Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: SAMANTHA J
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Great little hotel on a quiet street near the East Village that looks like a Parisian scene. The rooms are basic but comfortable, shared shower and toilets but a sink in each room. The staff were a bit hit and miss, one one really great and helpful and the other was rude and obnoxious, which is the only reason Im not giving this 5 stars. I would still recommend this hotel if you want something a bit different to the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable old-fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: marylandusacpl
Reviews.Content: It was nearly impossible to find a reasonable priced hotel room in NY easter week so we decided to give Hotel 17 a try, they had one room left. It is not a place that I would have ever thought about staying at, but after several good reviews on trip advisor I made a reservation. I stayed here with my daughter and her friend, both 15, and they loved the old fashioned feel of the hotel, especially the elevator from the minute we walked in the door. We paid $165 for a good sized corner room with two double beds, a desk, sink, plenty of towels and three windows. The only reason why I did not give the hotel an 'excellent' rating is because of the shared bath. We were lucky that it was directly across from our room, which was room 806 on the top floor. The bathroom was always clean and very convenient but I have become spoiled by the new modern private bathrooms. The hotel is located in the Gramercy area which is nice and quiet and it is on a very pretty tree lined street in a mostly residential area. We found many fantastic vintage clothing stores located within a short walk of the hotel & a great bagel shop around the corner. Greenwich Village, Union Square & Little Italy were within a reasonable walking distance. I would stay here again because it was quiet, clean and comfortable, a good price, and the front desk staff was friendly and efficient. Don't be scared away by the shared bath, it wasn't that bad.

Reviews.Title: “good basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: karenacheryl
Reviews.Content: stayed here a number of years ago - I was looking for a base not a hotel. Lots of American student use this hotel. Found it to be clean and tidy - only downside was that we did not have en-suit but there were plenty of washing facilities so no queue's. Easy to find and within easy reach of all sightseeing. Felt safe throughout my stay.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: mugu_travelling
Reviews.Content: we searched for the cheapest option with the best rating and this hotel had a good deal ( compared to other manhattan hotels.) it is at the 17th street , it has clean and cosy rooms. if you would catch a better deal closer to 33th or 42th street, access to subway would be easier. the closest subway to hotel 17 was at 14th street, 3 blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherPH
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and my sister from 26 December- 4 January and was thoroughly impressed with the hotel. As people have pointed out, the rooms are tiny, with little more room than the beds and wash-stand, but the lack of room wasn't really an issue. We had cable TV in the room, a sink/basin, a safe, and a dressing table, so didn't really need much more. The bathroom was directly across from our room, with another a few doors down, and we never encountered any problems with it (always clean, always one available, and if not then it's a short walk to the other corridor and their two bathrooms). The staff were very helpful, pointing us to a cheap dry cleaners down the road with one-day service, and the place itself was very safe (the location is extremely safe, so we never felt in any danger even when returning to the hotel at 5am on New Year's Day!). The main draw of the hotel is its EXCELLENT location, though. Located in the East Village, it is just a few blocks to Union Square, one of the main transportation hubs, and only a 30 or so minute stroll to Greenwich Village, West Village and SoHo. Staying here we got to experience what it's like to be a New Yorker, rather than just another Manhattan tourist. Staying in a place with this kind of a location is worth a crazy amount of money, and when you take the very reasonable price of Hotel 17 into account, it's a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: crawfishmedia
Reviews.Content: In a quieter section of the lower east side, Hotel 17 is a european style hotel with a victorian feel. The rooms kind of feel like small apartments, and are actually quite nice so long as you are not looking for luxury. Dark wood trimming everywhere gives it a bit of a home feel. The rooms have new sinks which is a nice touch to an history building. I recommend asking for a higher floor and/or a room not facing the street, it can get a bit noisy. I found rooms not facing the street are quiet. If you are concerned about shared bathrooms don't be, with 4 bathrooms(including shower) per floor, I was always able to get in. I found the bathrooms and rooms quite clean and the staff was quick to take care of towel refresh and cleaning bathrooms. If your visit to NYC is going to be spent mostly on the town, Hotel 17 will do just fine. Just a few blocks away you can get on the L to connect to uptown/downtown trains. If you want to save $ you can even take the L train to the A train to JFK Airtran, takes about an hour and only costs $7. Compared most Manhattan hotels, this one is an budget friendly option. A short walk and you can be at Union Square or St.Marks.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend 100%”
Reviews.Author: 138Tracey138
Reviews.Content: Great, Safe Location. Would Definately stay Again. Very Clean, Friendly & Helpful. Shared Bathrooms, but they were always clean & available. Just across the road from a great 24hr cafe. Very Affordable. Lovely good sized room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, budget-friendly”
Reviews.Author: longlegs042
Reviews.Content: My friends and I shared the triple room which had a queen bed and a twin. It was in a safe neighborhood, close to parks, shops and restaurants. Short walk to a metro stop. There were two shared bathrooms on each side on each floor so we had no problem with that. Overall a great stay that I'd recommend to anyone visiting NYC on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and affordable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NellGwyn
Reviews.Content: Since my husband was going to be in a nearby hospital for the week, I had some concerns about staying alone in an unfamiliar area. I chose Hotel 17 because we are on a tight budget. I was pleasantly surprised! Yes, the room was tiny, I did not have a sink and it got hot at times (I turned on the AC for a while), but for a secure place to stay it fit the bill. I'm not turned off by communal bathrooms, having traveled in Europe where they are much more common. These were immaculate; it seemed they were cleaned every few hours. The decor made it seem like a little bit of Europe in NYC and a step back in time. Fast check in and out, and if you have no safe they will gladly put your valuables in their own for no extra charge. No bedbugs and it was very quiet. Would not hesitate to stay again. As a woman alone in the Big City, I felt very safe and secure there. Try it, if only for the unique experience!

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here on EVERY trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Abby T
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly, the room and bathroom clean, and even with a shared bath I NEVER had to wait to use the bathroom. It was an easy walk to the Union Square metro which links to most major lines in the city, and the neighborhood was quaint with multiple cafes. I payed hostel rates for a private room--very nice for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MTraveler23
Reviews.Content: I scrolled down to look at the other reviews and I am completely perplexed at the negativity. I came back tonight from a 5 night stay at Hotel 17 with my partner, and have been gushing to everyone about it. We stayed on the 8th floor in a spotless corner room, overlooking the Empire State building. We paid $70 a night and with such a low price, I would have never expected such a view. The hotel is super clean, as are the rooms, and because I travel a lot, I have seen my fair share of hotels. The beds are large enough, and very comfortable. The bathrooms are in fact shared, but whenever I wanted to use it it was empty. I think the highlight of the hotel is its location. It is is 2 blocks from Union Square, and we walked everywhere, only cabbing once. My favourite part of staying at this location was that we got to enjoy the real, less touristy New York. My acquaintances stayed at the Sheraton at Times Square, and they complained that they didn't really get the NYC experience because they were constantly surrounded by fast food restaurants and chain stores. Yes, the internet is slow, but I wasn't expecting to use it while on vacation, and coffee shops with wifi are close by. The only downside I can think of is that our room was slightly cold. I slept in a sweater, so you might want to consider this when packing. Great deal, extremely clean, amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price ($70/night through Expedia)”
Reviews.Author: dangerousbusiness
Reviews.Content: I did not plan on spending much time in my room while visiting the city; therefore, was just hoping to find a convenient niche in the city that was safe, clean & cheap. I found Hotel 17 through an Expedia search. The room was only $70 per night with due reason ... was a tiny about 6' x 12' room with a twin bed in it. I should have called the hotel directly to be certain of what I was getting - my particular room did NOT have a sink in it. It merely had a vanity, TV stand with a tube TV (I unplugged and never used ... had my laptop which was better quality anyway). Therefore, I had to use the community bathroom for EVERYTHING (brush teeth, face, wash hands, etc). The community bathroom was right outside my room, and I never had to wait to use it (felt very private). So, this was not a huge issue for me ... but would have been nice to at least have a sink (like the picture implied I'd have). My room did not have a safe in it. This worried me but nothing went missing. The doormen were always pleasant & they even let me check out late on my last day (regular 12pm check-out; I checked out at 3pm at no extra charge ... they usually do charge though 1/2 a day). The only thing that did really annoy me about the place was that their WI-FI is HORRIBLE ... Very spotty connectivity. And I was not the only one with issues ... people were having to step into the stairwell to try and have consistent connectivity. It didn't matter the time of day & they were not having specific technical issues ... they just consistently have bad Wi-Fi signal in the building. When you're traveling and trying to check-in on flights and buy tickets online for events - this is very annoying. I have an iphone, so I was able to do a lot on it - but that does run up data charges ... The location is convenient for subway travel (2 avenues over from Union Square) and close to yum, healthy restaurants (highly recommend "One Lucky Duck" at Irving and 16th). Overall - for the price, it was great ... a safe, clean room in NYC close to Union Square. I would though call the hotel directly before booking to request a room with a sink (worth paying a tiny bit more to maybe have that one perk :)).

Reviews.Title: “Affordable sleeping quarters to wake up in in the city that never sleeps!”
Reviews.Author: asteri_in
Reviews.Content: If you are in NYC to explore and experience what it has to offer - you need not a better place to lay your head down at night. This was my first trip to NYC and though, admittedly, I was a tiny bit nervous about staying in the city alone and about an unwanted encounter with bed bugs, I felt safe in this neighbourhood and it gave me a flavour of what living in this city - bed bug free! - would be like. Hotel 17 is located about 3 short blocks east of Union Square, where the 14th Street-Union Square subway station is and numerous dining options are available. I made my reservation via their website and had requested a nonsmoking, single room with a sink, preferably on one of the higher floors. When I was checking in, the only room available with a sink was on the 1st floor, in a smoking section. I was quite hesitant about the smell of smoke but this ended up not being an issue for me at all (perhaps it was just luck). Being on the first floor had the advantage of reaching the room without the use of the elevator or stairs and the disadvantage of having a view of a wall of the adjacent building. The room I was in had a double bed, WiFi access, a TV, an alarm clock, a safety deposit box, a hairdryer, and a sink, as well as towels, soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. I was located across the hall from one of the communal bathrooms, which I thought was very clean for a shared facility, and I never experienced having to wait to use it. Overall, in my opinion, *Hotel 17 is excellent* as it is a charming, clean, safe, and inexpensive way for one to be a part of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “On your own nickle, this is a pretty decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pensfan58
Reviews.Content: Is it a 5 star hotel? Depends on how you view it. For the price I paid, in NYC, it definately is. My room cost $85 and had a double bed (my last time here I had a single and could touch both walls at once!). The staff was friendly and helpful upon check-in and my room was spotless. My only complaint was that it was too hot and I needed to turn on the A/C. Then again, its not supposed to be over 50 degrees in February, is it? I will say, that everythign was very clean and the place smells clean, if not overly fragrant. I could see some people cokmplianing about that, but after a minute or two, I didn't even think aobut it. Yes, there are no bathrooms within the rooms, shared baths in the hall. However, they too were spotless. I can't see anyone having issues with this place, unless they are used to staying at Fairmont Hotles or such. Having seen both sides, for both buisness and pleasure, for my needs, basically a place to sleep for a night instead of commuting home after a late dinner, it was perfect. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a chance .... very good value”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaTrekkers
Reviews.Content: My wife, sister in law and I recently spent one night here. We have travelled together a fair amount and appreciate a good lodging value when we see one. We arrived in the evening and were greeted courteously if not effusively. When we got to our rooms (two very small adjoining rooms, a double and single), we were disheartened. At first impression, it appeared dark and a tad tired. We went out for awhile and then to bed in the small but comfortable beds and slept well. In the morning, the hotel has a different aura. We noticed how very clean and intelligently utilitarian the room was (nice lighted clock, hair dryer, good shampoos), a little like the Yotel we have stayed at in Heathrow. The dark wood ambience in the evening had given a false impression of tiredness.The bathroom just across the narrow hall was immaculate and the shower excellent. The location of the hotel is very good (just off Irving Place, in Gramercy, not far from Union Square). The price ($121 per night all inclusive, or about 40 bucks a person) is excellent for a lodging this well located and fundamentally sound in expensive New York City (twenty five minute walk to theatre district, Trader Joe around four minute walk). Good restaurants nearby, including Brother Jimmy's BBQ and Irving Place Restaurant at no. 71; also good Chinese restaurant on corner nearby. It reminded us of good B & B/small hotel lodgings we sometimes get in London; not fancy, but nice comfortable safe havens in a large pricey city. The clientele appeared friendly and safe; a mix of young and savvy U.S. and foreign travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Third time's a charm!”
Reviews.Author: SammNYC
Reviews.Content: This has been my third visit to the Hotel 17. I really don't need more than what it has to offer,the staff are super friendly, and hotel is always clean and tidy. You really can't get better in NYC for these prices.. seriously they're undercharging for what they are offering. I always get the small single room, since I just check in , throw in my bags and go onto my business. I recommended this hotel to 2 friends of mine, and they each decided to go back when they came to the city... I only had 1 problem with the A/C in my room, for some reason it didnt turn on when I came back to my room at night, but I called the front desk and within 5 minutes a staff member came and it was just disconnected.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: aavalos
Reviews.Content: My first time with a shared room, and I can't complain. I think we shared with 4 or 5 other rooms (not sure how many were actually taken at the moment), and rarely walked into an occupied bathroom. Good location i you don't mind walking a couple blocks to the subway. The place seems alright or its price. We were satisfied with our choice of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: Keith S
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this hotel for the price - the staff were helpful, the location very handy and the room was a perfectly adequate size with all you'd need. The shared bathroom situation was a new one on me, but didn't cause any problems as they were always clean and tidy. Highly recommended, I've stayed in far worse yet far more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: jeff b
Reviews.Content: I brought my teenage daughters here for an overnight stay and was very pleased. The location is safe and practical. The biggest asset is the hotel staff who even held our luggage for us after our checkout so we could continue walking in the city without having to carry our stuff. I am accustomed to European-style hotels so shared bathrooms were not an issue. My girls had showers in the morning without having to wait and without getting creeped out by having to share. They said the showers were very clean. My only minor complaint was that the window air-conditioning unit allowed outside air to come in and made the room a bit chilly. I could have easily asked for an extra blanket which I hadn't realized until the next morning. I will definitely come back here and feel perfectly comfortable encouraging my wife to bring our daughters here for a girl weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pihtsus
Reviews.Content: Very good location near Union Square. Tiny but clean rooms, toilets/shower in the corridor which were usually free and clean. Good hotel if you want a central base for your midtown stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lower budget hotel, but for price and location, rates 5”
Reviews.Author: AlanAvalon
Reviews.Content: 4th year in a row here, always clean, friendly. Wifi throughout. Bathrooms are shared on corridors, rooms are New York sized, i.e. not huge, but on the edge of Union Square, and very nice. Also they store your baggage free on last day, reception always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and quiet for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: JaneCatLady
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay (4 nights) at Hotel 17 and will stay there again the next time I am in Manhattan. It's right near 3rd Ave and 17th St., just walk up 3rd to the subway and you can be anywhere in Manhattan very easily. The hotel is clean, quiet, and I enjoyed the semi-Edwardian decor and funky little old-fashioned elevator. The shared bathrooms were clean, no problems at all with that. There are restaurants, diners and bars within very close walking distance too. Room rates are very reasonable at Hotel 17, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place at a nice budget”
Reviews.Author: Justus P
Reviews.Content: We were visiting NYC for a couple days before a friend's wedding in NJ. This was a great place to stay in manhattan. Great clean room, they get the shared restrooms clean, and the price was right and the location awesome. No problems and would certainly consider going back there again if we get to visit NYC anytime soon!

Reviews.Title: “Charm, comfort, location, easy on the budget”
Reviews.Author: clarineta
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here between Dec 24 and 29th, two in a "triple", two in a "double" room. The triple had 2 beds, one a queen, the other a twin. Both had sinks. The double room had a double bed, so if you are two people used to a king or queen sized bed, you might find it small. But the beds were very comfortable, the rooms quiet (we were on the 8th floor in the B wing), with nice views. True, the wallpaper looks tired, the radiator knocks and pings a bit, the one elevator is tiny and slow, the lobby at bit dark, the rooms smallish - but this bothered us not one bit. The bathrooms are extremely clean and sharing them was no problem. Check in was prompt and friendly and the one issue we had with the TV was looked after right away. There's an ice machine on the 1st floor, but no restaurant, bar or even food machines. Plenty of stores and restaurants within a block though. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “impress your artsy bohemian significant other!”
Reviews.Author: aussienelson
Reviews.Content: Self employed artists don't have the budget to spend a lot of money for a hotel in Manhattan, so when I chose to stay here with my wife for our 20th Wedding Anniversary, I took a gamble that Hotel 17 was going to be the right combination of affordability, convenience, cleanliness - and still have a funky elegance that artists often respond favorably to. There are not too many places like that in New York, and that list just got cut down by 1 when the Hotel Chelsea recently closed it's doors to the public. Fortunately, there is still this smaller, lesser-known gem. Located in a beautiful and quiet neighborhood tucked in between Gramercy Park and Stuyvesant Park, I can only imagine how much it costs to live here. The area is a lot different from the funky, yet fun grime of Chelsea. Yet you are only a few blocks away from the East Village, and Union Square, which can get you anywhere else you want to go that is farther than you want to walk. Our room this time was a (very) small one, with a double bed. A sink, a flat panel TV, a small closet, and that was about it. There was barely enough room to fit the small table that the phone was on. Who uses a regular phone these days anyway? But everything was clean, and other than the clanging of the heating pipes in the middle of the night, it was fairly quiet. The bed was okay. Could have been a lot worse. I only mention these things for people who want details. As long as it's cheap, clean and safe is all I care about. The shared bathrooms were not a problem. They were always cleaned, but I never saw the cleaning people. If a bathroom was occupied, I was always able to find another one on that floor. If you are looking to save a lot of money, sacrifice a few optional conveniences in the process, and impress your artsy bohemian significant other with a whirlwind getaway in one of the classiest areas in New York City? You can do no better than Hotel 17. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel. Good value for New York. Only complaint would be that the heating doesn't turn off so it can get very warm. Fantastic location near a subway. The shared bathroom was always very clean,

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm_111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while in transit in NYC. The room was clean with a comfy bed, wardrobe, sink, phone and tv in room. The location near Greenwich Village and Union Square was great loved the character of the neighbourhood. While there was no fridge a basket and communal ice dispenser is provided. I had the unfortunate experience of being situated next to an incosiderate guest who decided to max out the volume of his TV at 3am in the morning! When I informed reception they called his room and the situation was quickly rectified. Whilst there is a shared bathroom, I found them to be very clean and personal with each bathroom consisting of only one shower/toilet combination. If your looking for a clean and comfortable room and don't want/need the additional add on's and luxuries then this place is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: Michele C
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews in T-A. It was a good choice and lived up to the reviews. It is a no frill older hotel, well maintained, quiet, very clean and in a good location. We had a triple room on the top floor and the bathroom was just across our room. We never had to wait to use it. So we do recommend it as a good choice for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, safe street”
Reviews.Author: stella_luna33
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely weekend at Hotel 17. I am always nervous about shared bathroom situations but these bathrooms were immaculate and there was a sink in our room, which was nice. The location was fantastic, very close to the subway and a short ride into Midtown. Hotel 17 is on a safe, residential side street, with many restaurants and a health food store/juice bar 1 block away. We would definitely stay there again and hope to do so soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect surprise!”
Reviews.Author: lisa t
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at a different hotel when visiting my friends in NYC but since the price of that hotel has tripled I searched for another option. I decided to try Hotel 17 and was definitely not dissapointed!We had a corner room on the 7th floor which was spacious and the two single beds were great even for me who has backproblems. Loved that you could open the windows and there was no streetnoise at all. I never had to wait for the shared bathrooms which were very clean. They could think of replacing the bathmats more often though. The staff are very friendly and helpfull plus the location is one of the best in the city, nice diners, restaurants and stores around and safe at night. All in all I will definitely stay here again when visiting the city, the hotel has everything i need, a nice bed, spacious room, great location and at a wonderfull price.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithoutCharli
Reviews.Content: We were unable to stay at our preferred hotel and so stayed at Hotel 17 instead. We went in well aware that we were paying significantly less than we would at other hotels. On the plus side, the location was fabulous, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the shared bathroom was very clean. But on the down side, our room was kind of depressing. It had peeling wall paper in several places, and there was a powerful smell in our room that was reminescent of strong soap. We figured it was probably carpet cleaner. It was very unpleasant and giving me a sore throat, but we were so tired we just opened the window and got extra blankets from the staff (who brought them up right away--like I said, very helpful!). I don't know if they would have moved us because we didn't ask, and the smell did not bother my partner as much as it bothered me, so this should be taken in perspective. It probably coloured my impression of the room and I didn't give them a chance to do anything about it. The towels are small and thin and I was a little uncertain about using the shared bathmat in the bathroom but there is no extra towel to use for that purpose, and no soap in the bathroom if you are just going to use the toilet; you have to bring your own with you and then back out again. These are little things and the hotel is certainly better than some we have stayed in. I'm not sure that I would stay there again but the hotel is safe, clean and really well situated and if you are not spending any time in your room except sleeping then it's a great deal for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money...enjoyed the experience”
Reviews.Author: IKESTER1960
Reviews.Content: A must for Kiwi travellers. Initially thought oh no wrong place, shared bathrooms, but fell in love with it. Friendly staff. Great price $95.00US + tax per night. 3 Blocks from Union Square Subway, central to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and great location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisLondon59
Reviews.Content: I learned to love this hotel for various reasons. The first time I stayed there I wasn't that impressed but on a very low budget. Now I think it has its very own charm and I love the Gramercy area, the restaurants there and that it feels very residential New York. Pro: Great price, great area, charming and clean. Contra: Shared bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, quiet, straightforward city-centre hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Caro1886
Reviews.Content: I really recommend this hotel, good price, quiet and calm. Very central for Manhatten. We walked and walked, but subways nearby for the wimps in the party... Really helpful staff, nice room, comfy bed, wash basin in room, loo and shower across the corridor. My only complaint were the entrance steps semed steep after a long day out! As well as all the usual sights, if you are interested in urban housing, don't miss the lovely Stuyvesant flats nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Idelle A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a course of 10 nights, and was very satisfied with the service provided. Staff is very friendly - especially James, and rooms are clean with working air-con. Although only communal bathrooms are available (2 on each level), they are kept clean. The hotel is conveniently located, a five minute walk from the Union Square underground but if you like walking then the central location of the hotel makes Times Square an easy 30 minute walk up Broadway or if your looking to go to Greenwich Village or SoHo the same applies. Very safe location with cool vintage style feel. Highly recommended for those who are looking for budget accommodation with excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Cradioco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of sept. For a long girls weekend. We had a great time here in manhattan. Did loads of sight seeing. Hotel is in a good location. We walked from central park. Back to our hotel it's so easy to get about. Bathroom are in the corridor but was always clean and vacant. Rooms were small but have everything you need. Id stay here again and would recommend .to anyone that is looking for a good budget hotel. I've got to mention James on reception. Hes a great guy and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “COMMUNAL BATHROOMS! They do not say this on website!”
Reviews.Author: KristenLeslie
Reviews.Content: Just know before booking that there are not bathrooms in the rooms! They are hall toilets and showers, which are very small. They were however pretty clean. We were not aware of this until arriving. I didn't even know hotels with hall bathrooms existed. They do not say this on the website. The site also says Madonna stayed there, which after staying myself, think is highly unlikely. Despite the fact that I requested a room with two beds when booking and called the day before to ensure it, they messed up and gave us a room with one bed. They were very rude and unappologetic about it as well. The rooms are very small. The heat did not work for the first night we stayed, but was fixed after complaint. The location is amazing however. As long as you dont care about having a nice room, your own toilet or shower, or kind staff, your stay will be fine...

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure in Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: Minmor
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. Great for a little weekend stay. Had to get use to the communal bathrooms, but they were kept clean at all times. Definitely a place I'll revisit!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: mattb1983_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 17 for 5 nights, last week. Was impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel from the bedrooms to the bathrooms, to the lobby area. A characterful hotel to stay in - brilliant location. Have 3 Ave metro stop a five min walk away, but for better connections Union Square tube stop is slightly further (about 10 mins) away, but a pleasant walk. Feels like a friendly neighbourhood too. Some good bars and restaurants nearby. Lobby staff were generally friendly. Was staying in room 102 - first floor, facing onto the road. Bit loud at times (ambulances etc), but not much you can do about that. Radiator was a rather loud, clunking thing, but heated the room up perfectly. Spoke to reception about it, who offered us the options of switching it off or moving rooms, but as it was pretty cold and we had good light (a rarity in the hotel as its deeper than it is wide, so most rooms have no windows) we opted with neither. Room wasn't massive (but only slept there, was out and about the rest of the time), but had a sink, TV, phone and safety deposit box (which was free to use). One word of warning: organised a wake-up call for our early morning departure with the receptionist the evening before - thankfully set a back-up alarm of our own, as the wake up call never came! Overall we were happy with what we'd paid - certainly felt like we'd got a bit of a bargain given what you could pay elsewhere. Can't argue with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Selkiechick
Reviews.Content: This is one of the places I check first when i make day trips to NYC. It's inexpensive (for NYC) clean, and in a good location. It's a little "no-frills" but that is just fine by me, and it is in an interesting older building, which feels very early 20th century.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price, for a hotel in the middle of New York!”
Reviews.Author: Laurain k
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 is a small hotel in the middle of all the highlights in New York. In a save neighborhood. The hotel was one of the cheapest hotels in New York to find on the internet for three nights. The price shouldn't be more though. The rooms are very small. There's is a bed, a small TV, and a place to brush your teeth and a closet. Everything you need! The rooms and the shared bathroom are very clean. We had a perfect stay in Hotel 17. And we love the big apple!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, great location, shared bathrooms spotless.”
Reviews.Author: footprints_76
Reviews.Content: We researched for HOURS trying to find cheap central accommodation. We had to conclude that it doesn't really exist in Manhattan. However Hotel 17 must be the closest thing to it. A great location on a leafy street, helpful staff, a decent room and a clean bathroom. All for $150 per night. I wouldn't stay if it was a special occasion as I'd pay the extra and stay somewhere with a great view, but if budget is tight and you just need somewhere that feels like home to lay your head then I'd choose Hotel 17. I'm sure I'll stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: tassosGR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 17 on October for a week. Got a level floor single room which was rather small, with a twin bed and had a sink. The room was facing a wall on the back, which means it was very quiet all the time. There were 2 bathrooms on the side my room was (109) for 11 rooms and the one had a sink (for the rooms that don't have one). They were very clean and I never had to wait, actually only a couple of times I saw somebody going there. The stuff was not the frendliest I ever met but they were ok, no complain about that. The hotel seemed to be busy, cause there were always people at the reception area when I would pass from there. No breakfast, but around the corner are a couple of 24h places where you can have full breakfast at reasonable price. The neighborhood is great, I loved it. Many bars, restaurants, mini markets and daily life shops in the area, where you mostly see locals and you fell like that. If you like a neighborhood that is not fancy, not trendy, neither shaddy or dangerous, but residential and still lively, where you mostly meet locals, you will love this neighborhood! Union Square, where is the closest subway station, is just 3-4 blocks away and Chelsea is a short walk. If you like walking, you can walk all over Manhattan from this area, I walked all the way down to the Financial district and also up to the Central Park, both are maybe less than an hour, perfect! What I didn't like so much, was that because there is no breakfast room or a bar or a lobby, you don't really have any interaction with the rest of the people staying there. If you like meeting people where you stay, that's not really the case here. Also the wi-fi was extremely slow, when it was there. Overall, it's a great place if you're looking for a place just to rest and sleep, at a great price for Manhattan, in a nice neighborhood, from where you can easily explore the rest of the island. I would go back, no question about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birgitte K
Reviews.Content: Loved Hotel 17! Very charming, old New York feel. The first thing that hits you is how clean it smells. The staff are great, and the rooms are cozy. Shared bathrooms, but there are plenty and they are always free and very clean. I have stayed here three times, and always go back here. Cheap and in the middle of Gramercy Park!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful, you don't go to NY to spend all say in your room!”
Reviews.Author: TreenJohnston
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here twice I'd recommend it. It central and great for sight seeing. Friendly staff, shared bathrooms not a problem, I didn't have to wait and they were always clean. I'd definitely stay here again. If you want a romantic get away I'd look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “As Expected at this Price”
Reviews.Author: Paul7878
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as advertised. The shared bathrooms were generally clean (depending on the previous user). There are four bathrooms on my floor, but only two of them had sinks. In response to another reviewer, I didn't have a lot of towels. In fact, I had a face cloth, hand towel, and a body towel that is large only by European standards. It wasn't large by American standards. On my first night, I inquired about how to control the heat in my room because it was too hot. In fact, the heat cannot be controlled on a per room basis. Instead, the heat is centrally controlled and is on a fixed schedule. The radiator in my room turned off at 11:30pm and turned on at about 6:30am. In between, I used the air conditioner to cool the room. On the brighter side, the heat allowed me to do laundry and everything dried easily. The staff was nice and polite. Noise from the bathrooms are noticeable. Wi-fi wasn't very reliable. I relied on my cell phone service instead.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: cadiza
Reviews.Content: So if you are looking for the Ritz, this is not for you. If you are looking for clean, unique, safe and cheap accommodation- this is it. The building is old but well maintained and charming, there is great woodwork everywhere. There rooms are basic- clean, small, and functional. You share baths, but i never had to wait for the bathroom. Staff is very nice. Front desk is polite, unpretentious, friendly, and efficient. I asked a maintenance man if I could look at the view from the room he was working on, and he did me one better and took me to the roof and cheerfully pointed out all sorts of NY landmarks. Also a note on bedbugs- I notice there are some older reviews on this site complaining of bedbugs- a problem that was epidemic in NYC hotels. Based on my expierence, Hotel 17 has conquered this problem- i saw not trace. I really enjoyed my stay and will come back

Reviews.Title: “best budget hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: mantaray24
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom stayed at this property on October 5 for 3 nights. We expected very little considering the amazing price for a New York hotel. We walked in and i almost couldn't breathe i was so excited. It looked like something out an old school movie with the decor and tiny pull-shut elevator. The front desk guy was very accomodating, giving us a 2 bed room when we had only booked for one. The halls are twisty and very narrow, but you wont have trouble getting huge bags through. the whole hotel is done in this interesting dark brown varnish look that really makes you feel like you're in the middle of a different time. The rooms were small but not clastrophobic at all. it is the perfect jumping off place for New York as it is walking distance to everything but on a quiet street so there's no outside noise to bother you. The only bad thing was having to share a bathroom. There was frequently someone in there and morning shower people will probably want to switch to night. There was a sink and plenty of towels in our room though so it worked out fine. The Gramercy Cafe half a black up is awesome for any meal as the hotel doesn't have a restaurant. the Cafe serves the biggest salads I've ever seen. I am a travel agent and I will be recommnding this hotel to all my clients travlling to New York and trying to stay within budget.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Acceptable/a Real Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Traveler561732
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that was originally designed for working class people who lived there permanently. You have to share a bathroom. Plus the decor is extremely dark and gloomy. Otherwise it is a perfectly OK place to stay if you can stand a small room. Everything was very clean and the housekeeping was excellent. Seldom a wait for the elevator and no waits for the several, very tidy bathrooms. It's on a quiet, tree lined street near Union Square. I lived in NYC for twenty years and never head any mention of this hotel. It is probably the best bargain in Manhattan. I paid a low rate, lower than other hotels in Queens and New Jersey. This is an especially good choice for young people who can ignore the depressing decor. Never found any place cheaper in NYC and certainly not with this level of cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary S
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel 17. It was half of the price of the hotel we usually stay. It is also half the size, but who goes to Greenwich village to stay in your room. Hallway shared bathrooms were close, clean and available. Interesting attraction and eattery's near by. We plan to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, for what you pay......”
Reviews.Author: pensfan58
Reviews.Content: First off, I've stayed at many 4 star hotels, and this isn't one of them. However, when you're sending your own nickle and its not on the corporate charge, this wasn't half bad. If you are used to spacious room and fancy decor, private baths, etc, this isn't your place. But if you are looking for a clean, comfortable place to sleep, you can't beat this place. Yes, I could touch both walls of my room, at the same time, but who cares,....all I wanted was a clean comfy bed, and I got that. The shared bath was no problem either. My guess is that there were 6 or 7 rroms along my corridor on the first floor and two baths. Both times I needed to use it, there wasn't a line. And it was clean. So, if you want a doorman, a mini-bar, robe and slippers, and a view of Central Park, this isn't the place. But if you are attneding an event in the city, don't want to travel home that night and need to be back in the office first thing in the morning, this place does it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: jahanavi
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure how we'd like sharing a bathroom, but they really do keep the whole place very clean. I loved the old woodwork too, and even the narrow hallways. We had a double room, #704, and had plenty of space, even to do yoga. At first we asked for a room at the back for quiet, but it was much smaller than the #04 number rooms. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nano sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Adamspdx85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a double bed w/shared bath. Room was tiny, 5x10 tops & you could hardly move with two pieces of furniture. Staff was average. Hotel was very clean, very unique old decor. Excellent spot near union station & young happening area of 2nd ave down to 9th. Rooms on streets side are noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca H
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying in this hotel after reading the reviews but I did not have 1 single problem with it. Yes the rooms are small & the halls are thin & there are shared bathrooms etc, but the bathrooms were always spotless. Plus your in NYC. Your not going to be spending a great amount of time in your room......if you are then your in the wrong place! Lovely little hotel for the price you pay

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jackieszabo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. The rooms are small but when visiting a city like New York you normally don't plan to spend too much time in the hotel. Shared bathrooms wasn't a problem either - always clean & usually available. Great location for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: Several years ago, there was a rock n roll photo shoot at this hotel, and suddenly everyone thought it was the cool place to be. It had a great low price, and while the rooms were tiny and not very impressive (with a shared bathroom in the hallway) there was something cool about being there....but that hype has faded, and we're seeing it now for what it is-- a cheap hotel with small rooms and a shared bathroom in the hall. There's an old-school style elevator and the hallways are thin thin thin. A few of the rooms in the front look out at the street, with large brownstone-style windows, and you do get a feeling that you're right there, in NY, and part of it, in an exciting way. The wallpaper in the rooms is funky-- either striped or old-fashioned patterned, and the beds are small (some just single beds) and old and with charming but crappy little blankets. Sink in the room. The prices have gone up, but are still relatively low. The lobby is no more than a vestibule, and the vibe of "we have to be careful of who we let come in the front door" is palpable. The rooms near the bathroom are to be avoided-- the hallway area near the bathrooms do reek of urine and you do hear people coming and going all night and doing what people tend to do in bathrooms. Many of the rooms are very dark and dingy and the windows look DIRECTLY into a brick wall and a tiny air shaft. Most of it is threadbare. Still, a lot of people are charmed by all of this.

Reviews.Title: “nyc on a shoestring”
Reviews.Author: MargieNY
Reviews.Content: great location. rooms are indeed small, but why would you stay in your room when you have the whole city to explore? shared baths are kept immaculately clean. great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: DCSojourner
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice and would stay again. This place is nothing fancy. It is just a basic, clean, cheap hotel. The decor is so tacky that some may consider it hip. At any rate, two friends and I got a room there for only $120 a night. The bed was comfortable, and everything was clean. That's all you need in NYC. Who stays in their room anyway? The best thing about the hotel is its location in Gramercy Park. From there, its an easy walk to Union Square, the East Village, and all the bars and restaurants on Saint Marks and Second Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, clean, safe, good location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: steveinuae
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I spent 4 nights at Hotel 17 in mid-July. Not wanting to spend a fortune, we compared Hotel 17 with other "budget" hotels in Manhattan after reading numerous reviews. We were not disappointed. Though the rooms are small (in general, they are in NY budget hotels), we got the 3-person room and were pleasantly surprised by the space we had. No food, coffee, etc. on site but there are numerous possibilities close by. AC worked well, and the place was clean enough for my wife (very clean). Shared bathroom was not a problem. We checked thoroughly for bedbugs and found no signs. Pleasant and helpful concierge downstairs. The small elevator makes for cozy conversations. All in all, if you're going to NYC to see stuff, not to hang out in a hotel, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: reino43
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came into the city for a wedding and needed a cheap place to get ready and then sleep. We had never done a "shared bath" situation but it was fine - the rooms have a sink in them so at least you can brush your teeth there. Clean hotel and rooms as long as you're just looking to sleep over.

Reviews.Title: “If you have can pay $50 more, Do it!!”
Reviews.Author: arctickoala
Reviews.Content: I always book the cheapest flight I can find and cheapest hotel in the best location I can find. Last year after a trip with China Air I decided that if I can afford it I am paying for a better airline when I travel next. Hotel 17 is convinced me that I should do that for my hotels as well. Look! there is nothing fundamentally wrong with this place. It is one of the cheapest priced for its cathegory, it is definatly clean, and in a good location. But, it is not in excellent location. the real place to stay south west of Unnion square ( closer to Washington square park as possible) or slightly north in the meatpacking district. So the location is good but not excellent as it is claimed. Rooms are so small that I can not fully open my luggage. I am sure not all of the rooms are like this but in my room there is no place to even stand. I had to wear my socks in the hall way sitting on the floor once since my travel partner occuppied the only avaliable standing room while he was dressing up. I am a very heavy sleeper, I have never thought that I will be complaining about noise in any place ( I slept 15 hours on the way to NY from sydney in the plane- NOthing wakes me up) but apparently hotel staff vacuuming the hallways 6:15 am on a Sunday would wake me up. I thought it was a bit much. Rooms are awfully hot and there is AC but it is so noisy that you can not leave it on and sleep. Not just yours every other room also have a noisy AC that every time your neighbours turn theirs on you wake up as well. I managed to get max 4 hours of sleep each night. So if you have to stay here stay. But if you can afford 50 more dollars a night i am sure you can find something a bit better where you can enjoy the place you are staying a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Every budget traveller's first choice”
Reviews.Author: salsa74be
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 is a great budget place to stay in, for those who do not need more than a comfy bed and a clean bathroom. Rooms are small but very decent. Shared bathrooms are cleaned several times a day. Hotel is very quiet, so excellent sleep quality. Staff is polite and helpfull. Hotel is located in a quiet part of town, with a very conveniently connected subway station 5-10 minutes of walking away. Only disadvantage is that some rooms don't have a sink, so that even for those small washes you have to use the shared bathrooms. In conclusion this hotel should be every budget traveller's first choice in an otherwise overpriced city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic price for great location”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend for 6 nights in August / September 2011. Great location - few blocks from Union Square and we were able to walk to many places we wanted to get to. Quiet, and leafy street (both relative terms given its New York!) in a nice neighbourhood. Shared bathrooms were fine, clean, simple, good shower and didn't have to queue once during the stay - could always find another one if full. Twin room we stayed in was, I thought, a good size given my expectation that in NYC space would be tight, and given the price. No breakfast but the Sunburst cafe a short walk away was very reasonable. Good service - helped when needed extra towels, booking an airport cab and recommending breakfast place. You could hear other people in the corridor at night but then as I always sleep with earplugs it didn't bother me! Nice comfy (single) beds. Got hot in the evenings but then it's a warm climate - chose to have the aircon off during the night. Wifi was a bit hit and miss, didn't seem to work or was very slow quite a bit of the time, so that was one downer. Would definitely go again and recommend to anyone looking for reasonably priced, well placed accommodation for exploring Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “Stressful check-in experience....”
Reviews.Author: Ben G
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Hotel 17. At the reception desk, James was neither helpful nor forthcoming with information. The overall impression was that James was not particularly eager to extend himself or to welcome a weary traveller. New York can be a stressful place to visit -- At Hotel 17 expect the bare minimum from this individual in terms of genuine interest in making your stay in New York easier. Hotel 17 deserves better representation at its front desk. Other employees at the Hotel, including management, were much more helpful once you are able to get past this desk clerk.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting cute and quaint”
Reviews.Author: Brent788
Reviews.Content: This place was a little offbeat but very cool and for NYC, an amazing price. It's a pretty small vintage looking hotel on a quiet residential street with hardly any amenties about 5 minutes walk from Union Square(one of the biggest subway stations in NYC). i came to NYC first of August 2011 on the trip of a lifetime and stayed at this place 3 nights and was quite impressed. For $115 a night(with tax) a single room is tiny(very tiny...), but includes a nice bed, a sink, a chair, a window, and wifi that was spotty. The bathrooms were shared, but the floors were small and only 3-4 rooms shared a bathroom so they were hardly ever busy and always spotless clean, cleaner than some private hotel baths I've seen. You don't come to NYC to stay in a hotel room anyway, and as a single guy without much luggage or maintenance needed, this place was excellent and when I return to NYC(and plan to soon... it's an amazing place), I will look at this place before anywhere else. Most hotels on the island of Manhattan will cost 2-3 times a night what this cost. My only complaints would be the erratic wifi(one night it worked good, the next it was trash) and lack of even a vending machine, but it is a short walk from a lovely 24/7 cafe that was good and reasonably priced. If you're not overly picky and are just going to NYC to enjoy the city and not worried about the hotel room, this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with all you need!”
Reviews.Author: awalnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location on a quiet and safe feeling street. Less than five minutes walk to Union Square where there are loads of shops, Starbucks (with free wifi) etc and many the 4,5,6, N, Q, R and L Subway lines. Do your self a favour and stay here instead of Time Square and you will see the real New York, not the disneyland version. It's easy to walk to a lot of great areas like the East Village, Chealsea etc. Seriously perfect location. The room was quite small, we bumped in to each other a bit when getting dressed, but who cares. If you are spending a lot of time in your room then why are you in NYC?! If you are low maintenance type people then you will be 100% satisfied with this place. Sharing bathrooms is not really an inconvenience because there are 4 bathrooms on each floor, only once in a 7 night stay did I have to wait. Well worth the money you save. All double rooms also have a sink and a big mirror so you can clean your teeth etc in your room. There was an extraordinary heat wave (40+ degrees) when we were there and the aircon did a perfect job at keeping us fridge cool at night. I can also highly recommend the Gramercy Cafe on the corner of 17th and 3rd ave. A great 24 hour diner with a very wide range of food. The staff are a bit snooty but ultimately helpful. They called a car to JFK for us when we were leaving which was $55. The only negative that I have is that the wifi was very patchy in our room and often didn't work at all. It may work better in other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, clean and good location!”
Reviews.Author: betty_travelsUK
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with the hotel and if you want somewhere a bit cheaper than most places in New York but that does not compormise on cleanliness and comfort this is the place for you. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff on the front desk very helpful and it's staffed 24 hours a day. They had a good system to let people leave bags on the day of check out if you were staying after the check out deadline, they were also happy to arrange a shuttle/car to the airport if needed. Even though the bathrooms our shared we never had to wait for them, there were 2 on our floor (that I know of) and they were remarkably clean. The room had everything you needed with a safe, sink, comfy bed and air conditioning (which was a little noisy but there's not much you can do about that!)! the location was brilliant, a five minute walk from Union Square and therefore Park Avenue and Broadway. Lots of shops, restaurants and other amenities close by particualrly on 3rd avenue. I never felt unsafe in the area even when walking back at 2am. Union Sqaure subway connects you to other parts of the city quickly and easily, although we chose to walk most places and none of the go-to tourist sites were so far that you couldn't walk (if you're happy to walk a few miles).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, classic hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: indigo07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal if you're looking for reasonably priced accommodations in the heart of NYC. I loved the classic, old NY, architectural details in the lobby and rooms -- dark wood paneling, original cage style elevator, radiators in the rooms. I personally didn't mind having a shared bathroom down the hall; I never had to wait for it and it was always clean. There are several restaurants, coffee shops and stores in the area, and it's not too far (a long walk or a short cab ride) from the Empire State building, Rockefeller Center and other tourist attractions. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good if it's what you're looking for, but avoid the 3rd floor!!!”
Reviews.Author: LC12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel 17 four times in the last few years, and I plan to most likely continue staying there because of its price, location, and generally friendly staff. Plus, I don't mind sharing a bathroom and when I head to NYC the room's really just for sleeping and getting ready for the next day. However, I just got back from a two night stay there and do have a few notable gripes: 1. Avoid a room on the third floor at all costs. The entire floor reeks of urine. The smell permeates the carpet and walls so much that when we woke up yesterday morning I felt as if I had slept in a dirty litterbox. I actually almost threw up. Now, you're probably wondering how I possibly fell asleep in the first place? Well, my boyfriend and I figured out that the cleaners must use some heavy duty deoderizer that masked the scent in our room for a while. The hallways smelled from the moment we arrived. Thankfully the morning person very kindly changed our room for the second night to the 7th floor and it was just fine with no smell just like all the other times I've stayed. The desk guy admitted that there has been a problem with a long term guest creating the 3rd floor urine smell...(I'm assuming he pees everywhere??) 2. Avoid the overnight desk guy. When my incredibly polite boyfriend asked if it was possible to have our room changed, the overnight desk man responsed with "F*** You, your majesty!" Really. My bf thought it was a joke, so he laughed, and the guy reasonded, "No really, F*** You!". My boyfriend then stupidly asked if this guy could recommend somewhere nearby for drinks and the guy (who is about our age, in his 30's) said, "Why the f*** would I know? F*** you!" and started slamming things. My boyfriend looked around to see if he was being filmed for punked or something. Absolutely insane. All the other desk people were helpful and did not swear. This dude is clearly in the wrong line of work. As I said, though, despite these 2 horrific experiences over the last 2 days, we may just go back to hotel 17 next time as long as we don't hit the lottery (or stay on floor 3, or ask for any help at night)!

Reviews.Title: “I never stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Power_E
Reviews.Content: I've visited NYC from the UK four times and I've only ever stayed at Hotel 17 or the sister hotel 31. It's such good value for money, and I love the Gramercy park location of Hotel 17. Anyone who has wasted money on overpriced hotels down in the noisy touristy Times Sq area will wish they'd known about Hotel 17. It's ideal for those who don't require extra frills from a hotel, they just want clean and good value for money, with a nice room and a comfortable bed. Sharing bathrooms is never a problem- they're always unfailingly clean, you'd never know you were sharing them. Nearby is Union Square with great shopping, farmers markets, and the subway which is ten minutes to Central Park area. I also recommend Gramercy Park Cafe just nearby where you'll get the best eggs, and Bar Jamon for spanish tapas. It's restaurant next door is also excellent but more pricey as its Michelin starred! Hotel 17 is perfect for those who would prefer a quieter more surburban neighbourhood, which is nonetheless only minutes from the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel. Been to NYC 5 times & wouldn't stay anywhere else now.”
Reviews.Author: CHAND13R
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, affordable with a perfect location for people wanting to experience a bit more real NYC culture rather than the tourist bustle of Times Square. The hotel itself feels old & its decor outdated but that's what's charming about it! It feels deliberate. I have stayed in 5 star hotels in NYC before but genuinely wouldn't swap this hotel for them. I feel at home here. I feel like I'm living amongst proper New Yorkers. The surrounding streets look residential yet it's just a quick walk from Union Square and perfect for exploring Lower Manhattan on the East (or, if you like walking) the West side. This gives you access to great bars, restaurants, shops and culture in Gramercy, East Village, Little Italy, Chinatown, soHo, Chelsea, Tribeca, Financial District and even Brooklyn. I would recommend it for people who have been to NYC before and stayed around Times Square or Midtown and now want something a bit more real. Good luck and hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: BASWIMMER
Reviews.Content: The room is of decent size and clean, and has all the basic amenities, including an alarm clock, a blow dryer, and a safe. The hotel also provides wake up call service. The shared bathrooms are clean and there was no wait time to use the facilities during my stay. The hotel is located in a reasonably quiet and nice neighborhood. For the money, it is very good value in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel at a good location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: hasanerdal
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and chose this hotel for my new york visit because of its good price. The reviews were right, this hotel is ideal for low budget travelers, it is at a good location, it is clean and the staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Marc0506
Reviews.Content: Against my initial fear this hotel is very good although you've shared bathrooms. The bathrooms have been always clean they must have cleaned it min. twice per day. We had never to wait to enter the bathroom. Also the room was large enough and clean. Walkway to the next Subway is also not very long 5 min. approx.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap comes at a price”
Reviews.Author: fatcontroller1999
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find reasonable accommodation at a decent price in manhattan. This hotel is one of the best value for the location but don't come expecting much. Rooms are ok sized for NYC, get one with a sink ( bathrooms are shared), and try to remember that your room will only be cleaned if you put the tag on the outside of your door. Beds are ok but not too comfortable, front desk is overworked and understaffed, but all in all you will be hard pressed to find anywhere much better at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent. We were here for a week and got a great room!”
Reviews.Author: nancyblackett9
Reviews.Content: We have almost nothing but good things to say about this wonderful little European style hotel, except for the air-conditioning being noisy-- so we switched it to fan only and it kept the room quiet enough and cool enough for sleeping. Our room was clean as a whistle and a comfortable size--on the street side--ask for an 01 or 02. With a sink--ask for a sink. The bathrooms were very clean all the time and nearly always available. The room was cleaned daily--hang out the sign--and the staff were most helpful. Close to everything, walk to Union Square, grocery stores, great neighbourhood restaurants, shopping, and the bus and subway just a block away. You can't do better than this in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations and I'd be back”
Reviews.Author: Leticia_Brasil
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to its price and previous reviews here in TripAdvisor. I stayed there with my mom for 6 days and I have to say that it's a clean hotel, much more than I expected for a shared bathroom (they are cleaned many times during the day). I could find bathrooms available whenever I needed. Bed linens were very very clean. The hotel is 3 blocks from the Union Square and Station, where you can take all yellow and green subway lines. Free Wi-Fi avalilable! :D

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel Option”
Reviews.Author: davdaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 17 with a friend for five nights in April. We were impressed by the cleanliness, convenience, and relative value of the property. Check in and check out was easy. Front desk staff were efficient but not the sort with whom one would chat about the weather. The single elevator was reasonably fast and efficient. Hallways were narrow but clean. We stayed in a non-smoking room on the fifth floor, but we were surprised to encounter a distinctive pot smell in front of the room closest to the elevator. (The smell was there all six days.) Our room had one double bed, one twin bed, a sink, nightstand, and small closet. The room was reasonably spacious, but it would have been uncomfortable for our five-night stay had we not spent most of our time outside. There was a large window with an a/c unit, but we didn't use it because the temperature was comfortable during our stay. Our room did not have any bed bugs. Sound insulation between our room and the hallway was minimal, but luckily fellow hotel guests were quiet. Unlike other old hotels I have stayed at over the years, the shared bathrooms at Hotel 17 were clean and well-kept. Our room was across from two shared baths, and we had no trouble accessing them during our stay. Water pressure was good in one of the tubs and so-so in the other. Hotel 17 is superbly located on a mostly residential street just a few blocks from Union Square. The 7 train stops nearby at 3rd Avenue, and multiple other subway lines are accessible at Union Square. I was very happy with the central location, especially since we split time between Brooklyn and Manhattan, and was thrilled to avoid the touristy chaos of Times Square. Overall, I recommend Hotel 17 if you are searching for good, affordable accommodations in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but I'd stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Helen_of_Oz
Reviews.Content: I was checked in about 10pm by a rather tired and grumpy man behind the desk who I'd obviously inconvenienced. I was so excited about being in New York to let it bother me too much though. This small hotel has loads of character starting with the walk to my room down a narrow, dimly lit hallway with patterned carpet and wallpapered walls. The sort of hotel you'd expect to find Philip Marlowe residing at in the 1940s. My single room was the smallest hotel room I'd ever been in. My room contained a single bed (too soft), a sink, an old tv that sat on a retro dressing table. I remembered I'd requested a smoking room when I spotted an ashtray on the dressing table. There was no fridge but there was an ice machine in the hall so at least I could grab some cubes for my drinks. My suitcase could fit in the room if I wedged it tightly up against the wall. . A shared bathroom across the hall and was always in immaculate condition and not once did I have to wait to take a shower. There's no dining facilities at the hotel but plenty of places close-by to grab a bite. Location of this hotel was great for me, near Union Square station and away from the congested Times Square. I'd stay at Hotel 17again because - 1) the location and 2) I can't afford anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure your room has a sink!”
Reviews.Author: MyCatsNameIsBernie
Reviews.Content: I would have liked to rate this hotel 3 1/2 stars, but I rounded up to 4 because of its location, cleanliness, price, and the friendly, helpful staff at the front desk. I can see why it gets such good reviews on TA. I visited NY for 3 days during a very busy period, and I was looking for a room with a private bath with decent reviews for under $200. I couldn't find one, not even with Hotwire or Priceline. So I reluctantly chose Hotel 17 with a shared bath. I booked a single room through Expedia, whose description said the room would have a sink. I've stayed in B&B's and European hotels with shared baths before, and I can tolerate it if I have my own sink. I checked into the room, and found it larger than I expected, very clean, with a comfortable bed. It appeared to be recently renovated. It was only after I was undressed and unpacked that I noticed there was no sink in the room. There were 4 shared baths for the 16 rooms on my floor, but only 2 of the baths had sinks. At that point I was too tired to complain, so I went to bed. The next morning I requested to be moved to a room with a sink. I packed my bags and left for the day, and when I returned, I had been moved. I was very happy for the remainder of my stay. I never saw more than 2 of the 4 baths in use at once, and I always found the baths clean. They must be serviced several times per day. The hotel is on a quiet residential street, but very close to shopping, restaurants, and subway. My one complaint is the air conditioning. In both rooms I stayed in, there was a window-mounted AC right next to the head of the bed. It was very effective, but the noise might be an issue for you being so close to your head. I got used to the noise. If you are willing to put up with the shared bath, and want a budget priced room, I would highly recommend Hotel 17. Just make sure you confirm your room has a sink!

Reviews.Title: “Value in a great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling4Tom
Reviews.Content: 3 blocks to Union Square subways, plenty of nightlife to choose from. Get's a 4 star because room is small but it is cheap and clean. Bed is comfortable enough, room safe a plus, shared bathroom was almost always clean and available. Stayed 5 nights and never had a bad experience the whole stay; staff was fairly friendly...if you are looking for help they are there, just don't expect them to fawn over you, real New Yorkers don't fawn.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for Manhattan, but expect one star”
Reviews.Author: RSW82
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a really good location. Easy walk to flatiron, empire state, lots of bars and restaurants and subway for everything else. The room was adequate. Bed was OK, clearly not new, but fine. Room was a god size and shared bathrooms were clean 99% of the time and only had to wait to shower once. We didn't have bed bugs which I was expecting as a give in so that was a good thing! T.he room was really hot and stuffy. We had to turn the fan on which was painfully loud, but i think this is just the nature of the age of the building. We were delayed in our arrival with snow storms and trying to change our booking was a nightmare! we booked through Hotels.com and had called and emailed them, called the hotel direct and then stayed on the phone while hotels.com called to change the booking and they still hadn't updated it/didn't get it when we arrived three days later, so not a great start. Service never wowed us. If you are looking for accommodation on Manhattan on a budget from what we could find it was the best you could get. If you are looking for a more comfortable US trip go to San Diego. When we were delayed in LA with the snow we rented a car and went there and it was really god value for money. For the same price we stayed at Hotel Del Coronado which was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Clean. Relatively inexpensive for NYC. Good night's rest”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaJack
Reviews.Content: It isn't fancy, but it is heaps better than a hostel. Clean place and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a budget”
Reviews.Author: krbsmile
Reviews.Content: When I go to NY I am never in my room. I am all about location, clean and comfy sleep time. I want to spend my money on shopping, shows, food and cabs when needed. This place is awesome in all the above. I was very scared about a shared bathroom, but I never ran in to a problem. Everything was clean, quiet and I will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: tandylands
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor is a must when sourcing hotels in unfamiliar cities, and this is how we stumbled across HOTEL 17. Located on east 17th street, it provides the perfect base for getting about NYC. The hotel itself is quite basic, with shared bathrooms and modest decor in the rooms. The bathrooms are always impeccably clean and I never had to wait considering the hotel is usually at maximum occupancy. The bedrooms are clean and tidy and when visiting NYC the idea is not to spend all your time in the hotel. The only downside to the bedrooms was the blankets provided on each bed were less than comfortable and were more like hospital bandage material than a cosy regular blanket. The location is definitely the key to the booking of this hotel.....all the main shopping streets are within walking distance and all the main attractions in NYC are a short cab fare away.....would recommend and definitely stay again when I return to NYC......might have to bring my own blanket though!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel - very clean”
Reviews.Author: maude2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends. Hotel is what you would expect for the price you pay: nothing outstanding, but everything basic is done well. It's very clean, even in the shared bathrooms you often couldn't tell that someone had been there before you. Rooms are simple, no bedbugs. Mattresses are not the greatest, but do the job. Good location; staff is not super friendly but I'm willing to overlook that for the good deal we got!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mintmoocher
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel 17 as it was one of the cheaper hotels in lower manhattan, it is also close to the large subway junction at Union Square and third Avenue buses which give great access to teh rest of the city. The room was reasobably sized for a couple but he Bed was slightly to samll for two people. The shared bathrooms were cleaned on a regular basis and were always clean and available when we needed them. The Hotel does not posses either a dining room or any comunial raeas , but if a bed and some where secure to leave your belongings. We hardly saw any other guests in our four day stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay, good location, but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: Wagon79
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in late summer. The location was excellent for us and based on the reviews it seemed good value for money. Although Manhattan is an expensive city, I still feel that this hotel is a little overpriced for the rooms and service provided. However, all in all a reasonable stay in a reasonable accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Third time here, but do book thru NYC tourist for best rooms.”
Reviews.Author: AlanAvalon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Dec 2008 (reviewed on tripadvisor), and again in December 2009 and Decemeber 2010. 2009, not bad, but room smaller and not as nice _ I'd booked thru the hotels own website. To be fair, they only had 1 rom left when I booked. Room was small and pokey. This time, 2010, I booked thru http://www.nyctourist.com/ (as I had in 2008). I was travelling with my mother, so booked a room with 2 twins. Absolutely fine, and for the price very good, for the location - Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “love this place”
Reviews.Author: JosephineBreadBaker
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 will be our new 'home' when visiting NYC from now on. Immaculate. Never had to wait for the shared bathroom. Friendly front desk staff. Loved the old elevator and cool room decor! Great residential neighborhood with wide variety of reasonably priced restaurants. (try Tsampa-Tibetan, Sahara-Turkish, Zerza-Mediterranean, and definitely Joe Jr diner on 3rd &16th). Easy access to bus and train. Love this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more for the money that we paid!”
Reviews.Author: doglover99_11
Reviews.Content: very loved and warn hotel but couldnt have been cleaner, which to me is what really matters. i never went to a bathroom that hadnt been spotless. it may be a little different in high season. value for money is really good. we had a large room with sink, tv, hair dryer and the room was always really warm, which help when it was -3 outside! we slept well and could not hear much road noise. over all i would recomend this hotel to any one looking for a cheap and clean base for explorin the big city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, rooms with character and a great location”
Reviews.Author: KylieP_27
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Hotel 17, and we were impressed again. The rooms are basic but clean, with funky decor and your own basin (which is useful when having shared bathrooms). The shared bathrooms worked well - we never had to wait to use them, and they were kept clean at all times. For the price, this budget hotel was great value for money. There was some noise from the street at all times, but this is New York... Location is in a residential-style area but some fabulous restaurants and shops nearby. About 8-10 minutes walk to the Union Square subway station. Free wi-fi was very useful. Would recommend for travellers on a budget who are looking for a clean, comfortable and well-located place to stay.
