I can also recommend a trip to Pure bar and restaurant just around the corner for a unique but delicious raw food experience! (and some great wine!)

Reviews.Title: “Cleaner and Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Bunnydots
Reviews.Content: I ended up booking at Hotel 17 after my friends' band suddenly got a gig playing New Years Eve at Irving Plaza near Union Square. The show was announced in late fall and therefore the hotels I normally would stay at were unavailable. I didn't want to go the sketchy "rent a strangers' apartment" route and since NYC is pretty congested on that night, I was hoping to get something within walking distance of Irving Plaza. After fruitlessly searching on Expedia and other travel sites, all of which had nothing for under 400 a night, a friend clued me to Hotel 17 and I decided to take a chance on it because it had single rooms for about 150 and doubles for about 250. (I noted that I had to book right at the hotel website - the hotel didn't seem to come up in the searches on the multi-hotel travel sites.) I booked a double for one night with shared bathroom for a price of about 250 which worked out to 300 with fees. To be honest, I would have preferred the single room given that I wasn't going to be in it that much, but at the time I booked I was planning to bring a second person and this hotel has a "no extra people after 10 pm" policy. Unfortunately, Hotel 17 does not give you any discount when the second person decides to cancel out last minute (as happened to me), nor did they have a single room left to move me into, which was a bit of a bummer, but the 300 dollar rate was still better than anything else I could find for New Years Eve at that late date. I'd booked a "no smoking" preference but they put me in what appeared to be a smoking room - it contained an ashtray. Because the room didn't reek of smoke and was otherwise clean (I also had a stuffy nose from a recent cold so couldn't smell whatever smoke might have been there) I didn't complain or ask to be moved. However, people with allergies or sensitivity to smoke probably want to be more careful. Other than that, the room was nicer than I expected it to be. It had a vintage decor with retro old-fashioned wallpaper (appeared to be new paper in a vintage pattern, rather than old paper) and dark wood. All the fixtures and furnishings were in good repair - better than most of the chain hotels where I stay, and with the atmosphere of a small historic hotel. It was sort of like renting a bedroom in someone's old house for the night. Walls were not the thickest and at times you could hear the other guests (particularly the guy who had a little too much New Years fun and came back drunk and screaming at 2 am) but there are signs posted in every room to be quiet, don't slam doors, etc. and most of the guests on my floor were more polite. Although the room did not have its own toilet or shower, it did have a new-looking sink and vanity shelf with towels, shampoo, lotion and soap. Also a number of other amenities I was not expecting, including a decent TV, working in-room safe, extra pillow, digital clock, ice bucket and 24-hour room service provided by carryout places. I checked carefully for signs of bedbugs, did not see any. The "double room" basically means you get a double bed rather than a single, and all of the room is pretty much taken up by the bed, so it's about the size of a college dorm space. Not a problem since I didn't have a lot of luggage and all the time I spent in the room was pretty much spent laying in bed. The bed pillows and mattress were kind of hard but I could still sleep OK on them - wasn't expecting it to be the Ritz anyway. My biggest problem with the room was that it was VERY COLD. There was snow on the ground outside and the maid had left the screened window open to the outside air (maybe she was trying to get rid of smoke smell?). I didn't discover the open window for about an hour after I checked in because it was behind a blind and partly behind the headboard of the bed. I couldn't figure out where the draft was coming from, and by the time I found the open window, the room had gotten really, really cold and there was no room heat control to make it warm again. There was an in-room air conditioning unit for cooling but nothing for heating. The room warmed up later in the evening when the building heat apparently came on, but if you stay at this hotel in the winter, you might want to bring your extra sweaters. I also noted that the area around the vanity sink was carpeted which seemed like a mold issue waiting to happen, since the sink tap was quite powerful and would spray water out on the floor if you weren't very careful. Like most people, I was turned off by the idea of a shared bathroom (especially for 300 a night) but figured I could put up with it for one night. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the shared bathrooms on the first floor were nicer than the individual bathrooms I've had in a lot of other places. The tub, shower and tiling looked pretty new, no mold. The toilet appeared older and not as nice but it worked OK and I only had one issue when the person before me had not bothered to flush. I did not have to wait for the bathroom at any time, although I was careful to schedule my shower very early so I could get in there ahead of everybody else. One thing they could use in the bathroom is toilet seat covers - there weren't any so I used toilet paper instead. Of the two bathrooms on my floor, one did not have a sink so if I used that one, I had to go back to my room down the hall to wash my hands. The other bathroom was bigger and did have a sink in addition to the toilet and tub/ shower. I am not sure about handicapped access at this hotel. There's a big flight of front steps to get in and when I arrived there was a family carrying a person in a wheelchair up the stairs with seemingly no other way to get her inside. The shared bathrooms on my floor also required you to step up to get into them. Again, no problem for me, but if you have any sort of disability you probably want to check on that stuff before you book. The surrounding neighborhood is nice - lots of private residences, picturesque historic buildings, little restaurants (both sit-down and carry out), wine/liquor stores, delis, cute bars, some places to browse antiques. I felt reasonably safe walking back to the hotel from Irving Plaza late at night, and the hotel has a desk person on duty all night. Union Square with subway, park and more restaurants and chain stores is just a 10-minute walk away. Overall this was a much better experience than I expected for a "shared bathroom" hotel and I would definitely consider staying here again for an Irving Plaza show or anything around Union Square, although when it's not New Years Eve I would hope to pay a lower rate.

Reviews.Title: “a home from home in the cusp of the village!”
Reviews.Author: huffy72
Reviews.Content: HOTEL 17! where do i begin, well i first stayed here in 2001,before the refurbsee woody allen film)it was cheap back then,and it still is now,so much ive been staying here once every 9 years now,the hotel is "euro" style,me being from here im used to sharing a bathroom,which are clean,and no lines,the rooms are basic,bed window(lucky if you have a street view,but can be noisy,due to traffic early)sink,hairdryer,soap,towels,radio clock alarm,basic cable tv,good for late night mnn cable shows!! firm beds,no bed bugs,clean,ice bucket?? well you have $$ left after the cheap rates! quirky elevator,even tho i got stuck in it once at 3am(blame the east village bars)clean hallways,friendly staff,there used to be some resident on the upper floors,one had a lovely small dog who would greet you,in the hallway,nice dude,the location is great,close to the"L" subway 2 stops to brooklyn,union squre is 5 mins walk away,styvesant square is a lovely small park,mumbles on the corner,nice eatery,local bars,great nightlife in the east village,the l.e.s is a short walk away too,deli shops have everything you need,i stay in the low season,january,$63 a night!! a steal,all i can say is,hotel seventeen is one of the cheapest budget hotels in new york,in a charming street,great neighbourhood,safe,and thats why i recomennd to friends around the world,and keeps me comming back year after year!! just booked for january 2011, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Jen_627
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were on a limited budget, but we really wanted to stay on Manhattan. We decided to stay at Hotel 17 for two nights. Great location! Close to Union Square subway, with lots of fun bars and restaurants nearby. We had a room with a shared bathroom. The bathrooms were always clean and never busy. The hotel is well run, friendly, and clean. Mattress protectors, keep the bed bugs away! Service is good. An excellent value! I would definitely return to Hotel 17 on my next trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN and a great value”
Reviews.Author: guest23
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 was a great find for us! I've read the reviews on here and I was a little worried about the bed bug thing. Let me just say that I check our 1st floor room with a flashlight and even inspected under the mattress. THERE WERE NO BUGS! We even had a private bath. The room was small but clean. A great bargain for NYC. It is on a nice quite street and in an excellent location. The staff could not have been nicer to us. Even the room was nicer than we expected (TV and coffee maker, working, clean shower and it was warm). A great little boutique hotel for the money. They even had Christmas lights in the little lobby. We had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great NY Find!”
Reviews.Author: SFtraveler7
Reviews.Content: New York City is very expensive. But Hotel 17 is reasonably priced. The location is great. Near Union square and with excellent subway access. The hotel is well run, friendly, and clean. Service is good. An excellent value!. AND we had no bedbugs :)

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, great location and not too busy”
Reviews.Author: booya818
Reviews.Content: The shared bathroom idea was a turn off but it turned out fine as it was clean and never busy. Staff were friendly enough. The bedroom was small and crammed but clean. I expected it to be no Hilton. The hotel offers room service with lots to choose from at an ok price. I would stay here again if I needed a budget hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and clean”
Reviews.Author: galianoboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Great location. We had a room with a shared bathroom. The bedroom was small but funky. The bathrooms were always clean and never busy. This is not luxury, but is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS! DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLER25039
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of October. It was our last stop after an 8 week tour of the USA and what a dreadful end to an amazing trip. I booked this hotel in advance because of the excellent reviews on tripadvisor but how I regret this. I had no problem with the shared bathroom or tiny old room but I did have a problem with the bites all over my body from bed bugs! I woke up after the 1st night and had bites on the whole of my body and on my face and they itched terribly. I complained to the front desk who immediately moved us to another room. This room was much bigger and modern than our dingy old room on the 7th floor and even had a flat screen tv but once more I woke up with even more bites. The biggest disappointment was that we had stayed in the cheapest motels whilst visiting America and never experienced this problem. Furthermore we paid £100 a night for this room which I think is quite steep for the size and quality of the original room we were given. The bed squeeked everytime you moved and could hardly fit the two of us in it as it was a more like a single bed than a double. DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO COME HOME WITH BITES ALL OVER YOUR BODY! HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Clean Hotel at a Bargain Price”
Reviews.Author: EMS059
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant to stay in this hotel, particularly after someone on TripAdvisor complained of bedbugs. But I was very pleasantly surprised- there were no bedbugs and the room was small but charming. We were on the 7th floor which had 2 bathrooms that you have to share with other people on the floor. Our room was right across the hall from one of the bathrooms and we had no trouble getting into it at any time. It was kept very clean. The elevator was sometimes slow, but we just used the stairs when we didn't want to wait. The hotel was very quiet and it was on a quiet residential street, but close to Union Square and within walking distance of NYU. If you don't mind sharing a bathroom, I recommend it. The price was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Old New York”
Reviews.Author: rplc3011
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were on a particularly tight budget and Hotel 17 was the only Hotel that was in a great area, had the best reviews and seemed relativity clean when we researched it on the internet. I'm what you might call 'obsessive' in terms of cleanliness, and upon arrival I took off all the bedding to inspect the sheets for bed bugs etc. None to be found. Although the furniture and the building itself was run-down the staff at Hotel 17 obviously keep it very clean, including the shared bathrooms which were cleaned twice daily from what I could see. If you dont like the smell of cigarettes do not stay here, because even though we booked a non smoking room the hallways smelt like cigarettes, but this didnt really bother my friend or I so I it wasnt a negative for us. However, probably not the best place for children for this reason. I am retuning to New York In January 2011 and have been researching accommodation, including hostels and apartments for months and have decided to stay at Hotel 17 again because nothing on Manhattan beets its position, price and cleanliness!

Reviews.Title: “Grade above hostel, fantastic leafy red brick location nr Union Sq & Midtown”
Reviews.Author: lcollens
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on a quiet leafy residential area in the east village and located 4 blocks from union sq which is a real bonus for travel throughout the city. Union Sq also comes alive on weekends with farmers markets. Meatpacking district is 10 blocks west along 14th street and great for drinking. The hotel has hated showers etc on the 7th floor where I was. The hotel staff are knowledgeable about the area. My room was small but I was not expecting luxury for the price given how expensive hotels are in NYC. You are buying location with this place and I would not overlook that. There is a wash basin in the room which is handy for teethbrushing, hair etc. I had problems with the wireless internet so if you want wireless I would get one of the lower floors. I also got a non smoking room. While I was there a guest changed rooms because she heard there were bigger ones on her floor and they accommodated this. May be worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: suzannesb
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in three years and it was great! We had a large room with two twin beds, great for friends travelling together. The staff was marvelous, esp. James! The staff was very helpful and nice. The rooms with the twin beds are much larger than some of their other rooms and much larger than any room I had ever stayed in NYC. I also love the location of Hotel 17. Some people might have difficulty sharing a bathroom but the bathrooms at Hotel 17 are kept very clean so for me this has not been a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Pilee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend for 10 days, and we absolutely loved it! The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was always clean and well kept, the shared bathroom was cleaned every hour so you couldn't even notice someone else has used it before you. The location is great, 2 blocks away from Union Square, and steps away from Stuyvesant park and Esat Village. I definitely recommend this great hotel to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: giapet015
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is worth every penny. The staff is nice and helpful. Rooms are clean. And if you are nice, some rooms have a view of the Empire State Building. Tip the Front desk...be nice.. and they may just give you that special room!!! 24 Hour diner on corner..$6.00 breakfast with coffee and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Price, Exellent Location”
Reviews.Author: aussienelson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and chose Hotel 17 because of the price and the location. Very clean and quaint old school hotel. Shared bath was not a problem, as it was right next door to our room, and never had to wait to use it. Room itself was a triple, and was about the size of an average hotel room. Within a few blocks of some great clubs and some cheap places to eat. Front desk folks were okay. Didn't really need anything from them, and my service was prompt upon check in. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and great location”
Reviews.Author: BenMorris
Reviews.Content: Good value for money as it was the cheapest Hotel we could find in New York. The location is perfect, we walked to all the sights both night and day. Shared bathroom wasn't ideal but never had to queue. Quite liked the old style of the hotel. Overall good budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: KSAS
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights with a friend of mine. After much research through various websites, tripadvisor and other review sites, I choose this hotel. Hotel 17 is close to many important places and close to Times Squre, Empire state building, China Town etc. There are many nice restaurants nearby this hotel. This hotel is good for a very short stay. Both the nights the stay was short. For first night stay I checked into hotel at 6.30PM and checked our morning 5AM. Similary 3 days later I checked into this hotel at 7.30PM and checked out morning at 4.30AM. First night we got a room, wihch was clean and well maintained but very small. Not good enough for two people. Bathroom was very clean with clean towels, bath tub etc. The second time we checked in we got a room in 7th floor which was good for 2 people. This room was a little better and bigger than the earlier one on 1st floor. Final words, dont expect any great service from this hotel. This is nice enough for people who would like to roam around NYC attractions and who dont linke to spend time in the hotel. There is no breakfast available and you need to pay cash in advance to use phone from your room. The room charges were on higher side for us, but no compalints as it was close enough to many local attractions. If no good deals available, I would surely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value, cozy room”
Reviews.Author: sasark
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 17 last year during a short trip to visit a few jazz clubs in the Village. The reservation process was a little odd (to me) because they didn't take a credit card, nor did they send me an e-mail confirmation -- and I am neurotic enough to have worried a bit that something might go wrong and the reservation might get lost. But there was no problem. My room, though small, was actually kind of charming -- I was really happy with it. The desk staff was friendly and the location was perfect for me. I never had to wait for a bathroom, and the bathrooms were clean. (My only minor complaint was that they did not have soap dispensers for when you wash your hands -- you had to remember to bring the little bar from your room. A little annoying at first, but after you figure it out, it's fine). All in all, it was a great choice, and I would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great place”
Reviews.Author: ilovenyc77
Reviews.Content: stayed there in february/march 2010, double room with shared bathroom. bathroom was always clean and available, felt like a little private bath. we had a room facing the backyard, so it was always quiet, but the area is pretty quiet in general. the hotel had a great atmosphre with it's retro-style. staff is very friendly and helpful. only a few minutes walk away from union square, so it's easy to get to any other place.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go again;)”
Reviews.Author: CecileLondon
Reviews.Content: I went there in April 2007 with my boyfriend and we had a great time . This hotel is well situated and you can walk everywhere. There is an amazing Mexican restaurant round the corner which is simply delicious and a good Traditional Burger restaurant next to it. The room are basic but clean and good for the price you have to share the bathroom but there were always clean and only 4 rooms to one bathroom. Only down, there wasn' t any not breakfast facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: roses46
Reviews.Content: The place seemed OK at the time, but I came home absolutely covered in bad bed-bug bites. I have had to wash, clean, vacuum everything at home and I threw out my suitcase in case it was infested. I stayed in Room 721 so perhaps it's not a problem on all floors, but I was appalled.

Reviews.Title: “Bugged by bites”
Reviews.Author: calgaryjim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before, liked everything then. Didn't need the air conditioner then, but this time we did, and is it noisy! Also, I asked if the room we were given on the 8th floor faces the street, I was told it does, but in fact two windows faced east, which was fine, but one window looked onto the roof and a barrier wall. Ugly. This quad was smaller than the previous one we stayed in. I would recommend getting one of the quads facing onto 17St. The hotel needs to find a way to be more responsible environmentally. For convenience, we would leave soap and small shampoo bottles you leave in the hallway bathroom. But they would get quickly removed. We did try to carry soap and shampoos back and forth to the room, but that can get messy and annoying. Permanent soap and shampoo dispensers attached to the walls would be much better I think. I feel badly creating unnecessary garbage when visiting a place as of couse after I'm gone the garbage stays behind. Where does New York dispose of it's garbage? In the ocean still? When we got home, we noticed we all had bites on our bodies. Not having experience with bed bugs, we could only assume that was the source of the bites. Not a fun way to end a trip. An email to the hotel about this was never replied to. Location wise, I like this hotel. Relatively quiet area, but close to lots of cafes on 1 Ave going south. And only a few blocks to Union Square, which is a major subway hub. Any many eateries in the area. Nice little deli on 17 St just west of 3 Ave. Never stayed at another New York hotel, but I'll try another one next time, given noisy a/c, very spotty wi-fi, and for this stay, likely bed bugs, with no response from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jeanfrombos2n
Reviews.Content: Let's face it: this is New York, and so I did find that the telephone manner of the reception was not as gracious as some might like. But the hotel is just fine for what it is. This hotel attracts mostly European and Asian travellers, and I would not recommend it for anyone who has not travelled extensively outside of the US. The room was very small but the sink worked, the AC worked, all was clean, and the bed was fine. The bathrooms were very clean and we never had to wait for one. I got up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom; when I got up in the morning about 7, I could see that the bathroom had been cleaned. Our room was on the back so there was no view, but it was quiet. It was a room airconditioner, but a newer one and so it didn't wheeze and clank off and on. I didn't even use my earplugs. It would be a little tight for two people for more than a few days, but for $120 in a great neighborhood, it's a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: carolyn1984
Reviews.Content: The receptionist/reservation line is SO RUDE HERE! I politely asked a few questions and received a very sarcastic response. I nicely said I felt that I wasn't getting full respect... and he hung up on me. Then continued to ignore the calls for the next hour. Then after we stayed, continued to be poor service. Unbelievable. I travel 2-3 times a month for work and have never seen such poor service ever. Definitely will never stay here again! Both experiences were with the nightshift.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value”
Reviews.Author: andrez
Reviews.Content: For New York City, Hotel 17 is a great value. But don't expect amenities like room service, complimentary breakfast, or even an ironing board or in-room coffee maker. This is a bare bones hotel meant to just sleep in and drop off your luggage. The Wifi is also very spotty, so if internet access is essential during your visit, you'd have better luck going to an internet cafe. We were given a room with a double bed and shared bathroom. My main complaint was being assigned a room in the smoking section. But the good news is the location and the relative cleanliness of the shared bathrooms. Hotel 17 is located in the East Village, very close to St. Mark's place and restaurants such as Veselka and Otafuku and bars such as Decibel. Despite its no frills approach, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in NY”
Reviews.Author: CRJX
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 3 nights and it was almost perfect for my needs (somewhere to sleep). Yes, the room is small by normal standards, but not by NY standards Good - excellent location, ion a quiet street 3 blocks from Union square - friendly reception - very clean room and shared bathrooms, and no trouble accessing bathroom - very quiet - no noise from street or other guests (I was on the 7th floor) - nice old- world feel - comfortable bed (if like me you like a hard bed) - good value for money in NY Bad - wireless Internet very unreliable - if you want consistent Internet save yourself the frustration and go to Starbucks on Union square - Aircon unit was noisy and 1 foot from my head - impossible to sleep with it on (fortu nately it was not too hot) but could be a problem in summer in such a small room - maybe too much to ask for but it would have been good to have a kettle in the room (and even some sachets of instant tea and coffee) Overal hghly recommended for the price and I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST LOCATION and FEEL AN OLD BUILDING IN NY”
Reviews.Author: R!Ekaza
Reviews.Content: i stayed @ hotel 17 for a week when i was a student ・the best location, quiet, easy to go anywhere and you could feel the local ・old building, but clean so you could feel cozy place to stay

Reviews.Title: “This hotel's a pleasant bargain.”
Reviews.Author: Virginia009
Reviews.Content: Neither of us had stayed in Manhattan in 20 years. We found Hotel 17 online and frankly were most happy that tourist reviews of it didn't mention bedbugs, a common complaint at so many places. We wanted an affordable, safe, clean place within walking distance of the Village. Hotel 17 turned out to be even more perfect that we had hoped. It's on a quiet residential street of large brownstones, a few blocks from Union Square, which we came to love. Our room was impeccably clean, with recently refurbished bed, carpeting and bath. At $130/night, it was a steal. No carpet stains, no bugs of any kind, no loud neighbors. Service was quick, friendly and minimal (no breakfast). Our only complaint — and it didn't matter much because we were there only to sleep — is that the room was dimly lit. The place has charming architectural touches with modern refits. We had cable TV, a coffeemaker and microwave. We'd recommend Hotel 17 to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but didn't enjoy the hotel”
Reviews.Author: parkinglotblues
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are not fussy travellers, we have stayed in many similar priced hotels and have been happy with them. The upsides to this hotel were the great location, the nice decor, and the friendly staff. However the downsides to this place were the terrible wi-fi (frustrating for people trying to organise their travel), the hard bed and the fact that I was bitten by a bed bug when I was there, which has never happened to me anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Manhattan value”
Reviews.Author: Popcornlanes
Reviews.Content: The hubby and I have stayed in various European pension-style hotels throughout the US - NYC, Seattle, and San Francisco to name a few. Hotel 17 is at the top for this type of lodging. I was apprehensive at first, but all doubts were erased as soon as we checked in. Our room was on the 8th floor and it was extremely clean (i.e., we check under the mattress at every and any hotel for bed bugs and found none in our room) and quiet. It was spacious and the room had a TV, a sink, soap, towels, hairdryer - all clean and in perfectly working condition. The shared baths were not a problem - they were also clean and we rarely had trouble getting time on the loo. Location, of course, was convenient. We took the train in from JFK to the Union/14th St Station which is a major transfer station with routes that will get you anywhere in Manhattan and Brooklyn. We stayed for 3 nights and paid approximately $350 after all was said and done. Friends that traveled with us and stayed elsewhere paid almost that much for one night alone. I would stay here again easily.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Affordable - would love to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: WhitWhite
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by our recent stay at Hotel 17. A friend and I booked the hotel because it was in our price range and it was just blocks from the Fillmore at Irving Plaza, the venue for our concert Saturday night. We didn't want to travel very far late at night after the show, but the location for us was perfect. We felt very safe walking home. It's right across from the lovely Stuyvesant Park and just a short walk to Union Square and many shops and restaurants. It was so easy to catch the Subway in this area too - we mostly took the Green line uptown and downtown (at the 14th St./Union Square station). It was incredibly easy. Even when we got confused, everyone was very helpful. The staff was super friendly and the bathrooms were incredibly clean. There were two on our hallway, no waiting at all in the morning, we just hopped right in the shower. The room was small but nothing worse than what I expected from the pictures I had seen online, and since we weren't going to be in the room that much anyway who cares? The only thing I would have improved was the bed. Even though it wasn't the most luxurious, I still got a good night's sleep! I would definitely recommend this place, and I will stay there again when I go to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller20103
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to go to New York on a budget and just need a base, the Hotel 17 is perfect for you. The rooms are incredibly clean as are the two shared bathrooms on each floor. Located a couple of blocks from the New York subway station 3rd Avenue with easy connections to midtown Manhattan, the villages and lower Manhattan. A weekly subway pass cost $27 and we found this invaluable. There are a few cafe's and restaurants on 3rd Avenue, our favourite was the one at the top of the street, The Gramercy Cafe which was open 24 hours. Also located nearby was a supermarket, two Duane Reed shops and a Starbucks so you didn't go hungry or thirsty. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful too. My only complaint was that there was quite breeze coming from the window but we rectified this early on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.. and that's all you get.”
Reviews.Author: fleurbean
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 17 after looking at all the fabulous reviews about this hotel on Tripadvisor. I thought i had found the hidden gem in Manhanttan. However, the hotel was way below my expectations. I checked into the hotel with high hopes. As soon as i reached my room, i was appalled by how small it was. It was indeed a big closet... with a queen size bed, heater, a dresser all squeezed into it. There was absolutely no place to put your luggage. The TV was placed awkwardly, and you could bump into it easily if you weren't careful walking from the bed to the front door. All those could be tolerated, but all the reviews on trip advisor failed to mention the paper-thin walls. If you were talking to your friend/spouse..etc. you had to whisper, or else your next door neighbor will come banging on your door. I could hear everything next door, from their talking, to their use of the bathroom, flushing the toilet, to the crumbling noise of a plastic/paper bag...... it was crazy!! One other thing, the website mentions that there was free Wi-fi in all the room, which was true, but barely worked. It was choppy, and pages would not load, and would just go to error due to how slow the internet was. Definitely not recommended if you want to bring your laptop here, because you won't be able to surf the internet. For better internet service ,i would recommend you walk the two blocks down the street and find a Starbucks. This place is not recommended if you want a decent and quiet night's sleep, and certainly not recommended to families with children. I would say look around, there are several hotels nearby that cost a few bucks more, but believe me, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “highly overrated, stay away”
Reviews.Author: marcoclaudio
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel 17 following the brillant reviews it got on TripAdv. I was highly disappointed as I found a rundown hotel with a miniscule room (just big enough to fit a queen size bed, an outdated small bathroom, a noisy malfunctioning aircon and a window facing a wall. I had booked for 4 nights but decided (wisely) to change hotel after the first since upon enquiring with the desk they told me that all double rooms are alike. Certainly not worth the price, stay away from it, with just a few bucks more you can stay at a much more decent hotel in manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Clean , nice and cheap !”
Reviews.Author: nountchak
Reviews.Content: excellent old school hotel in a nice neighborhood ! Cheap and clean . Shared bathroom , cleaned several times a day . Excellent and helpful staff ( I had a lost luggage by continental , they took care of everything ! ) The street in quiet but its 2 blocks from the lower east side , where you can party all night long ! Closed to the L train for Brooklyn . I´ll come again .

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Leave Your Bags and Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Danimal2007
Reviews.Content: I had a single room which was the size of a big closet. This is good if you plan on only sleeping in the room. This is not the place for room dwellers. The shared shower and bathroom were clean enough. The hotel was safe, quiet, and in a great location. The price was great considering the locatio. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Blueberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 17 for 3 days in December. We stayed at Hotel 31 a few times before, and thought we would give Hotel 17 a try. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was surprisingly large (we got a room with a twin bed and a double, shared washroom), clean and very close to the subway. On our last night, we asked whether it was difficult to grab a cab early in the morning to the airport, and the concierge booked a car for us that was nice, comparable to the price of a taxi, and showed up early. Overall, we had a very good stay at Hotel 17 and highly recommend it if you want a great place to stay for cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient, clean, inexpensive and friendly”
Reviews.Author: SarahNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here last week. We were a bit nervous before arriving because it was "too cheap". We were very pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and charming. It had nice wood furniture and crown molding. It had 2 windows, plenty of space, pretty wallpaper and a sink. There were 4 shared bathrooms on the floor. As americans we aren't very used to sharing a bath, but they were always clean and we never had to wait. Knowing this hotel exists will make it easier for us to visit NYC in the future. The neighborhood was nice and very walkable. There are two parks within a few blocks and plenty of close restaruants. The 14th and 3rd subway station is just 5 minutes away. We'll be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Good,nice and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: anthony1travel
Reviews.Content: for any situation... good place for it, very clean... also friendly and recommended

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but great location”
Reviews.Author: RogerRamrocker
Reviews.Content: This place is unbeleivably basic but cheap and very good location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for NY”
Reviews.Author: mfaraco
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from a 10 day trip to NY and stayed the whole time at Hotel 17 with my boyfriend. We stayed in a double room with bathroom and it was very clean, the room is not big but since we never stay in the room anyway it was enough. There was a coffee maker in they room which was good, heating worked perfectly since it was pretty cold and the location of the hotel is great! Many good restaurants near by, subway very close and near Union Square which has everything you need. Will definetly go back and stay there! The rates were good compared to other NY hotels, less than $200 per night for room with a bathroom. And the staff were very nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expected, loved the location.”
Reviews.Author: TatOnHols
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a street surrounded by residential buildings and you get a real feel for what it would be like to live in the area. We found a great diner nearby (Joe Junior's) that became our regular breakfast place, a laundry that delivered, a bar on the corner (mumbles) that did great scallops in the restaurant, and were only a few blocks from Union Square's shopping, restaurants and subway. We had a room with an ensuite and were glad of it as we were there for a week. We were on the second floor, so could walk up, which was good as the lift seemed slow. It was amazingly quiet (although the air conditioning could rival a jet engine for noise, so we didn't ue it) and clean enough. The bed was a little hard and only a double, but I wouldn't hesitate to go back as the location was the real star.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the value”
Reviews.Author: midatlantictraveler1
Reviews.Content: This is one of the cleanest hotels that I have stayed in in a long time, especially the shared bathrooms. And they clean them so unobtrusively, I'm not sure when they do it. No frills, that's for sure. But anytime I needed anything service-wise, they delivered. Brought an iron up to my room, and came up straight away to fix my door when the lock got stuck. The old wood-paneled elevator was quite fun (if slow). The room I stayed in (single) was TINY though, from my estimates, I'd say it's about 6.5" x 14". It had all I needed though. The room I was in did NOT have a sink, which was sort of a pain. I took this room, because I was insistent on having a non-smoking room and it was worth it for me to not have the sink. A word of advice, if you have a request, like non-smoking room, try to arrive early or call them earlier in the day to remind them that it's what you want. One oddity: each floor has four bathrooms, two of which are larger and have sink and shower, toilet. The smaller bathrooms have a shower and toilet but no sink! How strange. I guess it's because most of the rooms have sinks in them. Inconvenient for me though! Also know that with shared bathrooms you will hear more noise as people leave their rooms in the morning to use the bathroom. The hotel's proximity to Union Square, a major subway hub, makes it easy to get anyplace within 20-30 minutes. 24 hour Duane Reade drugstore, restaurants and delis all within a block away on 3rd Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location in New York City”
Reviews.Author: timoguic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 17 in August 2009 (5 nights). Staff is very friendly. Our room was a bit small but ok for the price (looking outside the window we could see... a wall). We had a shared bathroom - there are many of them in the corridors and we never waited to use them. And they were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing and unhelpful staff but good location”
Reviews.Author: KirstyMLondon
Reviews.Content: Good location for exploring Manhatten. Rooms were clean and adequately (although by no means lavishly) equipped with towels and toiletries. However, staff don't seem to be trained in the most basic of procedures (using the credit card machine correctly) nor in customer service (issueing apologies when things go wrong can make all the difference chaps!) And don't expect the manager to reply should you email him with any comments / compaints. The vibe here is that they really couldn't care less! Nice hotel; shame about the service.

Reviews.Title: “Funky! Simple but lots of character!”
Reviews.Author: numanuma99
Reviews.Content: Shared Washroom wasnt a problem at all, and it was always clean, you never had to wait to use it either :) The room was very simple, but you had your own sink and mirror, Cable TV and a decent bed. it was in a good location - walking distance to everything. Staff was friendly, and the hotel was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean quiet and easy to park on the street!”
Reviews.Author: ArtsyGal61
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed here with my husband and again it was just what we needed. I attend a banquet every October at the National Arts Club with is only a couple of blocks from this hotel. If you keep driving around the block you can find a space which is free as long as you aren't there for street sweeping which is posted everywhere. Tip: take your shower early, the pressure ran out before my husband took his! Shared bathrooms are very clean and usually no waiting. If you don't need internet in the room, it only works in the lobby and you have to sit on the floor or the front steps, then this is just a nice quiet, clean place to sleep during your trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Paddy60
Reviews.Content: Rooms were much bigger than they looked in the pictures. Had to share a bathroom but they were cleaned regularly and I never had to wait and the price reflected the fact you had to share. Large tv in the room and a wash basin , mirror etc. Plenty of towels. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Close to the subway, an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: FirstTimeBrian
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Hotel 17, New York City. As far as the decor and overall image of the place goes, think the Pricilla Hotel in the movie Thoroughly Modern Millie. I half expected Mrs Meers to pop up behind the reception desk asking if I was all alone in the world and I kept an ear cocked for the laundry basket with the sqeaky wheel coming down the corridor ! However, once I got used to not having a bathroom or even a sink in my room I began to see the benefits of staying there. It's cheap but clean and the staff seemed very friendly and knowlegable about New York City. The location is great, just down from 3rd Avenue and 3 blocks from Union Square. My room was small as was the bed and rather dark with just one overhead light and one small bedside lamp. There was a TV . However it was very quiet and the air con. worked well. Overall a good, basic experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfection !”
Reviews.Author: Phil774
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel is a Gem !!! I stayed there 3 nights in September. I'm not able to find even one negative point. It's very quiet, clean, perfect good, very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Gem”
Reviews.Author: CubanWaters
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here more than once and most of what I have to say is good. For the prices they charge and what you get, is what makes this a great NYC hotel. ROOMS- Be prepared, the rooms are small and some don't have private bath but very clean and decorated well in a sometimes quirky way. BATHROOM- Some rooms have and some have not. The private ones are a good size in accordance to the room size. The shared ones are kept well maintained. LOCATION- If you want to keep away from the hustle & bustle of Gotham at night, then this area is the little oasis away from it all. Near several small parks like Gramercy, Stuyvesant & Union square. If you are looking to go up, mid or downtown then the subway is minutes away. In walkable distance to Madison, Tompkins & Washington squares. PARKING- No parking on site but a few handy underground garages nearby. You are looking at paying about $45 per night. FRONT DESK- Usually quick service without the line-ups of larger hotels but one time they told me they over-booked and asked me to stay at their other hotel on 31st. After driving many hours and already finding parking, I told them that this would not do and demanded that they honor my reservation. After they figured I wasn't going to move, they miraculously found me a room. Bicycle rentals are nearby across 3rd avenue on 17th st. Unless you're looking to stay near the nightlife of Times Square /Midtown/ theatre district, then this is a perfect budget choice.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great Value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Yonguk_traveller
Reviews.Content: Having just spent a night here after a gap of 30 months since the last stay, I am pleased to report that Hotel 17 is still great value for it's location. As well as value, the service is friendly, the rooms are clean and internet is now free (get a room on the 2nd floor if you need wireless access from your room). Don't be put off by the shared bathrooms - the condition of them is fine, they are well cleaned, and we never needed to wait to take a shower. Manhattan is not a cheap place to sleep - Hotel 17 continues to provide a good value choice so you can save the dollars for some good food and shopping !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great value”
Reviews.Author: Senlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in mid-August -- I chose it primarily for its location, as I used to live in that neighbourhood and wanted to be close to that and the East and West Villages, and for that it was definitely perfect. We made sure to get a private bathroom, and the room was absolutely fine: just big enough, somewhat gloomy and eccentrically decorated (where do they source that wallpaper from?!) but clean and, most importantly in a NYC heatwave, cool. The staff were never less than helpful and courteous and I'd definitely not only recommend it but go back there. My only niggle was that when booking many months in advance, I'd asked for a room with a view (well, I thought it was worth a shot) and instead got a second-floor room with a window looking out over a verrrrry narrow alleyway. Still, that's about the only bad thing I can say about it: otherwise it was excellent value for money, very central and very comfortable. And, interestingly, very quiet. Despite the predominately young crowd we'd see coming in and out through the foyer and hanging round, we never heard a soul during the night. Great stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay during Mother-Daughter trip”
Reviews.Author: cjuel66
Reviews.Content: Awesome value! I travelled to NYC with my 19-year old daughter and not once during our six night stay did we worry about safety. The shared bathrooms were cleaned often through the day and always available when needed. We found Mariella's Pizza just around the corner and enjoyed their slices almost every day. The subway is located within easy walking distance. On most days, we found either an open air market or art show at Union Square. Am planning a return trip and will not hesitate to stay at Hotel 17 again.

Reviews.Title: “So cute, so affordable, great location!”
Reviews.Author: kearnsv
Reviews.Content: We were only in NY for two nights but staying here made it very comfortable. The staff was friendly, the rooms were CRAZY clean (the mattresses are brand new and wrapped in special plastic), the location is great -near Union Square so easy to get everywhere in NYC via the subways. Delis, pizza places, restaurants, and a liquor store all right around the corner. I will absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect low budget hotel - Even though the shared bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Elin87
Reviews.Content: I went to NY due to intervies for a job. The concierge staff were very friendly and helpful where to go and what to recommend. Sure the room was perhaps not very fancy but it had everything I needed and the rooms towards the garden were quiet. The AC was a bit loud though but after being awake for about 18h that did not bother my sleep. Even though the bathrooms are shared, you could never see that anyone had been there prior to you (unless they closed the door after taking a long shower). The location was perfect! Subway station max 10 min away, internet cafe 3 blocks away, many beauty salons and restaurants close by. I love to walk so therefore I walked through half of NY and noticed that the location of the hotel was much closer to everything than I thought. Definitly a pleasant experience, and I would definitly visit Hotel 17 in the future! :)

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT BUDGET HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: dostoyevsky
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for those on a budget. I just spent two nights there with my teenage daughter. While the shared bathroom is a bit of a problem (reminds me of being in a college dorm), we never had a problem getting access. The hotel is clean and it is located in a very quiet neighborhood, but not far from Union Square with access to the wonderful mass transportation system. Its greatest asset is, of course, the price. I spent the same amount of money there that I spent when I first started going to New York on a regular basis . . . over fifteen years ago. I would highly recommend this hotel for someone on a tight budget (and who isn't these days?) and willing to share a bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for its price, can definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Janerixo
Reviews.Content: Not a special hotel, but very clean (common bathrooms) and convenient location, good value for money! I stayed for the weekend as a single traveler and as such can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Gustofers_travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in November 2008. This is the third time I had been to the NYC. The first time I stayed in the W at Times Square and to be frank I though Hotel 17 was only slightly below par to the W (or course the W has its own bathroom). Given this, I will take the extra cash and spend it on a nice dinner or new clothes. The room was clean, quiet and an ok size. Bathrooms always clean and never had to wait. Staff were courteous enough. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Budget Hotel in great location - not gunna lie!”
Reviews.Author: brooke_se8
Reviews.Content: So, I am an 18 year old young woman from Toronto who decided to take a few days and travel to NYC and I am SO glad I chose this hotel. It wasn't obviously the most glamourous of places and I just got the single room with shared bathroom. There are four bathrooms on each floor and I never encountered a problem with accessing the bathroom once. The walls were a little bit thin and you faintly hear your neighbours, but thats to be expected I guess in an older building. VERY small elevator, but it has its charm. The staff was very friendly and I left my luggage there after I checked out for the day before I went to the airport and they took care of it no problem. About a 7 minute walk from Union Square 14th street station, which is great, close to 3rd avenue and they recommended a place nearby for breakfast, I think it was called Stardust cafe or something? They had good breakfast, a little pricey though. Oh, and I couldnt get the AC to work, which wasn't really a problem for me. Overall it was a great value for what I needed it for.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Little_red_courgette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights with a couple of friends in a triple room. It's dark and art deco, oozing with character and charm. Basic but brilliant. Staff are friendly but unintrusive, shared bathroom always spotless and rarely busy. Free fast wifi in the room, comfy bed, clean sheets, yeah! I spent days hunched over the computer looking for the perfect budget hotel for the trip of a lifetime and found it at Hotel 17. Close to the dive bars of East Village, shops of Soho, with a dinky diner on the corner that serves pancakes 24/7. Can't wait to go back again to this wee gem. Miss it madly!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but brilliant”
Reviews.Author: JayTee77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 2 times. Both times for 5 days and I really loved it. The staff is very helpfull and can help you with anything and it is located near to the best breakfast place in town, Sunburst. The location is great for first time visitors as it is in the middle of many great things and still near the subway. The rooms are small but very nice and the hotel really got some personality. The shared bathrooms were clean and there are enough of them. So if you are looking for a cheap, but cozy place to stay I would recommend this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: caitlinmac
Reviews.Content: this place delivered brilliant times. staff dont bother you, infact you hardly know they are even there. awesome location near the trendy east village and alphabet city for groovy dukebox classics, dive bars and trendy types - close enough to stumble home at 8am. nyc is pretty small so you can easily walk to soho or the west village, and the subway is easy aswell. hotel 17 - great price, cool rooms straight out of a movie and just one street from uma thurmans ouse - cant go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: i_heart_music
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in NY.Cheap and cheerful.Our room was on the 6th floor and was very spacious. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Bathrooms were always clean, which is great since they're shared. Location is excellent. One thing that was annoying was that it was always very hot in our room, but we didn't spend much time in there anyway. But yeah, would definitely stay there again :) x

Reviews.Title: “Picking Up Daughter from NYU”
Reviews.Author: CollegeboundNY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 3 nights at the Hotel 17 and had a wonderful experience. We were in NY to help our daughter pack up after her first year in college. We found the Hotel met all our needs. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Our room (612) was a double and was laid out quite nicely and very sunny. The closet/shelving unit was big enough to store our suitcases, encased a nice television and helped keep the room uncluttered. We had a separate area for a pedestal sink with mirror and blow dryer. Our room was at the end of a quaint narrow hallway, but the shared bathroom seemed only a few step away. The bathrooms were always extremely clean and we never had to wait...there are two on each floor. Hotel 17 is located in a great part of NYC. Union Square is a couple of blocks away. There is a very pretty park across the street towards 2nd Ave. Washington Square and Greenwich Village is less than a 10 minute walk; the East Village is even closer. As in most areas of NY, there a lots a good restaurants nearby. We got coffee and a light breakfast at Corbet Conley, just down 17th St. across 3rd Ave and would eat in our room. The hotel has a nice feel to it and is very well maintained. The single elevator, though slow, puts you back into another era. We found the best prices for rooms were to book on their website. My wife stayed her in March and they had a multi-night special. The same was true for the current trip. I would not hesitate to stay here again on our next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Second time and still satisfying”
Reviews.Author: Digdem
Reviews.Content: This review is about my second stay in Hotel 17 in April 2009. As same as my previous stay, I really enjoyed my choice of Hotel 17 again. This time we -three people- stayed in a non-smoking room which is bigger and has a better window view than smoking rooms. I can say that Hotel 17 is -clean -safe -central -friendly -close to public transport -fairly priced Although my trip was in April, the weather was very hot (app. 32C). The air conditioners were noisy and not working properly. We opened the windows. Luckily the window has a mesh. The location is very nice and 8 minutes walk to Union Square Subway Station. There are nice cafes and restaurant around. When we were arriving, we asked for a cab. The receptionist arranged it and it took 40$ to La Guardia Airport. Actually it was not that difficult to go to the airport by public transportation, but one of my friends had a huge suitcase. We stayed in a room with a shared bathroom. But it was not a problem. It was clean and mostly available.

Reviews.Title: “Had an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Edulka
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I visited New York in April 2009. We stayed in Hotel 17 for 5 nights and had an enjoyable stay. The hotel is clean, rooms are clean and the shared bathrooms are also very clean, which was our main concern. They were always available, in fact, we hardly met any other guests in the halls at all, only by the reception or in the elevator. The reception area and the halls are quite small. First night we stayed on the 7th floor and had one double bed. The next morning talked to James about possibly getting a room with two single beds, and we did (thank you James, that was much better), moved to the first floor, room 111. It was a little bit more spacious, and a bit on the cool side for some reason, which turned out to be great because it was hot that weekend and was nice coming to a cool room. The hotel is in a quiet and nice neighborhood, I was waking up to the sound of birds chirping every day (that was a surprise... did not expect that in NYC). The hotel is simple, does not have much as far as extras (with so many European travelers I thought it could at least have an electric adapter... costs only $6 bucks or so, we had to buy it to charge our cell phones... should have left it there for them, no use for it now)... no coffee, etc... but it served our basic needs and if we needed an extra towell or a blanket, or even an electric heater one night, we had it within 5 minutes. There is a great little mexican place behind the corner on 3rd Street called Paquito's, good food. Location is great, 3 or 4 blocks from the subway at Union Square to take you pretty much everywhere. Good shopping at Union Square as well. Over all - great place for the price, had a nice stay there.

Reviews.Title: “nice & interesting budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dowlins4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year on a weeks holiday in New York. We had a double room with shared bathroom and it was a very pleasant stay. The shared bathrooms (two on our corridor) were always empty even though the hotel was full and they were always in great condition. The thing I really liked about this hotel was it's character and old fashioned charm. Apparently a scene from a Woody Allen film was filmed here and I can see why, the lift especially, looks like something straight out of an old american movie. So when you pair that with the lovely location (nice and safe & only 5 minutes walk from union square) it's a great base to explore New York. one tip though: If you're going there around September time prepare yourself for the very hot subway stations, we didn't factor in how humid and hot it would be (coming from Ireland) so we had to ditch all our jeans and buy light clothes!

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel now!”
Reviews.Author: CockneyScouse
Reviews.Content: location - downtown Manhattan public transport - Union Square is 5 mins walk (can get everywhere from here) room - clean, comfortable with a double bed, sink, tv and safe bathroom - 2 on every hallway but never had to wait for one and was ALWAYS clean definitely value for money for where it is!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient for the price”
Reviews.Author: MissSian
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for five nights in March. It is definitely a boutique style hotel, the wallpaper in the room was definitely bright and it was quirky. We had a twin room which consisted of a double and single bed. My bed was comfortable but very squeaky, but the place was exceptionally clean. I was initally concerned about the shared bathroom situation, as all patrons on each floor have two bathrooms to share. The bathrooms were cleaned regularly and I did not encounter anything unpleasant at all - it is just important that you remember your swipe card as you would not want to lock youself out of your room wearing just a towel! The same went for the toilets, they were exceptionally clean. Our room had a TV, two large windows which opened up to air the room, an airconditioner which we did not use, a dressing table with large mirror as well as hairdryer, and small wash sink with mirror. Overall we could walk from the hotel to the subway in 3 minutes and could walk to Times Square in 30 mins. We walked the entire time and only used the Subway once and we saw everything we wanted to during that time, from Brooklyn to Greenwich Village etc. There are two great diners very near the hotel which serve amazing pancakes - an authentic American diner experience and a great way to fuel your walking each day. There are also some cute little bars very nearby as well. Oh just one point - I think other reviewers have mentioned this - internet access looked to me quite bad in the rooms based on seeing some people sitting in the stairwell with laptops so perhaps this is not great if you want to take your laptop along! All staff on reception were very helpful and even called the shuttle company to book my bus for me for my very early flight out of the US - this was only $15-20 and saved me lots of money on a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Lone female travellers- excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kitty1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid April 2009 and was not disappointed. The neighbourhood is lively and within easy reach of transport. The single rooms are small, but cosy and quiet too- a rare thing in New York! I had a single room without a sink then moved to a single room with a sink- either way the shared facilities are really clean and I was never waiting for the bathroom. It's a budget hotel, clean comfortable and i'd recommend it to lone female travellers as the staff were really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the money”
Reviews.Author: foodloverCambridgeMa
Reviews.Content: Paid $136 for three adults sharing (two beds). Sink in room. Shared bathrooms, clean but bring your own towel (provided in rooms) to dry your hands. After a long day of walking around manhattan pleasantly relieved to find the room smelling fresh and clean. Quiet at night time. Safe neighborhood. $10 to get a cab to times square for the three of us. I thought the room was every bit as nice as one in the Edison Hotel I was in in 07. Bigger even but no bathroom of course. The free internet did not work in our room. When we asked about this they told us that it only worked on the first floor. There are no seats in the tiny lobby to hang around on. We used the parking garage and found the staff there very nice and helpful. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: DavidLo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days. Was suprised to find such good value. I paid 200 pounds for 4 nights. Apart from a dorm room bed I found nothing else approaching that for value. The place itself is clean but basic with a shared bathroom. Free wifi but very patchy. Great location. Nice little cafe called the sunburst 1 min walk away on 18th St. Was good for breakfast. To be honest I'd much rather stay somewhere with more luxurious facilities but when i run the numbers I just cannot justify the extra cost. Really good option to know about. I'm going to give it 5/5 because it is great to have as an option and it does what it does brilliantly. Just know what to expect though - a clean, small room in a great location with no trimmings and shared bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good option for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: mtatraveler09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in March 2009. It is just a few blocks away from Union Square, so the location is very good, close to the subway station and within walking distance to many restaurants and several delis. I had a single room on the 4th floor overlooking 17th street. My room was tiny but the truth is that you hardly spend any time in the room when you go to Manhattan. The room had a sink, soap, towels, shampoo, conditioner and a hair dryer. The room was never made up unless I put the "please make up the room" sign on the door. Internet is complimentary but service failed everyday. There are 2 bathrooms per floor, and they were always kept very clean. I never had any trouble finding an empty bathroom. The heating wasn't enough during the coldest days, and it was turned off during daytime during the warmest days. It wasn't turned on again until late in the evening so when I returned to the room at around 7 pm it was very cold and the receptionist offered me an extra blanket. Service at the reception desk was always very polite and professional. I would definitely stay there again and I highly recommend it for a solo traveler or couple in search of an affordable and good hotel in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “clean, safe place”
Reviews.Author: alex_tCambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in October 2008 as part of a two week holiday to the US. The hotel is easy to find and within safe walking distance to the subway; it is set in a quiet street; there is a supermarket very close by as well as various coffee shops etc. The room was small and quite dark because of all the dark panelling; there was also no view to speak of since the wall of the next building was 30 cms away and I had to crane my neck to see the sky but this is New York after all. There was heating in the room but it was spurrious. The rooms also have a sink and tv, safe and alarm clock. Everything was very clean. The bathroom was a little outdated but also clean. don't expect much from the staff on the front desk; there really wasn't much customer service to speak of. Be aware that they swipe your credit card through the machine when you check in, and swipe it again when you check out, although they only charge you once. I also had a rather unpleasant surprise in that the price I booked with did not contain the city tax which was added on (another $150 or so at the time!). The hotel IS expensive for what you get but it is in a good location and it IS in NY...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Aeon_Flux2
Reviews.Content: OK, it is not luxurious but it is cosy, very clean and the location is spot on! I cannot believe how lucky I was to find it! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: matthewsf
Reviews.Content: I was initially reluctant to stay at this hotel. All of my previous visits to NY had me staying in well known, name brand chains, mostly in mid-town. But with sky-high prices I decided to give the Hotel 17 a try. Everything was represented honestly without any surprises. I was traveling alone so I got a single room. Yes, it was small, but no different than what you might find in London at an economy/tourist class B&B. The room itself was clean, the shared bathrooms on the floor even cleaner. Never a wait to use one. The only downside was being an older building with central heating, the automatic heating unit really warmed up the (small) room, so I had to crack the window open to let in some fresh air. Also, my room did not have a sink/wash basin-apparently, some don’t come with it so be sure to ask if your room has one. Location was great-close to subway and plenty of local, neighborhood restaurants. No street noise could be heard even with the window open, so a quiet and pleasant night’s sleep was easy to come by. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, close to hospital”
Reviews.Author: NjCosmicTraveller
Reviews.Content: When my husband was recently hospitalized, I needed to stay in NYC and wanted to keep my costs down. What luck to find Hotel 17, with single rate at $95. At first, I was hesitant about the shared bathroom, but I never had to wait and the bathrooms were always clean. The front desk staff was most helpful, and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: gywisyw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights mid December with my soon to be wife. Based on former reviews, we didn’t know what to expect. Hotel 17 turned out to be the best of the 2 hotels we stayed in during our 5 days in NY (first time in NY, other hotel was Ye Old Carlton Arms). Yes , it is dark, the reception guy is a bit weird and the rooms have funky wallpaper, but the rooms are clean, have a TV and our (tiny but cosy room, 412) had a sink in the room. Shared bathrooms (2 per floor) were spotless, and no waiting issues. Our room was located at the back of the hotel and therefore it was very quiet (even heard birds in the morning). Only down part, as stated in an other review, due to a gusting icy wind, the wind blew true the air conditioner, creating a cold draft. (put a piece of the cupboard in front of it which worked out fine). So, in short, no this is not a 4 star hotel, it is a bit rough around the edges, but has a great location and definitely a good price/quality ratio. Would definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, great location....affordable. What more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: TreyAnastasio14
Reviews.Content: Can't really say enough about this hotel. Perfect location, short little walk to Union Square. Staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms large and never a wait for the bathrooms (which were always clean). Will be back in the future, no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: eponine18
Reviews.Content: Great location and price - I would definately stay here again. Although the decor is very dated and dark the hotel was spotless and the room was cleaned every day on request. I never had a problem with the shared bathrooms and again these were spotless - there was also a basin in the room. Only thing I didnt like was the heat - it was overpowering at times in the room and there is no way to turn this down. Although the week I spent here was 'unseasonably cold' I had to sleep with the window open and no covers just to be comfortable. Definately worth the money though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: traveller27London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 17 during a short trip to New York. It is well located in mid-town so we were within walking distance of all the major attractions and there are plenty of 24-hr eateries nearby. The hotel itself has a slightly spooky feel to it but this apparently attracts film-makers to shoot there. I was a bit worried about using shared bathroom facilities but the toilets and showers were spotless and I never had to wait to use the facilities. Would definitely recommend it if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: RoelVT
Reviews.Content: My second stay there. First time was July Fourth weekend 2008, this time in early December during the pre-Christmas high season. Good price for the room -- $120 Sat night, $110 Sunday. I think it may actually have been under $100/night when I was there during the Summer. Beware that NY hotel taxes added another $40 to the stay. Both times I was in a single w/ shared private bath. Very small room -- I estimate about 110 - 120 sq ft., dark and no view but it was clean, the staff was nice, and the hotel was in a good location. Note that other pension-type hotels I've stayed in have included a sink in the room. Not so here. Also, I stayed on the third floor, A-side (specifically, room 306) and it was pretty apparent that some jerk had relieved himself in the hallway -- pervasive urine smell. The hotel's in the Gramercy Park neighborhood of lower Manhattan, just north of the East Village. Close to NYU. No room service or dining facilities but plenty of restaurants and bars nearby and there's a Duane Reade drugstore a couple of blocks away that's open 'til midnight and a Whole Foods supermarket on 14th (three short blocks away, the hotel's on 17th). The subway's nearby on 14th St & 3d Ave, but the NYC subway system's a bit inscrutable and I found myself walking to the 23d St or 8th St stations for more direct access the to the line that goes uptown. BTW -- notwithstanding the reputation of the locals, they were quite helpful in deciphering the subway system. If you're a walker, Manhatten's flat and the Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, and Tribeca neighborhoods are an easy walk South, and as mentioned above, the hotel's on the North edge of the East Village. Similarly, the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, and Herald Square (think Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade) are a pretty easy walk North. I also walked to Times Square and Rockefeller Center (to the North) and the Financial District (to the South) but next time, will likely take the subway or a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Location cant be beaten”
Reviews.Author: ClayDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5days at Hotel 17 and would recomend it for location and price. Single rooms are small and basic and these rooms dont have an ensiute or a sink. I cant say i agree with other reviewers about the sharing bathrooms not being a problem. Only 2 showers per floor and having to constanly check to see if their free can be a bit of a pain. Rooms are clean and cleaned daily. Location is fab, a real neighbourhood with plenty of cafes, shops, bars and excellent places for evening meals. Would go back if i could manage to grab a room with its own shower, may sound petty but after 5days you really miss having your own private space.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice For Those Who Know Better”
Reviews.Author: K-Hobo
Reviews.Content: Had to spend a night in NYC, and came here to look at the best deals for value and cleanliness. Having lived or worked in the East Village for five years in the mid 90's, I knew that for under $150 a night staying at the Hotel 17 was going to be a major money-saving coup, and it WAS. The hotel itself was clean and the overall atmosphere was nice-- victorian decor, earth tones, and low-lit. My room was small but had exactly what I needed-- a bed, some working heat pipes, and a TV. The bathroom, a shared one down the hall, was very clean and available whenever I needed it. I knew the location(Stuyvesant) well, and it was close to all my favorite downtown restaurants (including Veniero's, a fantastic Italian pastry shop on e11th street). Let's face it, some of people, when rating hotels, expect their own personal masseuse and don't fully understand how great of a deal this place actually is. It's within a 10 minute walking distance of one of the greatest places in the world-- the East Village, and people are complaining about trifles. Let them go uptown and spend $300 a night in one of those touristy jobs and spend yet more in overpriced presumptious restaurants. I'll take the Hotel 17 and the East Village anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Mike_8530
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and would definitely do so again. Booked via the website, called to confirm twice before arrival -fearing the botched reservation stories on tripadvisor- but no issues with my reservation at all so the calls were likely not needed. Convenient, safe eastside neighbourhood. My room 109 was in good shape...very clean & new sink, wall fixtures and TV. I booked a "non-smoking" room but there was an ashtray in there nonetheless. I also noticed the ashcan in the hallway. Luckily, neither the room nor the hallway smelled of smoke (perhaps I was just lucky to be on a floor without smokers, judging from the previous review). Noise was not an issue...again, I might have just been on a quiet floor. Two things I mentioned to them: no hooks to hang wet towels in the room, and would be nice to have robe/slippers to get to the shared bathroom (given the size of the towels you get, better not be too modest!). Other than that I was very satisfied. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Bc_Bcrosie
Reviews.Content: Our room had a private bath which was modern and very clean. Quaint hotel on very quiet street centrally located near Union Square suited us perfect. Stayed 6 nites and were very comfortable. The room is one of the smaller ones I have stayed in. Don't expect a fabulous view from the window and the selection of channels from the tiny tv were limited, however we found the whole hotel very clean, the staff friendly, and I would recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “The whole place reeks like an ashtray”
Reviews.Author: delphicat
Reviews.Content: Indeed, Hotel 17 is cheap. And because of all the raving reviews here, I booked it for me and my friend to stay for four nights. Immediately when we entered we noticed the smell of cigarets. In every hallway there are many ashtrays, inviting people to smoke. I'm not fussy, but find it very strange that no one else would notice this horrible smell. The third night we could not sleep because our neighbours had the a/c on all night, which caused a factory-like noise in our room. The reason they used the a/c was because the heating system had been turned on and is in no way controllable by the guests. So the only way to make your room not so hot, is turning on the a/c. Not very eco-friendly and terribly noisy. When we asked for another room because of the noise, the staff member would sigh and sigh until he finally said: well ok, but the other room will probably be just as bad. Say what???? Cheap yes, neigbourhood fine, recommendable no.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: azoic17
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at Hotel 17 and had an excellent experience. The hotel is kept very clean (the stairway stank of polish and gleamed when I walked up the stairs) There are shared bathrooms but they are regularly cleaned and I only had one incident where there was water from the shower on the floor (and lets face it how hard is it to keep the water IN the shower people!?) The hotel is located in a pleasant tree lined avenue roughly two blocks from Union Square on one side and the Lower East Side on the other. I always felt safe in the area.
