The only negatives were the WI-FI only working in the stairwell and occasionally not having hot water in my room but these were minor distractions. Overall all I would recommend this hotel to others and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: ruadh_ruadh
Reviews.Content: Unless you're used to 5 star hoels there is no reason in the world to give this place a bad review. Great Hotel, staff and location. I was a little apprehensive of the shared bath but not all the rooms share, some have private so we never had a problem with waiting-it was always spotless. I lived in New York in 2007 so I knew my way around but there's a subway in Union Square which is only a 7-10 minute walk (with shops along the way so be prepeared to be side-tracked!) I'd definitely stay again and would not hesitate to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: GemsIreland
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at Hotel 17. I spent 5 nights there and will def be going back. Gr8 price,spotless,friendly staff, safe location and within walking distance from all the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Love Hotel 17!”
Reviews.Author: Garfield0880
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel 17 was probably the best decision I've ever made. Close to Union Square, the East Village and Gramercy Park, I found everything to be either close by or within walking distance. Especially subway stops and some incredible budget restaurant finds. Where the hotel is located, you'll find a safe and quiet street, across from a peaceful park. Great for eating outside and enjoying the ambiance of the neighbourhood. The staff was super friendly and super helpful. Rooms were kept cleaned daily. And though I had reservations about sharing a bathroom with other people, in the end it didn't matter. There was no line ups and the facilities were kept in precise order. I will stay in Hotel 17 in future visits. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The most important part of the reservation: the holding”
Reviews.Author: OttawaLov2shop
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here Oct 17-19th. We requested a non-smoking room with “if available two single beds”. I do understand that there was a chance that I would have had to share a bed because not all the rooms have two beds. However, if a non-smoking room is an option offered by the hotel when the reservation was made, I do feel that a non-smoking room should have been held for us. We were in a smoking room on the third floor with a broken air conditioner and one double bed. We called down to the front desk to ask to have some one look at it (we didn’t need it to cool the room, we needed it to bring some fresh air in!) and after waiting until 12:30am no one showed up. The staff were not friendly or overly helpful. However disappointed we were with the attention paid to our reservation requests we were not dissatisfied with the overall cleanliness or location of the hotel. The room was very clean and the bathrooms were always available and spotless. The bed was comfortable and the pillows, fluffy and fresh. My friend and I felt safe in the neighbourhood, and found the 14th street Subway stop very convenient to travel further uptown or down town. I do not know if the TV worked as, as another reviewer commented, who watches TV while in NYC! I would suggest staying at this hotel if you are somewhat of an independent traveler, appreciate a great deal (and are willing to compromise at times), and want to be in the middle of all NYC has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “no frills hotel for a frilly city!”
Reviews.Author: meganvd
Reviews.Content: it is a very cute hotel. no frills, but a lot of history. my roommate and i had a triple room (full and twin bed). we paid $90 per night to stay there! a steal in nyc. the staff was a bit uppity, but it is nyc... the bathrooms were always clean. disappointed there wasnt a fridge for left overs. dont know if the tv worked. who watched tv when you go to nyc! the lyric diner on 23rd and 3rd, just a few blocks away, was delish! but wait staff were always cranky. would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: gneosk
Reviews.Content: I love Hotel 17. My sis and I were very concerned with NY's expensive accommodations but we were lucky to find this hotel. The location is great as it's very close to Union Square and the subway. There is M1 bus stop nearby to go straight down to Madison Ave. We felt very safe walking back at night as the neighborhood is very friendly. The hotel itself is decent. It's clean and the shared bathrooms are well maintained. The only downside is the dark hallways and the funny smell of the room spray that they use. I will definitely choose this very same hotel the next time I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Sandra42
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Hotel 17. Well, NYC rooms are expensive so finding a room less than 200 bucks was a challeng... The hotel 17 is nice for NYC. (I mean there would be no way me paying 200 dollars for this type of room in any other city but hell... you re in NYC...) -->The room was OK. We had a triple room but our friends staying in a quadruple room had a much better place : bigger room, nicer wall paper, a safe in the room, shelves, and view! -Our room was clean but the wall paper was awful :stripes on one wall, flowers on the other. it was a really choking experience when we turned on the light!Also the ceiling was quite in a bad shape..In the morning we found some paint on the sink... -the bathrooms were surprisingly clean. No complaint about that and the staff would change the bath rug often. -you don t get an iron in your room but can get one from the reception The best part of the hotel was the location. Close to Union sq and almost in E village (10 min walk from St mark place).you can t beat this. So I would recommend the place

Reviews.Title: “My home in New York! You cannot beat this location”
Reviews.Author: julesjay
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at Hotel 17 four times over the last 5 years and until someone points me in the direction of another hotel in this price range in this fantastic location - I'm not going anywhere else! Have found the staff always friendly and helpful, the rooms clean - although this time we were in a very small one! (but you only have to sleep in it, after all! ) And there was never any wait for one of the shared bathrooms. You have Gramercy Park and Greenwich Village right on your doorstep. Close to subway stop, close to gorgeous eateries and left or right out of the front door will take you to an Internet ready Starbucks (the only small niggle - no wifi in-house). If you are looking for luxury - this hotel is not for you. If you want location location location! and value for money - this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissie050
Reviews.Content: This place wouldn't win any prizes for its decor but who cares about that when you're in New York City. What is important is that the room was spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. The communal bathrooms were also clean and I only had to wait once or twice during the 8 nights I was there - and I could have gone to one of the many other bathrooms if I wanted to anyway. The air conditioning was a bit noisy but you soon get used to it. It is ideally located, just a short walk from Union Square, where you can take the subway anywhere you want to go, although we walked most places to get a real feel for the city. I paid less for 8 nights in this hotel than I could have paid for 2 nights elsewhere, and I'm glad I did. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC value -Yes, There Is Such A Thing!”
Reviews.Author: RML-OH
Reviews.Content: Again, Trip Advisor comes through. I would never have heard of Hotel 17 without researching Trip Advisor and never have experienced this charming European-style hotel on West 17th near 2nd Ave. All the reviews are right on the mark, superior value for your money in the safe, walkable East Village neighborhood. Sure, Hotel 17 is slightly worn with small rooms, but in Manhattan who wants to spend time in their room? The shared bathrooms are spotless and obviously well cared for, never a wait with four to a floor. The staff was very professional without being cloying, and the housekeeping staff was very nice as well. One important feature that is available here is that the air conditioning unit has a fan that you can run at night to provide that "white noise" which eliminates street or hotel sounds that might keep you awake. Union Station and the subway is about a five minute walk, which eliminates the need for a taxi. All in all, a wonderful stay, and I will certainly return to Hotel 17 in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but...”
Reviews.Author: simonsmidt
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 5, stayed here for 3 nights in 2 rooms, a double and a triple. 2 Nights were booked via a travel website, but later we decided to add a third. This booking was done directly with James from Hotel17. I got a confirmation from him via email that the 3rd night for both rooms was ok. However, when we came back from the second day, the room for the kids was emptied, and already occupied by other guests. As such this was not a big problem, but the brace for the teeth of our oldest son was gone. He needs to wear them every night, otherwise the investment in the teeth are worthless.... Luckily they were found back after some light panic from us and the hotel staff. The kids got another room and we could stay in ours as they didn't dear to clean out our room which was occupied with our suitcases ;-) It turned out that the third night was not added in their system despite the promise in the email. To compensate the annoyance for us they offered to deduct $35 from the room rate, which was accepted by us. As written by other reviewers the double (312) and triple (607+205) are not very big, but they are clean and functional. The shared bathrooms isn't a problem either. We found them almost always available and clean. APPLAUS for the cleaning staff!! Location is ok, as it is 500m. from Union Squar metro. A good breakfast (as it is not available in the hotel) you can get at Gramercy Cafe on 3rd avenue and 17th street. I recommend the Lumberjack breakfast, it will fill you until diner ;-) Conclusion: despite the 3rd night confusion, this is a value for money hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Craigdon
Reviews.Content: A friend that had stayed there some years previous recommended hotel 17 to me. She said it was very basic, a bit gloomy, but very good value. I love a bit of value so we decided to stay there during our trip in October. First impressions were mixed, everything seemed so small and dark, and the décor bordered on gothic chintz. But after seeing the room I was really surprised. Everything was clean (if not a bit battered), the room was fair-sized and the bathroom and shower facilities were great. In fact, we never had to wait to use them and I saw the bathrooms and showers being steam cleaned every morning and night. Most reassuring! The staff were helpful and all of the other guests seemed to be having a great time too. The best thing about the hotel was the location. It was so close to Union Square and all of the shops and eateries on 2nd. Everywhere seemed so easy to reach, yet the immediate area was so lovely to explore. I pretty much love just walking around and exploring when I go to another city, and stumbling across the Flatiron building and the Empire State Building in about a 30 minute walk was marvellous. I would recommend the hotel to my friends who, like me, appreciate a good location and great value, and don’t mind staying somewhere a little worn. I would definitely stay there again, and hope to do so soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: I-love-my-holidays79
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in Apr 2008 with my boyfriend and I guess we got pretty much what we expected for the money that we paid. The best thing about this hotel is the location, no doubt. Even though both of us had been in New York several times before and we thought we knew the area pretty well, we still found new gems within a 5 min walk from the hotel. One of these was a reaturant called The House (17th St) and a few others along that same street heading west from the hotel. Don't expect the rooms to be chic, they really are not anyting special. Basically they have everything that you need and the standard is basic but fine. We had booked a room with a private bathroom, which was small but clean and the shower was nice. The size of the room was fine. The bed was not so comfortable and there were lots of pigeons very much in love outside the window waking us up way too early in the morning (even for a jet lagged Londoner). If you are, like we were, planning to spend most of your holiday enjoying New York and not sitting in the hotel this is a very good choice as I think it would be difficult to find something cheaper with the same standard and location.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain for the bargain-minded”
Reviews.Author: Welcome_Matt
Reviews.Content: I just can't stop raving about the adequacy of this hotel! And even though I trusted the chorus of other reviewers saying what a decent place this is, the question of adequacy lingered in my mind until the wife and I finally arrived and checked in. After all, the price for our standard room (with shared bath) was so much lower than most other plausible options that I wasn't sure what to expect. As others have stated -- bathrooms were clean and at least one was unoccupied every time a need arose. The linens were clean. The AC worked (and quickly, thanks to the small size of the room). The staff was professional. The location was great, both for the relatively laid-back neighborhood feel and the proximity to Union Station (still a little walk, but walking's good, no?). Yes the decor is a bit dated (and the wallpaper in our room certainly couldn't have been appropriate even when it was first put up), but if that's the price we pay for, well, paying a lower price, then hurrah for ugly! We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fine”
Reviews.Author: Marcil1
Reviews.Content: I booked through Orbitz a month before my stay - I was able to get a room while other web pages, including the hotel's own page, showed no vacancies. I agree with most of the other reviews left recently. The hotel is simple, no-frills. Single rooms are tiny. The staff was attentive though not obsequious. Check-in and check-out very smooth. Rooms clean with fresh wallpaper. Evidently shared bathrooms are not for everyone, and only half the bathrooms have sinks as well, but there were 4 on each floor (for about 20 rooms) so that was not a problem for me. You have to leave a card on your door for the maid-service to tidy your room. Note: $20 deposit for turning on the telephone in the room. Charges for all calls - including local. Unused balance refunded at end of stay. Hotel was quiet. I could sleep in without being awoken. A 5-minute walk from the L (Canarsie) subway at 14th St and 3rd Ave. The bus stops about a 30 second walk from the door. Delis and snack-bars and restaurants close by. One of the least expensive hotels, when I was looking. As someone who spends only a few waking minutes a day in a NYC hotel room, I would have no trouble going back at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: nmusso2
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in NYC. I did not know what to expect from a hotel that was a decent price in NYC. I figured once we got there we would be in hell for 9 days. But I was very very wrong. As soon as my sister and I arrived we LOVED the hotel. Everyone at Hotel 17 was so friendly, and helpful it made our trip that much better. If you are looking for a 4 star hotel well then keep on looking, but if you are looking for a place that is one of those amazing bricked house, tree lined NYC streets you see in the movies then stay here. We loved how it was located near Union Square, so there was always something, and somewhere to go. Being two younger girls and always being on the run we were not sure if we would feel safe walking back to the hotel; but we felt safe at all hours. From leaving at 4 am in the morning or returning at 1 am the streets and neighborhood around Hotel 17 were so safe and comforting. Another concern we had was the shared bathrooms, but out of our 9 days there we never had to wait for the bathroom once. So do not let the shared bathrooms scare you off. Stay here when you are in NYC and you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic downtown accommodation”
Reviews.Author: pdp84
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a generally cheap (by New York standards) hotel, then this is the place to go. The rooms were very basic, the shared bathrooms were clean (when I used them anyway) and it was in a perfect location. One of the staff members was a little rude and lacked any customer service skills, but apart from that it was a cheap place to lay your head for the night.

Reviews.Title: “You can't complain about the location, but...”
Reviews.Author: WoollyBully
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel 17 from May 26th to June 2nd. The weather in NYC was perfect for sight-seeing. I was there all by myself and it was my first trip to NYC. I was a bit nervous since I'm a girl who's never been to the mainland of the U.S. and I heard that NY is very scary city for a young girl by herself. So i was really careful about picking up a hotel that i was going to stay. Of course I was a budget traveler since I'm a college student and i was looking for a cheap but nice hotel. I found Pod hotel, Chelsea Lodge, Hotel 30 and 17. All 4 of those hotels were located in good places and price were reasonable. But even though I tried to book a hotel on April, Pod hotel, Chelsea Lodge and Hotel 30 didn't have room since it was around the Memorial weekend. But fortunately Hotel 17 had room and the price was very reasonable for me. I checked the location in google map and I also mapped from both JFK and LGA to the hotel. It wasn't that far from both of the airports. Plus, I've booked 2 other hotels from expedia when I stayed in Hawaii and I really satisfied with those hotels, i had no doubt that this hotel would be suck. On the day of arrival, i checked my luggage in first, since it was 9 am in the morning. Check in was fast and easy compare to fancy hotels like Hilton or Ritz Carlton. It was just 8 min away from Union Square and near to main avenues like Broadway and Park Ave. Also it had a lot of good restaurants around there, so that i could have beer or wine in the night time near the hotel. But the problem was the hotel itself. I couldn't get to sleep 2 nights in a row. Some crazy people next door made noise all night long in the aisle. Damn it was horrible! I was so tired from walking around the metropolitan and I needed peaceful rest at least for 5 hours for the next day. I called the front desk for more than 5 times but it was just for that moment. Those crazy people made noise over and over again. It irritated me a lot. They were yelling at each other and kept slamming the door all night long, seriously. And do you wanna know worse thing than that? I went to the front desk after that first night and told them that I had trouble sleeping the other night and if it's happening again, i will call the police. And the person in the front desk made mock of me. His attitude toward thecomplaining guest was totally wrong. I got more angry after talking with him. I felt so frustrated. And the same noise making happened again. Also, the card key that they serve was so bad in quality. I tried to open the door for 15 min and it didn't work. So i went up to the front desk and changed the card key to total new one, but it didn't work either! I've had to change my card key 3 times. And whenever I tried to watch TV, it kept shutting down the channel several times. Maybe it was because of the weak signal from the station, but it's their problem. It was so horrible when they shut down TV for a couple of minute when the show was at the peak. But they had some good sides. Even though it's sharing bath for people who choose to stay on the floor which doesn't have private bath, it was clean enough not to make people feel gross about it. Besides the location of it and cleaness of the hotel, my experience in Hotel 17 was horrible. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone if that person can't afford a little bit more expensive hotel or doesn't give a [--] to this kind of crap. I will never stay in Hotel 17 again. I mean it!

Reviews.Title: “A step up from a staying at a Hostel”
Reviews.Author: teut0nic
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 feels like you've just entered some kinda surreal Jim Jarmusch movie, where the hotel check in person chain smokes behind a glass window and theres ghosts in the the hallways. After finding a decent rate online of just under $60 a night, which is a steal for NYC, we got a great top floor unit facing out on the street. This might've been since I stayed a summer after 9/11, so hotels had dropped their rates to get more travelers in the door. The beds were pretty uncomfortable, the baths and showers were european style - shared and the doors never seemed to close right because they were crooked. The place had a lot of character, the wallpaper was kinda out of control with its pin stripes. The TV never worked for the 3 nights were there. But on the plus side, it was clean and the Gramercy Park near by was nice to walk to. Its pretty close to everything as well -- especially the subways. All and all for the price it gets 3 to 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 17 historic and interesting”
Reviews.Author: nkearns
Reviews.Content: Although I only gave it a score of 3 - this hotel in Midtown Manhattan was a pleasant surprise! The ONLY reason I didnt give it 5 is because of 3 of the front desk workers. One worker (James) is wonderful and accomidating, but the other 3 who worked in the evenings were absolutely terrible and aloof. We were nervous about the "bathroom down the hall" but it was completely a non-issue. Beautiful bathrooms, rarely had to wait, completely private, and SPIC AND SPAN CLEAN! AVOID rooms with a 20 in it (520 - 620 -720) because they are literal CLOSETS - the "double" bed in these rooms are actually SUper singles and NOT DOUBLES> however we also stayed in the room with an 03 (603 and 703) and they are WONDERFUL double -doubles - great rate for a double/double and lovely room - large and spacious. (the 01 rooms are the best SINGLES 501-601-701) James continually tried to move us to nice rooms, and the other incompetants would move us back - so frustrating- if you arrive late they WILL give your room away and give you whatever is left over. I even called the day before we arrived and confirmed that we would arrive at 11:30pm and they STILL gave away our doubl/double and popped us into a triple (SO VERY SMALL) and somehow fit a roll away- a miserable night - no where to walk or put our luggage. But then moved to 603 by James in the Morning. -we had to check out when friends left and move to a double room - and James assigned us a great room when we left early in am - but - YOU GUESSED IT- the other guy GAVE THAT ROOM TO SOMEONE ELSE -that was the night my daughter and I spent in 620 basically a CLOSET! so miserable - we later moved back to 720 when our friends retruned. But all in all - aside from the fact that the decor looks like Disney's TOWER OF TERROR (we all agreed on this) - I guess that just adds to its charm :) - we had a pleasant stay (other than the closet) -= 3 blocks from the L train -and about 5 blocks from Union Square subway and some pretty fun shopping. A great bargain too. I would definately stay here again - the rates are great. HOWEVER if I were arriving late - I think I woudl call about 3-4 times during that day - fromthe airport - when I arrived etc... to make sure they hold a GOOD room for me - because there are some not- so -spacious rooms. But the hotel is very clean - and when you talk to James at the desk- you know he is listening.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: didyFlorida
Reviews.Content: What a delighful surprise Hotel 17 turned out to be. The hotel is old world charm with beautiful woodwork. My single room was small but adequate. The room, baths and hotel were very clean. I never had to wait to use the bathroom. The bathrooms were extremely clean and you never saw any sign that anyone but you were using them. Note -the mattress was extra firm ,there is a window unit air conditioner in each room -a little loud, but nothing that ear plugs couldn't drown out. My room had a small safe, a TV, nightstand, desk and area to hang clothes. Rooms well insulated you couldn't hear neighbors or their TV's. Very nice and affordable. Beautiful neighborhood right off of 3rd, 3 blocks to Union Square subway , Grammercy Park & NYU. SAFE. Lots of Europeans were staying in the hotel. GREAT VALUE I will definitely stay here again! Oh and don't listen to the reviewer who said "Bugs" never saw a one -either on the floor, walls or my crisp clean white sheets! Thank goodness I read all of the reviews from other satisfied guests.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay again”
Reviews.Author: LysaJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at Hotel 17 and we were very pleasantly surprised. I had not expected much as we only paid around $150 a night and with all the stories you here about cheap New York hotels I was actually a little apprehensive about what we might find. When we arrived the man at checkin was quite pleasant and then we made our way up to the 6th floor in the small, but very nice lift. From what I can tell there are no rooms with private bathrooms. Each floor has 4 bathrooms and they were clean everytime I went in and never had to wait. Our room was small but not too bad. We had a view of the top of the Empire State Building from our window. It had a dressing table, basin and mirror, quite large wardrobe with a tv. We even had room on the floor to have two bags accessible. For the price this hotel is an absolute bargain and I really liked the neighbourhood. 3 small blocks from the subway and restaurant and diner just down the street. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: Amer0704
Reviews.Content: May 2008, I was pleased with my stay at Hotel 17 at 225 E. 17th Street in New York City (Gramercy Park). The hotel is clean and well cared for. The location, being in a residential section, especially appealed to me. There was easy access to public transportation; easy access to eating establishments, and those corner fresh fruit vendors. My room was small, but clean and well cared for by the staff. The bed was comfortable. The advertisements speak of a "shared bath." I feel that is not quite accurate. There are two lockable separate private baths per hallway instead of in-room bathroom. That did take some getting used to. One bath had a toilet, sink, shower, and another had a toilet, shower. The baths are furnished with toilet tissue, but everything else you need you need to bring with you each time. Packing a roll or two of paper towels would be great to bring with you. Very seldom was anyone in those baths when I needed them. If one really needed into a bath, one could always go to another floor. The hotel places your towels in your room, along with soaps. My room had a window (but no view) twin bed, phone, clock, small tv, desk/chair and two night stands, lamp but no official closet, bring your own clothes hangers. If you read in bed bring your own reading light. I would certainly stay there again and do recommend it to anyone considering this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spot for a Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: lenehan20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. It does not have extras that big hotels would have, and it does have shared bathrooms, but the hotel is extremely clean, the desk staff is pleasant and knowledgeable, and the location is wonderful. It is less than 3 blocks from Union Square and it is located on a quiet street. I would highly recommend this for the budget traveler who wants to stay in Manhattan in a clean and safe hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: lebaobab
Reviews.Content: I really loved my stay at Hotel 17. The staff were helpful and funny, the rooms were charming and clean, and the shared bathrooms(which I had worried about) were clean and always available when we needed them. The neighborhood exceeded our expectations and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: SweetGirl505
Reviews.Content: I was VERY pleased with my stay at the Hotel 17. Being a simple farm girl, I was somewhat hesitant to stay anywhere except a well-known hotel. However, this was very affordable and had good reviews so I decided to give it a try. It was excellent. Yes - the rooms are very old and somewhat small. But to me, that made the whole place unique and charming. Everything - the rooms and the bathroom, was very clean. The bathroom was so clean - almost to the point of being sterile! The only downside is that (and this is probably my fault), I was under the impression the bathrooms were dorm-style, with separate stalls and showers. In fact. the bathroom is actually just one small room with a toilet, shower and sink. But once again - it was very clean, and of course, there are more than one on a floor. There are also private sinks in the rooms so you never have to leave to brush your teeth, etc. I never felt unsafe in the neighborhood or in the hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, quaint, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanzaman
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in I thought this hotel was outstanding!! From the charming decor in the lobby right down to the extremely handsome blonde Desk Clerk or Front Desk Manager that works in the daytime. The room was small and very basic, however, it was super clean. I don't believe the the review that someone said they had a room with bedbugs. The daytime Desk staff are extremely helpful and very professional but the nightime Desk Clerks are perhaps the worst I've ever seen, they talk on their cell phones all the time in a loud, I assume( Arabic language), completely disregard customers, are completely useless for any information whatsoever, and their extremely rude and short when you ask them something. Its better to avoid them all together if you can. All in all I had a great stay, I would highly recommend this place to anyone who is seeking a lower priced hotel which is hard to get these days. The area is really super!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: uninvisible
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after looking for a cheap hotel. We were happy to go into a hotel with shared bathrooms as long as we had our own room. The bathrooms were always clean, and shared 1 between 5 rooms. We had a spacious triple room which had plenty of space, and wasn't too hot as reported by other reviewers. We also didn't have any problems with our online reservation, and arrived at 9pm at night to find our room available and ready for us. room has a free safety deposit box, and in room sink. Lobby was quaint and clean, and the hotel is in a really safe nice neighbourhood not far from a good subway station serving almost all of manhattan. Easily walkable to Flatiron and Times Square. Would definatly recommend this to other budget hotel speakers.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Blixa
Reviews.Content: Although I am surprise what little one gets in New York as compared to London or Paris. Hotel 17 was dark, depressing and reminiscent of the 1930s Great Depression. I am glad I only had to stay one night. Shared bathroom, tiny sink in tiny room. Plastic cover on matress - feels like your sleeping on an old man's diaper. One unreliable lift for all the rooms (about 80?). They also have lodgers, so be prepared for strange characters roaming the halls. If you're really cheap like me and only staying one night - you'll survive. Otherwise, splurge and stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: burleigh7
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly Surprised...Cape Cod, Massachusetts,USA initially searched for a reasonably priced hotel in NYC with startling results, culminating in our decision to try this shared bath hotel due to its low rate and good customer reviews. We had no problem with our online reservations, which we had confirmed. We found the small lobby charming in an old world way-and a bit dim with dark carved wood work, picture frames and wallpapers. The elevator was a treat, beautifully ornate wood, although can be quite a wait. Since we were on the 8th floor, only our 17 yr old took the stairs each time. Had a European feel,and in fact, most of the guests were European.The desk person commented that our room (#808 - triple, non-smoking) was particularly nice, so we don't know if its indicative of others. But, we were pleasantly surprised by its decent size, encompassing 1 double and one twin bed with plenty of room to spare. (Had stayed in a much smaller room at a Comfort Inn during a previous stay in NYC). The mattresses were comfortable, the linens clean, the carpeting appeared newish, the in-room sink a bit cramped in its alcove. We had 2 large windows offering great views of neighborhood life. We needed to run the air conditioner the whole time, but it never got too cold-so don't know what it would have been like in the room if it was really hot out. Our big fear, the shared bath, was just a minor inconvenience. 4 rms shared 1 bath. Using the shower after 8 am might necessitate a short wait, but all in all, no problems. And as everyone has been saying, the bathrooms were immaculate, bright and newly tiled. Need to remember to bring soap/towel each time, not just for showering... It would be great if management would wall mount antibacterial hand cleaner.It's location was fine if you don't mind some walking. 3 nice parks nearby, lots of decent,reasonable restaurants. As a family of three, we often took a taxi, costing only a little more than a subway. I would return, although we might check out their sister facility -Hotel 31-next time, as some have private baths, and its location may be more convenient. I would recommend this to certain others, as not every one would enjoy its old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Your Expectations Low”
Reviews.Author: capewanderlust
Reviews.Content: This certainly isn't a W Hotel, but if your expectations are low you won't be too disappointed. Our overall opinion was that it was a great location for our needs, a safe neighborhood and reasonably priced for NYC, but I'm still a bit shocked at what $150/night gets you in the city....a tiny room w/ a sink, 4 hangers on an open rack, and a bed that was about as comfortable as a brick...I've been more comfortable camping in a tent, sleeping on the ground than the bed in the double bed in Room 707. Thank God we brought our own pillows!! The room was really stuffy and smelled mildewy. It completely lacked any air circulation. We put the AC on from time to time, but the room definitely had a dankness to it. I would have prefered being able to open the window than the AC. Our room was fairly quiet, except for the banging pipes which seemed to happen just a couple of times during the night. It was very hot, particularly for April, and again...the bed was awful!!!! We stayed two nights and on the second night my kidneys didn't hurt as much as the first night. I also learned to stay on my back and not my side to avoid my shoulder going numb, but I don't know if I could have taken a third night...and I like a firm mattress. The shared bathrooms were always immaculately clean, and I never had to wait, although it would have been nice if they had a soap dispenser and paper towels to dry your hands. Be prepared for a cold shower!!! The front desk staff wasn't particularly friendly or helpful. We booked the room online, but still had to sign a credit card slip, and a second time when we checked out. I'm waiting to get our bill to see if we were over charged. If you're looking for a comforable, charming, hotel with great service, this isn't it. If you're looking for a decent place under $200 in the Union Square neighborhood, Hotel 17 will do. Would I go there again? Probably not. I'm thinking it might be worth the extra $100/night to stay at a W hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception”
Reviews.Author: BirdyEdwards
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at Hotel 17. Yes it was hot...I opened the window. Yes it was coffin like. I slept like a baby. Yes the same car alarm went off every morning so we didn't need an alarm clock. The desk clerk's recommendation of the Sunburst cafe for breakfast was spot on. Only a 2 minute walk. Breakfast for $4.95 and that included a small coffee, and all the atmosphere you want..or you could watch CNN on the big screen TV. Union Square was 5 minutes away for the subway. You could be at Times Square in 25 minutes. We walked down into Greenwich Village. Comfort level day or night was good. I got a kick out of the elevator, and my wife would race me down the stairs from the seventh floor and always beat me. There were no surprise charges on the bill. The bathrooms were always clean and accessible. Value for the money is my opinion. Birdy Edwards Winnipeg

Reviews.Title: “If you've always want to go to NY, Hotel 17 is great”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgent54321
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed Tue-Fri (3 nites) at Hotel 17 in March 2008 to celebrate my 27 birthday & loved it. Our room was spacious, with a double bed, vanity, sink, clock radio, phone, & a coat-closet like nook w/hangers. Our view looked out to other large buildings in the neighborhood. Normally the bed would be too hard for my husband but he was so exhausted every nite he didn't care. TV channels are limited. I know you get the local news, public access, TBS, & Bravo. It is not like a spa or resort (like the W down the corner), but was better than a lot of Ramada Inns/Comfort Inns I've stayed in. And the location can't be beat. The restroom was 2 doors down & always *immaculate.* By far the cleanest restroom I found in the city. I showered every nite & had no problem--although being on the 7th floor it did take a little while for the hot water to heat up (pressure was fine). There are 2 restrooms in the left wing & 2 in the right wing of each floor--so if one is occupied, there are 3 more to choose from. The elevator is old fashion, meaning it's also slow. So if you're in a hurry take the stairs. The halls are relatively narrow & dimly lit. Our room was decorated in golds w/green carpet & we were a little disappointed it wasn't as mismatched as the other rooms. The style of the hotel added to the experience for me. The front desk & housekeeping were always nice. The front door is locked @ nite & they buzz you in. The neighborhood is exceptionally safe, quiet, residential. It's around the corner from the police academy & the private Gramercy Park so I'm sure that has something to do with it. Hotel 17 is 1 block away from the Gramercy Cafe that is open 24hrs & has a great lox-cream-cheese-veggies-bagel sandwich. It is 3 blocks away from Union Square & the subway. It is a short walk to the East Village & Greenwich Village. The location is absolutely perfect for me. It caters primarily to European tourists. We ran into a lot of Germans in the hallway. We seen guests who were 20-somethings to 40-somethings. It also has some apartments, with their most famous resident being Amanda Lepore. (My husband ran into her.) The only draw back was no Wi-Fi, but if that means rising the price ($128/nite w/tax, off season) I can survive w/out internet. I would recommend Hotel 17 to anyone who wants the New York experience & a good, clean, affordable room.

Reviews.Title: “Mishandlied reservations are a problem at Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: AgentSix
Reviews.Content: My own reservation (made online) for a three-night stay was handled fine: My room was ready when I arrived, and my stay was pleasant. Room 204, though dark, was immaculate, well-maintained, and quiet. I would have given this hotel a much better rating if the hotel had not misplaced/dropped my friend's reservation, made months ago, also online: when she arrived to check in at 2:00 p.m., the front desk told her there were no rooms available and they had no record of her reservation. She had even confirmed the reservation by phone the week before! In my view that is astoundingly bad managment, bad overbooking practices, or both. (We witnessed another couple with reservations get turned away the same day. Who knows how often this happens?) A room for my friend did open up the next day, but that room (Room 211) was next to a laundry room or something that was so noisy it kept her awake all night. I will not stay at Hotel 17 again, despite its great location and other virtues.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 17 - Budget - ideal for seasoned traveller - other tips”
Reviews.Author: pea13
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews on this hotel could put you off in a flash but please read this before you make your decision. Arriving from Newark, we got a taxi from Penn station to east 17th and 3rd avenue for $11 (inc tip). well worth it after a long flight. the hotel has scaffolding out the front but at no time did we hear any builders etc. We were dealt with pleasantly and efficiently and got a non-smoking room on 8th floor. Now, there have been a lot of comments about the slow lift, but if you have ever been to a hotel in Paris it's the same principle, slow...small but fine. you can walk down the stairs or wait a small amount of time. either way if you have physical difficulties of getting down stairs or are impatient to wait for the lift then hotel 17 isn't for you. the hotel room was fine. now it's not the ritz but neither for the money did i think it was going to be. what we got was mismatched wallpaper, a clean double bed, a sink in the room and lots of storage. perfect. the most annoying thing was the birds on the roof that loved to make a racket and you have your usual urban noises of traffic etc. the bathroom was always clean but at peak times in the morning it will be busy. my advice get in very early or shower late at night. but absolutely clean. top tips - gramercy cafe on 3rd ave is very nice and very reasonable for food. the tips i got for st marks ale house down in st marks is great for food and drink. thirsty scholar on 2nd a great wee bar. molly shebeen's packed, expensive for drink but very reasonable for food. pete's tavern expensive but beautiful. other top tips - take the subway. it's $2 and very safe. didn't use it at night but it's perfectly safe. i would advise that you study the line you need to use as there didn't seem to be many maps in the actual station. other tips- go see a knicks game. now they aren't the best team but the spectacle is out of this world and a great alternative. you can celeb spot and have a good night. beer is expensive tho. and take good shoes to walk in, cause you will walk miles!! for cheap shoes etc try union square DSW and filiene's basement. for a great book store barnes and noble on union square to chill grab a coffee and read! anything else just ask!

Reviews.Title: “normal”
Reviews.Author: Lidashka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great variant for its price. Very low prices for Manhatten. Responsive administrators. And very good location - you can easy get to upper part of Manhatten and to lower. Subway station is in few blocks. It was a little cold in our room, but we asked for a heater and everything was fine:)

Reviews.Title: “Beware bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Biztraveller123
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, but got bit several times on the shoulder by bed bugs. I should have read the previous warnings by reviewers. You pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: Wisland2020
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price (for NYC). We had room 501, which got great light since it faces south on 17th street. 3 different wallpapers - which sounds odd but was very cool. Bathrooms were clean and fresh smelling and had garbage disposal instructions in several languages (abfall en den abfalleimer!). Couldn't find a thing to complain about, and I'll stay here again next time I'm in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and cheap - what more can a girl ask for....”
Reviews.Author: Onyafraggle
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a week staying at Hotel 17 in New York. I found it so hard to know whether to book this hotel based on reading some of the other reviews on this website, they all seemed to contradict each other. I'm a natural born worrier, so naturally I worried..... Turns out, nothing to worry about. Hotel 17 is in a great location for the subway and places to eat and its away from all the hustle and bustle in a safe area. To pick up on some of the things other people have commented on: 1) Yes the lift is a bit slow, but its an antique - and why is everyone always in a hurry. 2) The desk staff were generally very helpful, apart from one 'vacant' guy, but I guess some people aren't born with customer service skills - he needs to work on acknowledging people. None of them were rude though. 3) Bed bugs - load of rubbish, I saw no evidence of them. 4) Shared bathrooms were nothing to worry about as they were always spotless and there was always plenty of hot water even after everyone else in the building had showered. 5) The central heating - our room was always warm enough even when it snowed, there were only 2 nights when it was making a funny hissing noise, but not loud enough to keep us awake. If you're expecting the Ritz then you're going to be dissappointed, but I think its great value for money (about £180 for 7 nights). Tips for food places - go downtown from the hotel along 1st or 2nd Avenue a few blocks and there's loads of places. To sum it up - I wouldn't suggest coming here on a romantic weekend (unless you're on a really tight budget) as the ecclectic decor may put you off, but as a young female student it suited perfectly. Here is a pic of the bathroom, in case you want a peek. Thanks for reading my review, I hope it helped you make your decision - enjoy your holiday - I did!

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: rallybug
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends had a triple at Hotel 17 for the first week in Feb this year, and found it a great place to stay. The room was large, clean and comfortable, the shared facilities were in great shape and the staff were all friendly and helpful. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone travelling on a budget, and the position is great with a good diner and bar nearby (Gramercy Diner and Still bar), and only a couple blocks from Union Square station. All in all, a great time was had

Reviews.Title: “A BIG mistake”
Reviews.Author: BONDGIRL28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week after a mishap with my company left me without a reservation during the one of the busiest travel weeks in New York. Boy, what a mistake! No matter how you crack it folks...this place is a DUMP! Not a hotel..but a rooming house for transient men. As a single female I did not feel comfortable and didnt sleep a wink. Why Why Why I didnt read the reviews on TripAdvisor before booking! There are certainly better places to stay in the city for $109. The carpet and drapes stunk too and It took me a week to get the smell out of my luggage which I stupidly placed on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No frills”
Reviews.Author: boomerz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 17 was a great deal and had an excellent central location. The large room and shared bathrooms were very clean. We never had to wait to use the shower or toilet. The hallways are narrow, and the lobby is small but the hotel is great for travelers on a budget. Don't expect a lot of service/interaction with staff. Bed was not the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Most of the other guests we encountered were young Europeans. The Larchmont further downtown could be compared to this hotel. Between the two, I'd say that Hotel 17 is in better condition, although I preferred the Larchmont's Village location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Southern_Brazil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights there in 2006. The hotel is very clean and we didn´t have any problem with the shared bathroom. The hotel is located in a very pleasant and calm area, near the subway, nice coffee shops, the green market. We will surely stay there again. Tip: If you are coming from JFK by subway, remember to drop off at the 3rd Ave x 14th St station. You ´ll be only 3 blocks away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, quiet, small”
Reviews.Author: JFPARKER
Reviews.Content: I went to New York City for a two-day seminar and needed a mid-price place to stay not far from Cooper Union. I found Hotel 17 through Hotels.com and it seemed like just what I wanted -- something with a little more character than bland, joyless franchise motels but not overpriced, overdone, corporate conglomerate hotel chains. Hotel 17 was just right. Reception was polite and courteous at check-in. The room was on the small side, with a window but not a view. There was a desk, dresser and closet. The single room shared a bathroom, which was down the hall a couple of doors. I did not have a problem with the bathrooms being occupied, nor were they ever in bad shape. The elevators were fairly quick and quiet. The hotel is a bit dank and cramped -- it's an older building -- but overall the place is kept tidy, clean and seemed competently managed.

Reviews.Title: “Charm & Character”
Reviews.Author: MrsSixx96
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at Hotel17...it's not a luxurious hotel but it has got charm and oodles of character - not to mention a great location. Again the room was spotlessly clean on arrival, bathrooms were kept clean throughout our stay and front desk staff were helpful. We booked through Expedia and had no problems whatsoever with our reservation. Hotel17 is not really a romantic getaway - for that try the nearby Second Home on Second Avenue. Instead, I would recommend Hotel17 to singles or friends traveling together. Check out the East Village, St Marks Place, Alphabet City, Union Square....from there get on the subway and go downtown. This is the best city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, not noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Razestar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was what we needed to explore New York on foot. Close to Union square and the huge wholefoods market there where we always got our breakfast and with a starbucks within 3 minutes away it was a great location. We asked for a twin non-smoking room and that's what we got, at the back of the building high up so we had space for our four suitcases and did not get interrupted by any traffic/late night drunken noise whatsover (except for the occasional siren but where in NY will you not hear that?) Great place to stay and reasonable for New York.

Reviews.Title: “no room at the inn!”
Reviews.Author: multipurpose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the hotel at 1am on 2nd Dec after taking a taxi direct from the airport. I had confirmed the booking by email and phone, informing the hotel that we would be arriving around 1am due to the time of our flight. I had even phoned 24 hours before arrival to make sure it was not a problem arriving at that time. When we arrived the guy on reception (JOHN - see other comments about him on other posts) said that our room had been given away as we had not arrived by 6pm and that the hotel was totally full. I explained to him that I had checked that it would be ok to arrive at this time, but he said he didn't know anything about that. (At no point did he apologise for the hotel's mistake.) After a while he made a call to hotel 31 (sister hotel on 31st street) and said we could go there for the night instead. Again no apology. I asked how would we get there. He said we could hail a taxi outside. I asked how would we pay for the taxi. He gave me $5. It cost $8. Still no apology. A disgraceful experience all round. We would not receommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: globaloutlook
Reviews.Content: Really liked the European hotel style,Nice woodwork and funky lift. The personnel seemed relatively friendly and competent. The hotel was clean, quiet and well located. Lots of restaurants and a major subway stop just a few blocks away. Our major complaint was a lack of hot water. One morning the shower went from warm to ice cold and stayed that way. The other days it was warm, not hot. We had a room with private bath. At 200$ plus tax one would expect a hot shower.Otherwise the room was comfortable,large enough with coffee maker and decent mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location - Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCfanUk
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel 17 for 5 nights for was generally quite impressed. The service at the lobby was fine, despite reading some bad reviews. Our room (807) was larger than average, so plenty of room to store luggage and many new purchases! The decor was a kitsch mix and quite charming with clashing striped wallpaper and weathered wooden furnishings. I had major reservations about the idea of shared bathrooms, but apart from the morning rush it was never occupied. I would avoid room 806 though - its door is directly opposite the bathroom and I should imagine it's quite noisy, especially as the walls seem to be paper thin. In terms of the location - this hotel is fab and has plenty of great places to eat/drink within walking distance. Try the cocktails at 'Olives' on Park Avenue for chic start to any evening. I would happily recommended Hotel 17 if nothing else but for it's location and price (it was very cheap) but 4 words of advice for anyone thinking of staying here - BEWARE THE BED BUGS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: helen0782
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel 17 for me and my boyfriend after recommendations from friends and positive reviews from this site, as well as finding a great rate for it at hostelbookers. Just wanted to echo all the good comments on here - this is a great value hotel in an excellent location, and we felt really comfortable here. was a bit nervous about it before arriving,as was not sure about the shared bathrooms and while our priority was location and price, we also wanted to somewhere that we could relax in after a day out in the city. We were not disappointed - had a really lovely, big room (603) with an extra bed in even though we just booked a standard double, which was clean, light, with a decent TV and lots of charming furnishings! We never had to wait to use a bathroom which was always kept clean, the nearby subway at union square is very handy for all parts of the city, and we were able to walk easily to the east and west villages, lower east side etc for all the good bars, shops and restaurants . There were a couple of minor flaws - when we first arrived the service was a little surly, and it would have been nice to have access to a proper bath as well as a shower (there were no taps on the bath). But these are very minor details - overall we loved the hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to stay in new york who dont want to blow their budget on overpriced hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: chillout1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel seeing the good reviews and was not disappointed. The hotel is very clean, friendly staff and even though there are shared bathrooms there is never a problem with cleanliness. This is a budget hotel, it is essentially a place to sleep so don't expect anything other than that. However there is luggage storage and ample information on hand regarding New York. The hotel is in a central and nice area, the union square or 3rd ave subway stations are only a few blocks away. There is also a nice cafe serving huge amounts of food on the corner of 3rd ave. If you want a cheap quality hotel then this is it. If you also book way in advance you also get good prices. If I am coming back to New York in the future then I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location - clean and comfortable too”
Reviews.Author: Myffanwy
Reviews.Content: After staying in the super touristy-expensive Midtown Manhattan, Hotel 17 was a welcome change. Walking distance to Union Square, the Subway, The East Village, and short taxi/subway rides to SoHo, Chinatown, and further downtown made this hotel the perfect one for a couple of 30+ travellers on a budget. Do not expect the Ritz - the rooms are clean, quirky and comfortable. The slightly noisy aircon was worth being comfortable, and the TV provided entertainment when we wanted to zone out and relax. Bathrooms were always clean, and although there was sometimes a wait, the fact that there are 4 on every floor meant that if you were desperate you could always go to the next floor up or down. Overall, we had a great stay, and would definately recommend this for travellers on a budget who dont need all the bells and whistles. The Ice machine on the first floor was also a good feature, considering that there are no mini-fridges in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jdaries
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom had nice, new fixtures and furniture. High ceilings, wood paneling. Good location. Only downside was a noisy, hot radiator at the head of the bed. Was there during blizzard and hotel was very accommodating with letting us extend our stay and not changing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, confortable”
Reviews.Author: Jon12345
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, bedrooms are really clean, also shared bathrooms. We felt really confortable!

Reviews.Title: “It could have been perfect...”
Reviews.Author: MereteJ
Reviews.Content: There is so much to like about this hotel: It is cheap for New York, it is very centrally located and there are many good diners, restaurants, supermarkets, etc. nearby. I will definitely stay here again, but the next time I will be sure to mind two things: 1) Stay clear of room 204 (it has a private bathroom) The room is very close to some kind of "AC-unit"/generator-thing located in an alley below the window next to the bed and it continually makes so much noise that it is completely impossible to sleep in the room - and I am not usually squemish about this. It sounds as if a car is running right next to the bed! The guy who manned the desk the night we arrived acted oblivious to our complaint about this, although I cannot possibly believe that no one has complained about this before. The following morning the very nice and helpful young man, James, moved us to a different and very satisfactory room, though - room 316. The air conditioning in the room was loud, but this seems to be the case everywhere in the hotel. 2: Stay clear of their car service They will rip you off big time. Upon arrival at your chosen destination they will charge you a much larger amount of money than you were informed the service would cost at the hotel. Upon refusal to pay their outrageous prices (we were charged $15 more than agreed upon with the hotel for our drive to JFK), they attempt to intimidate you into handing over the cash.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but beware”
Reviews.Author: SFStanley
Reviews.Content: Firstly, they gave away our room, even though we had booked weeks in advance and had called them the day we were to arrive to confirm. The man on the front desk called John was extremely rude and suggested we lied about calling. It was a nightmare, especially as this was 2 am after a long flight. He had no sympathy and could not have been more unhelpful. He didn't once apologize either. We felt completely unwelcome. We ended up at their sister hotel (Hotel 31) paying more that first night. We were back at Hotel 17 for the rest of our stay and things were fine after that. The guy on the front desk during the day is clearly more adept at dealing with the public. His name is James and he is very nice and helpful. He suggested a good breakfast place nearby called Sunburst (18th and 3rd). The room (623) was a good room to have - quite big for NYC and quiet. Two windows. Shared bathroom (they all are). However, I can imagine some of the rooms are noisy being close to the bathrooms or near the doors from the elevators. I also hear that they are mostly small rooms - so ask for 623! This is the sort of place where the enjoyment of your stay depends on the room you happen to have. And watch out for John on the front desk. If he is still there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: suzannesb
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed in Hotel 17 for 5 nights. We had a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. Sharing a bath was never a problem and was always clean. We had a room with two twin beds and the room was larger than the double bed rooms that we saw. The location was was great and close to the subway. I would stay here again, plus the $ was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “tiny room but it was comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Aeger
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced hotel in Manhattan, New York? Yes it does exist, but it was never going to be too flash either. My room was small, very small, but still quite comfortable, and I like my comfort. I got a single room with only a sink, the bathroom was a share down the hall, but since there was 2 of them I never had to wait and it was clean and everything worked. Everything was clean and neat. The hotel is in a quiet street and not too far from the nearest subway station and one could even walk to Union Square without too much effort. Reception was pretty uninspiring, but I had nothing to complain about. A/C in the hallways was practically non-existant ( i was there in summer), the A/C unit in my bedroom actually worked thank God. Next time in New York, unless I win the lottery, I shall stay in Hotel 17 again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: DerekinCanada
Reviews.Content: Our party of six stayed in three rooms at the Hotel 17 for five days over the Labour Day weekend. It’s hard to add anything new to the posts below, but I’ll reiterate that it’s a comfortable, clean, well located, and well priced hotel in midtown Manhattan. Everything is a little worn around the edges, and perhaps the wallpaper and carpet don’t match, but everything is well maintained and very clean. It feels a bit strange to use a shared bathroom, but pretend you’re in a dorm room in university, or at the office – it’s really not much different than that. Fortunately, the bathrooms are kept scrupulously clean, and I always found one free when I had to use it. Some of the rooms are quite spacious and bright, while others are not much bigger than the double bed squeezed into them. The ceilings are twelve feet high, so even the small rooms do not feel claustrophobic. If you don’t like your room, ask to be moved. There is only one elevator which is rather slow, so this is a good chance to get fit and use the stairs. During our stay the elevator actually broke down one night and the fire department had to rescue a passenger. The elevator was up and running the next day. In my short stay I found it to be a quiet, and safe neighbourhood. The Gramercy Diner located two minutes away at 3rd Ave and 17th is an excellent place for breakfast. The major subway station at Union Park is an eight to ten minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to public transport”
Reviews.Author: anzac1
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to stay. Close to Union Sq station on the subway, which makes getting almost anywhere really easy. Lots of cheap food options and a good quality supermarket (whole foods at union square). Union sq also has a farmers market 4 times a week which has lots of good food. The hotel itself is pretty run down. It trades on the fact that Madonna stayed there once and Woody Alan made a movie there. This hasn't help the dated decore, old furnishings, flaking plaster and tiny bathrooms (which are shared!). We stayed 8 days and usually had no problem getting a bathroom in the morning or evening. The room has it own hand basin and towels were supplied, but you had to ask for fresh ones (see below). The room had aircon which was very loud but kept it cool. In fact the noise of the aircon help drown out the noise of the street and other residents slamming doors. The bed was reasonably firm and the room was only made up in the mornings if you specifically asked for it, otherwise the maids wouldn't go near it. Reception staff were typical of most US hotels in the budget range. Courteous but don't ask too many questions as it just annoys them. Usually they looked bored when you spoke to them and their responses were lacking any enthusiasm. Overall, the hotels location is it's saving grace. Great for anyone wanting to experience Manhattan, but don't expect the Ritz when you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Tkyle
Reviews.Content: We would have to agree with past reviews about Hotel 17. Perfect budget hotel, very clean, well kept, no problems whatsoever with shared bathrooms (first time we had tried this) always clean and available. Three of us (Mom daughter and friend) stayed in a triple room, beds were clean and comfortable, room enough for three of us plus luggage and shopping. (There was a sink/vanity in our room and towels/toiletries were there, not in the bathrooms) We knew what to expect in the way of decoration from past reviews and hotel photos! After three busy days of sightseeing and shopping we didn't even notice the funky wallpaper! The hallways (quite narrow upstairs) and front entrance are clean and well kept, desk staff courteous and helpful. The elevator is a work of art! The Gramercy diner is at 17th and 3rd and is open 24hrs, good inexpensive food. We also enjoyed a dinner at Mumbles at the S/E corner of 17th/3rd, just south of this is a store/deli which serves coffee/tea/juice/bagels etc for breakfast to go. Neighbourhood is very pleasant, quiet, easy walk to Union Sq for subway. Overall great stay, good value, we will go back, it's a hotel with lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “great location budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazychets
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right next to the Empire state building, brilliant for a week in NYC, great location for shopping, I stayed here by myself and felt safe and secure. ok reception staff and no problems throughout, didnt spent alot of time there so fitted the purpose fine, got a double bed so even more happier, tiny room but hey i didnt mind!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and perfect”
Reviews.Author: dave_nix
Reviews.Content: this was my 1st trip to the big apple. i stayed here for 6 days in the very hot month of august and is well worth checking out if you are on a budget, my room on the 5th floor was small but i wasn't in it much and had a shared bathroom(there are 2) which i never had to wait to use there is a small sink in the room and an air con unit which even though was noisy was absolute bliss in temps over a 100 .the hotel is situated about 5 minute walk from union square and is very easily accsesable to the subway which compared to london is very cheap. with the money i saved staying here i had more money to spend on the more important things like clothes!!! the room was clean and was cleaned every day what more can you ask for, if you intend to stay in your hotel room you are missing out on the whole nyc experience.what more can i say, stay here save money spend more on yourself you know you deserve it.i will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I traveled alone with the kids, good value and felt safe in a strange city”
Reviews.Author: robinlb
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to NYC and was unsure of what to expect. I needed to save money so booked a room based on reviews on tripadvisor.com. The room was exactly as I expected. Slightly worn, but more than comfortable. Air conditioning worked just fine, enough tv channels to satisfy, and a very clean bathroom, always available. A very short walk to a grocery store (small), we took cabs mostly, but did try the subway and walked a bit. The staff was able to accurately answer any questions we had right away. Not overly friendly, but did the job more than adequately. For the money, I was more than satisfied. Had a great time and the kids (5 and 7 yrs old) want to go back. No disappointments here!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: BlancheIowa
Reviews.Content: For our purposes, this hotel was just right: good location close to Union Square, comfortable beds, quiet room with quiet air conditioning unit, pleasant, helpful front desk staff. The room was slightly shabby, but great for the price. We have stayed in some incredibly small rooms in non-chain, budget hotels. Our room here was a triple and provided adequate space for the three of us (husband, wife, adult child) to spread out. You have to hang the "maid service" card on the door to have your room made up or get fresh linens, and that service was a little on the slow side. We shared a bath (sink in room) and didn't have trouble with access, but the bath did start needing some attention before it got it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMathTeacher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 17 from July 13 - 16 and had a great experience. The staff was helpful, the rooms clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathrooms were kept immaculate and were always available.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedDwarfSr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my last visit to NYC for a gathering of the Oscar Wilde Society of America. I was on my own in New York and this place was ideal. The hotel is charming and the staff is friendly and helpful. It's located in a very quiet location near Gramercy Park and the walk to Union Square to catch a subway was fairly close and convenient. I was worried about having to share a bathroom, but I never had any trouble or wait and the bathrooms were very clean. Yes, it's small and funky, but it was perfect for me and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “You know what you'll get”
Reviews.Author: Ducati40
Reviews.Content: Read the tripadvisor review and that’s exactly what you will get! Small rooms, a bit worn out as well. Bathroom in the hall. Central. Convenient. No great hotel but location is good and the sunburst café just around the corner is excellent! If you don’t plan to stay much in your room anyway this is a good offer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for $$ hotel in downtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: HappyKiwi2007
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 is a great value for money hotel in downtown Manhattan. I narrowed my choices of hotels within my budget to 3 and used TripAdvisor to make the final choice. The hotel is in a great location 2 blocks away from Union Square so using the subway was easy. We were close to most attractions some even in walking distance. Cafes around the vicinty were great and the area is definately upper-class, at no time did we feel unsafe even after attending shows and travelling on the subway at 11pm. A priority for me was cleanliness of the rooms and shared bathrooms, I was not disappointed. Each floor has 20 rooms and there were 10 rooms on each wing of the floor. With 2 bathrooms in each wing and 4 bathrooms on each floor we never had to wait to use either the shower or toilet. Cleanliness was a priority to the hotel and thankfully the bathrooms were absolutely clean. I saw one of the cleaners cleaning a bathroom and everything was scrubbed down with disinfectant and other aromatic cleaners. Thanks Hotel 17 for providing a fantastic value for money hotel, thanks Tripadvisor for providing this website allowing ndependent review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel for Solo Woman Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Ostrichboneyard
Reviews.Content: First time at Hotel 17 for Memorial Day weekend -- very European style hotel. As other reviewers have noted, the bathrooms were always clean and available. The room is just the right size for one person for a long weekend. Room was clean and quiet, as was the air conditioner. The neighborhood is mostly university and residential. Great mix of people on the streets; I felt safe everywhere. Fantastic value for the money. Only negative I can think of: the property is nearly 5 blocks from the subway. No big deal in nice weather, but may be an issue otherwise. For the courageous: rent a bike at Manhattan Velo (1 block west of Hotel 17). It is the best way to see New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for mid/lower east side in NYC”
Reviews.Author: wasthere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days based on location that was close to conference, etc. It was a good stay - quiet (no joke!) with the shared bathrooms never once being occupied when I wanted to use them. Room decor, as illustrated on the hotel's web site, is a bit ecletic and the total light bulb wattage is mybe 30 lumens- maybe the lack of light helped concela some of zippy wallpaper! Lot of reasonably priced places nearby for a meal as well as a 5 minute walk to Union Sq. with its numerous subway connections.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie99
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheap, no-frills hotel in NYC, Hotel 17 is a great choice! I have stayed at this hotel twice and would definitely consider staying there again in the future. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the quirky atmosphere makes it a fun stay. One disadvantage is that the rooms do not have their own bathrooms. There are sinks and mirrors in each of the rooms, but if you have to use the toilet or shower be prepared to go down the hall to one of the bathrooms(think of it like staying in a house). Despite the fact that other hotel patrons have to use the same toilet and shower, the facilities are kept incredibly clean and I have never had any problems waiting for an available bathroom. The location is also great and puts you right next to Union Square with a close walking distance to the nearest subway.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs in Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: avenueb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel L on March 20, 2007, in room 715. Two days later, I realized I had been attached by bedbugs – some 15-20 bites on my left hips and both elbows, big red circles that itched and itched. I had never encountered bedbugs before, but I showed the bites to my daughter (whose apartment had been infested with them) and she made a positive identification: big red circles lined up – bedbugs walk along the body in a line, biting as they go. When I got home from New York, I called the Hotel 17 to report my experience and to request a refund for my one-night stay. The person at the desk said they’d check and get back to me. When I didn’t hear back I called again, and the person said they hadn’t found any evidence of bedbugs. But I had realized, thinking back on it, that the room had a very strong smell of disinfectant cleaners, which I didn’t smell anywhere else in the hotel – not in the hallway or the bathroom or the lobby. So that made me think that they knew that room 715 had bedbugs, that they’d tried to get rid of them, and that they’d put me in that room knowing that bedbugs were there. When I asked to speak to the manager, the person at the desk wouldn’t put me through. I left several messages asking the manager to call me and he never did. The person at the desk told me that the manager offered to give me a 10% discount on my next visit, which hardly seems like enough to make up for the trauma of being attacked by bedbugs on that visit. I will not return to the Hotel 17 again, and suggest that anyone who stays there should check for evidence of bedbugs before they take the room.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: redpanda30
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in April 2007. We found this hotel pretty easily, and it is on a reasonably quiet and residential street in Manhatten. I was very concerned about sharing a bathroom, and enquired as to the possibility of upgrading to an ensuite, when we checked in. However, I was informed that this was going to be an extra $70 per night, so I decided to make do! I need not have worried though, there never seemed to be anyone in the bathrooms, and I never had to wait, plus they were spotlessly clean, no problem at all. The room while not huge, was pefectly adequate, with a comfy bed, and it was always warm enough. We slept really well, and the street was fairly quiet considering it was New York. Whenever we asked for help from reception they were always obliging and friendly. However, one warning....the hotel were keen to order us their "car service" back to JFK airport, as they claimed you could get over charged in a normal yellow cab. They quoted $56 for the trip, to include toll and tip. Their driver arrived on time, but he demanded money for the toll, and the bill came to $66! We argued that this was not the price quoted by the hotel, but he was having none of it, and I would not be surprised if this is a regular occurance, he was just lucky that we had enough money to pay him, but he was definately trying his luck! I would recommend getting a yellow cab, as these are all on a fixed rate, and there are plenty of them about. Cheaper still, take the subway from Union Square. Overall though, a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Alex71Uk
Reviews.Content: This is a great budget hotel but make sure you don't get stuck in one of the rooms on the four corners of the hotel like we did. The hot water pipe for the whole hotel runs through the room and is right next to the bed. The noise that this makes throughout the night is unbelievable and it is impossible to sleep through it. Opt for a room with a private bathroom and you'll be ok - the hotel is in a great location and the decor and cleanliness is fine - just make sure you're in a room without a hot water pipe if you want to get any sleep!

Reviews.Title: “great central and clean”
Reviews.Author: haddock22
Reviews.Content: quite reasonable cost for new york $85 for a double room.great location just of union square but on a quiet street.lovely atmosphere not fancy but great decor.shared bathrooms but spotlessly clean and never had to wait to use.beds very comfy with tv/dvd player in room.would definately go there again

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: allanmac81
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at this hotel was in March 2007. This was my second time here. Contrary to the bad reviews I have seen for this hotel, I found it to be very good indeed. The hotel is by no means a palace, but you get what you pay for and this was exactly what I needed - a clean, comfortable room. The room was a good size. Lets face it - this is the city that never sleeps so you are hardly in your room anyway. The shared bathrooms were clean, and with four on every floor there was never a queue.
