For anyone who prefers their own bathroom, the hotel offers en-suite in some of its rooms. The hotel staff were all extremely helpful and polite. The location (just off Union Square) is perfect and in my opinion this is the nicest part of Manhattan. You have good subway links at Union Square and you are just a short walk from the heart of Greenwich Village. The square is also an ideal starting point for getting uptown or downtown, either by foot, on bus, or by the Subway. I will definitely return to Hotel 17. (one other thing - its worth checking out Gramercy Cafe on the corner of third avenue and 17th st, about 2 mins from the hotel - excellent service and food). I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: loch2
Reviews.Content: Good value and not a bad location. Rooms are small and very little day light but they are clean and the service is good. Recommend to budget travellers. There is something nice about the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 17 - Will Definately Go Back!!”
Reviews.Author: oldkentroad
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 is great for the budget traveller. My previous experience of staying in NY was horrendous, so it was with a lot of trepidation that I arrived at the hotel. Past experience had let me to be very cautious about what you book on the net and what you actually get can be two completely different things. But not in this case. I was met with complete courtesy at the front desk and help with any queries. I liked this place as it had character and the fact that it could have been the set of some 1950's noir movie also gave it a bit of something extra (believe it was the set for a Woody Allen film as well), but I digress. The room we booked- a triple, was roomy had all the basic essentials, we had to share the bathroom and toilet with the rest of the hall, however we never had to wait and they were always spotless (a sink in the room proved very handy). The hotel was generally quiet, accomodating as we wanted to change our booking dates etc last minute and offered helpful suggestions of things to go see and do. The area is also quite handy, there are some great little restaurants (Joe Juniors Diner I think it's called is fantastic which is just around the corner) near by for food, as well as close to the underground, bars etc... I think you would be hardpressed to be anywhere in NY and not be close to a great bar/area anyways. The only thing that I would mention is the smoking areas in the hotel were a bit unclear. We had a non smoking room, however the hallway we were in did smell very strongly of ciggarette's and there were ashtrays placed along them. This did not bother us hugely, however I can imagine that this would be an issue for some people. All in all the hotel was a bit quirky in its decor, friendly in its service, and provided all the essential basics you look for in a hotel at a very reasonable price. I will be definately going back next time I am in NY. I believe there is a sister hotel, Hotel 31 also located in Manhattan which I have yet to try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ddeviate
Reviews.Content: It's been the first time ive been to NYC, and this hotel made my trip even better! Nice people, great atmosphere, service and location. This will be my top pick in the future! gotta check it out recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: jax1972
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute as had stayed at a terrible place for one night previously. Got to Hotel 17 and were delighted with the whole experience. Very clean, fresh towels and laundry done as and when you request it; staff were friendly and very helpful. The decor is dated, but other than that the rooms were well equipped with a basin, tv, phone, heating etc. Very comfortable and good value for money in comparison to our first hotel. Highly recommend this hotel for the budget traveller(s) or if you want somewhere quaint. The old-fashioned elevator is very cool!

Reviews.Title: “If you want maid service...”
Reviews.Author: RocArt
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel in a fine location (17th and 3rd) and a nice price. One thing to watch out for: if you want maid service---beds remade, new towels and soap etc---be sure to put the door tag out *requesting* it. At most hotels, they assume you want maid service and you have to put out a "do not disturb" if you don't, but here they "assume" (i.e. hoping you will not notice and hence save them money) that you don't want service. There is a little sign on the front desk about this, but I didn't see it when I stayed. Otherwise, no complaints: not unduly noisy, and no need to wait for a (shared) bathroom at any time.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden GEM!”
Reviews.Author: Leighy
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to go to NYC the week between Christmas & New Years. Hotels were outrageouly priced. I did some searching and found Hotel 17 on a hotel/hostle site. The reviews I read were good so we decided to book. We were still a little scared of what we might find once we got there. I had heard of bed bug infestations throughout the city in the previous months. Suffice it to say, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was small but very cute. There was a sink in the room. The bathroom/shower was down the hall. One might think this would be gross but it was immaculately clean every single time i entered. Not a problem at all. The location was terrific also... right near Grammercy Park. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great location at a great price!!

Reviews.Title: “right price”
Reviews.Author: Loisstella
Reviews.Content: okay - so it's a dump...no other way of saying it. It's a charming dump though. I stayed here quite a few times and got to know the staff so now they put me in the 'penthouse' which is the slightly larger, more comfortbale room at the top - it's still got bugs and dodgy bedding. But seriosly - this place is cheap - I read someone paid £120 per night - you paid too much - I have never paid more then $100 - which is about £60. The location is fab. The bathrooms are kept quite clean considering the hotel is pretty much always fully booked. It's by no means glamorous, but I have a soft spot for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonGemma
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute online directly with the hotel for £120 per night. Really quiet room- the only problem was there was no heating, but they did provide a good blanket! Really good shower and hairdrier in bathroom. Great area- very safe walking around at night. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Cyclist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. I prefer the Larchmont for a shared bath hotel. My single room didn't have a sink or toilet. Only one of the two shared baths on my hall had a sink. Initially, I was concerned about that but no one seemed to use the bathrooms. The bathrooms were large. The bed had just flat sheets so they pulled off the mattress and that was the only thing on top of the mattress. The alarm clock was sitting on top of the little TV which caused amazing static on TV. (Cured once I moved the alarm -- I guess I put my electrical engineering degree to good use!) The room I had was very small -- think 2 times the width of a twin bed but was near the back and very quiet. There was no internet available -- no wireless, no wired computer in the "lobby". I managed to pickup a weak signal from a neighbor but I wouldn't count on that. This is definitely not my first choice in hotels but given the difficulty in finding rooms in NYC, it is good to have a long list of acceptable places.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Belongings Disappeared After Room Was Cleaned..”
Reviews.Author: ACM8882
Reviews.Content: Up until this incident I had really enjoyed my time at Hotel 17, but this has to be the worst experience I have ever had overseas (and I am well travelled!). My mother and I booked a trip to NYC and Hawaii for November this year, spending 2 weeks in NY and 12 days in Hawaii. We decided to go budget in NY because everything was so expensive for what you got. A lot of rooms were booked out so the only option was a shared bath, which wasn't so bad anyway. Some people on this website are exaggerating, the staff are not ALL bad. When we arrived James was on the concierge desk and was so helpful and wonderful, and was the same for our entire stay. There was also another concierge who was wonderful, but I didn't catch his name. The hotel is quaint and cosy and very warm inside. Yes there is noise from the outside, but hello you're in NY - the city that never sleeps. I'm a light sleeper, so I just turned on the air conditioning unit at night to drown out any noise. This is what I had an issue with. On about the 10th night of our stay I realised that a pair of boots I had brought with me from Australia were missing. The boots were new and in a shoe box, in a carry bag. For some reason I had this feeling that the cleaners had thrown them out (this was despite very clearly separating the rubbish on one side of the room from the shopping bags which were on the other). It was almost midnight but I went straight down to the concierge and told him that I believed the cleaners had thrown my boots out. His response was basically, "So?". I started to get pretty agitated and demanded that he called someone to find out what had happened. His response was then "it's midnight, there's nothing I can do. You will have to wait until the morning". I told him that there was no way I was leaving until they were found and asked where the rubbish was. He called a staff member located elsewhere and then told me the rubbish was out the back but that nothing could be done until the morning. By this time I was getting rather angry and told him that the rubbish would be gone by the morning and so would my boots, that they were $600, new and that if they weren't found I would expect compensation. This STILL did not provoke a response. After about 15 minutes of this, I ended up having to demand rubber gloves and stood on the sidewalk (not out the back as he had said) rummaging through garbage bags. The concierge was "kind enough" to call some cleaning staff to point out which bags the boots could possibly be in. At no point did they or the concierge help, they stood and watched as I did this. It turned out that my boots were in one of the bags, along with a $30 Christmas card I bought at bergdorf goodman. Since returning I have remembered a few other things that I bought in NY that are missing. I have never been so humiliated or angry in my life. I never received an apology or anything but a bill from him or anyone at the hotel. I would never stay there again or recommend someone to stay there. Mostly I was disappointed because I always make a huge effort to be kind and friendly to people who have jobs in the service industry, and to be treated like dirt in return was the ultimate insult.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: On the side of a mountain in BC
Reviews.Title: “Great for the price.”
Reviews.Author: wattsco
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel 17 in mid October. I had no complaints. All of you who complained about the bathrooms in the hallway or the size of the rooms, do a little more research next time. Just by checking a few places on the internet I was able to get a good preview of what the rooms might be like. Quite frankly for around $120 US a night, Hotel 17 was great. It's in a great location, pretty much in the middle of things. The neighbourhood was good. The place was clean (I could hear cleaning staff doing their stuff all the time during the day). Was the room small and oddly decorated??? It sure was. Could you hear others coming and going, or just moving around the room over??? Sure could. Did it kinda blow having to go into the hallway to have a shower or use the can?? A little bit, yes. Did that seem reasonable to bear for around $120 a night in the greatest city in the world?? One huge YYEEESSSS. If you want to go to New York just to end up complaining about how your room is wallpapered strange or how you have to walk a little bit to one of a bunch of private shower/bathrooms in the hallway, then go back to wherever you came from. You should be spending as little time in your room anyways when you are in New York. The city runs 24/7. Hotel 17 may not be the Waldorf but for around 120 bucks a night it'll give you a good location, a private clean room, private washrooms steps from your door, and tv with cable. If you want more, go blow 300-400 a night somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and cheap - excellent budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Silvery
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 17 with my boyfriend in December 06 for three nights. After having read some negative reviews I half expected to encounter unfriendly staff, bed bugs and cockroaches. After having stayed at the hotel, I wonder where the people having written these negative reviews stayed. This hotel experience was very nice in all respects. Reception staff was friendly, our room as well as the reception rooms were very clean. What I liked very much and what surprised me a lot after having read a review about "bad odours" was the nice, slightly flowery smell that permeated the hotel. Also the hotel was very quiet, the only noise we heard was the cooning of pigeons in front of our windows. Contrary to other reviewers I find the location of the hotel, not far from Union Square, very convenient. All in all the hotel experience was much better than I expected. And it was a comparatively cheap one too!

Reviews.Title: “If You Don't Need a Private Bath, Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: LizDexic
Reviews.Content: I was VERY annoyed that the room that I booked did not have a private bathroom. This is NOT mentioned on their reservations web page of the hotel's web site, and Orbitz does not mention it either. This strikes me as being fairly dishonest. I would not have stayed there had I known that I would have to go down the hall to take a shower. (I paid $150+ per night so it never occurred to me that I would not have a toilet or tub in my room.) The front desk staff is very unhelpful, bordering on rude. There was no possibility of "upgrade." The wallpaper was torn and one wall did not match at all, as if they had run out of the pattern. The lighting was awful, with a single lamp and a dim overhead light in the 12 foot ceiling and a fixture that was like a bare lightbulb over the sink. Very depressing. The only good thing was the location. Even so, the condo conversions going on next door woke us up with the pounding of construction noise. I like Gramercy Park, but next time I'm trying the Park South Hotel in Murray Hill. (This may have been a very nice hotel at one time in the past, but those days are gone.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Princess66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first discovered Hotel 17 a few years ago. Since then we have stayed here several times--excellent location, clean rooms and bath, very helpful staff. Staying there makes us feel like part of the neighborhood when we return.

Reviews.Title: “FUN”
Reviews.Author: jacknoc
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet street... I had a single room (shared bath) facing 17th street. The bathrooms were clean, as was my room... The staff was friendly.. Overall.. I had a great time for $100/ night... I would definately stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Roaches...”
Reviews.Author: JSLAJ
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Hotel 17. It is a very nice little hotel for budget travellers. I liked it enough to return there. But there are also some things I don't like about the place. The worst thing is that this time we spotted several cockroaches in the bathrooms, and also one in our room (thank god it was on the day we were leaving, I don't know how I could have slept there knowing there's a cockroach around). I guess this is quite a normal thing in NYC, but still it felt uncomfortable. This time we stayed on the 6th floor at the back of the hotel. On the way to our room I expected the view to be just a wall of another building, but it was a much nicer view. Also a room with two separate beds was bigger than a room with one large bed that we had last summer. It was a pleasant surprise. I wouldn't be surprised if the hotel had a problem with mold. The room smelled really bad all the time, kind of moist and damp. We were coughing and sneezing all the time. Some reviews say the reception staff are rude. I've never had any problems with them. I would probably return to this hotel if it was for a few nights only, despite the roaches and the possible mold, because I bet you can't find better for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: IHateRebecca
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there 4 nights. No problems whatsoever. I had a double with a private bathroom. It was very quiet, and the room was clean and neat. Front desk staff was friendly. Great location too, 3 blocks from the subway. I'm booking here next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Travelers on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: travelingGs
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel 17 while in Manhattan was a great experience. The hotel has a dramatic yet quirky interior reminiscent of the 1920's. My friend and I stayed in a double room with a shared bathroom and were pleased with our decision to stay at Hotel 17. The East Village/Grammercy area that the hotel is located in is completely safe and mere walking distance to great shopping, food and the subway system. The only minor inconvenience that we experience was that the comforters on our beds were a bit thread-bare. But, really we could not complain for the rate that we were paying. As mentioned in previous reviews, the customer service was not 'amazing' but to be honest the customer service is not great in most of Manhattan. If you are checking in early you can leave your bags in a holding area. The front desk will give you baggage claim tickets to hook onto your luggage and then a staff member from the hotel will lock them up for you. They generally are not keene on letting people check in before their standard 3:00pm check-in time. A key to having a great time in Manhattan and specifically at Hotel 17 is to learn to be flexible and simply get caught up in what this amazing city has to offer. I had such a great time that I am already planning my return trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely architecture and design, lousy customer service”
Reviews.Author: tigressa
Reviews.Content: The property actually is better than i expected in terms of beauty and cleanliness. We loved the dark wood, low lighting and European feel. The rooms are spare but clean and tolerable for the cost. With the exception of one lovely front desk guy from India tho, most the customer service was horrible. Most of the people working at the desk seemed to absolutely hate being there. It was hard to get help with even the most basic problems. But when we had an extra night in NY and every space in the city under $150 seemed sold out, this hotel did the trick, so we're grateful.

Reviews.Title: “hotel 17 rocks”
Reviews.Author: coastfm
Reviews.Content: You might read my review of the commonly owned Hotel 31 as the properties have some similarities. Because only 2 nights were available at 31, I booked 2 nights at 17. There was a price differential-134. per night instead of 100 per night (prices are plus taxes). I would have to say both were ok; very good for this price range, frankly, I didn't know there were acceptable hotels in this price range in NYC. Now I have no excuse not to go. Hotel 17 is slightly better on most scores than Hotel 31. At 17 we got a room in the front, so we did hear honking horns, but not very many. The room was larger and brighter, I want to say the bed was bigger, there was a new air conditioner-useful even the first week in october-, the TV cable channels more interesting. All of these things are probably not worth the extra money if you must be very tight, but I think for me they were. The location is near lots and lots of shops, restaurants of the first order, and everything you go to NYC to do...for example a cab back from Chelsea or the West Village is about 6 or 7 dollars. If you're in good shape you can just walk everywhere and be perfectly happy in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rolieirish
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, we could walk everywhere.The rooms were basic but clean -made up every day and towels changed. The shared bathrooms were spotless and again were cleaned every day, as one would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & good location”
Reviews.Author: Tatterss
Reviews.Content: Room was sparse and the sink took ages to run hot water through, but the room was clean and the shared bathroom was very clean and well equipped. It was clearly a grand hotel in its day and has aged well over the years. The web site directions tell you which station to get off at; do not be tempted to deviate from the directions and walk! The staff were helpful and courteous and was a great location for discovering the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gjh405
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It is small but then again, you are in NYC. I knew it was older and yes, shared bathrooms. No problem, it is very clean and the location is great for walking and lots of dining options in this area. Madona once stayed there and we will again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location...crap staff”
Reviews.Author: Gormanghast
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel quite a few times in the last couple of years. I love the neighborhood. Great walk to Union Square! The Gramercy Cafe is a must stop no matter what time of day! The hotel is older and kind of worn but the rooms are as clean as they CAN be and the shared bathrooms are always SPOTLESS. The STAFF?...avoid them at all costs. Rude, confrontational and mean. I don't ever talk to them but the FEW times I HAD to were bad. So, if you can deal with that this is a good hotel. Too bad management can't do something about their staff to make this a GREAT hotel

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: charlesjhaughey
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with a shared bath. first room I checked into didn't have a sink - make sure you ask for a sink in advance. I was moved to a room with a sink the next night. cool. room was quite small. really quite small (single room). it clearly used to be one room that was split in two. I didn't really care though. I spent the money I saved on other stuff. shared bathrooms were right outside my door and vacant 80% of the time. bathrooms were spotless, new feeling, and very confortable to use. building was nice and inn a very nice part of the city. overall a good budget hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: abostonfriend
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was nice and clean, the staff was horrible. It was not possible to communicate with them and they were not responsive to the needs. I felt like they had no idea about what was going on and they were rude. Yet the hotel is not very close to any of the attractions (i.e. not walking distanceTimes Square), however it's location is sort of in the middle of possible tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 17 for 5 nights in June and were very happy. It's hardly the Ritz and doesn't have the friendliest staff, but was clean and in a quiet street. We had no problems with mice/insects but then again we made sure there was never any food in the room. Air conditioning worked but was very loud. The 1920's style decor was very cool - I want to see the Woody Allen movie that was filmed there now! Best thing about this place is the location. Only 7 minute walk from Union Square subway station and you can just about get anywhere in NYC from there. Union square also has some funky bars and student cafes (check out "Republic").

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: roytheboy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and checked out the reviews before booking. 90% of the reviews were positive and they were correct. The hotel is in a handy location for the subway and lots of restraurants. We paid for a private bathroom which worth the money as we stayed for a week. There was heat wave and the air-conditioning felt like it was saving our lives. All staff were courteous and polite. As for the actual holiday- we will defintely returning to new york, but at colder times of the year. The Heat and humidity was really very difficult, but it did not marr the experience. If I had some advice is make sure you only wear the most comfortable pair of shoes you own, the whole time you are there. And if you walk the same 4 blocks across and 2 blocks up everyday, don't! Take a different route everyday as you will miss some nearby gems of parks and restraurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: attony
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife and daughter on a hot July night in a shared triple. The staff was courteous, the room was very clean, the beds were fine and the air conditioner worked well. There was never a wait for the shared bathrooms. One small problem I encountered at 2:00 a.m. when I got back to my room was promptly attended to by the staff. We plan to make it our regular stopover in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, nice”
Reviews.Author: ariuna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel 17 for four nights during a very hot period in New York and enjoyed a quiet, wonderfully cool and spacious room. We could really relax in here after exhausting days in the city. The room and the bathroom were perfectly clean and seemed to be recently renovated. We never had to wait to get into the bathrooms. It might have been the right decision to book a triple room for two people: We had enough room for everything, including our huge backpacks. A good deal in a nice neighbourhood, just a few minutes to walk to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Really a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gza222
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, lovely rooms, great location right next to Union Square. Staff were friendly, the rooms were clean and of a decent size (ask to see a room first - we stayed on the 7th floor with private bathroom). My only complaint is that the lift was very slow, but we found this at every hotel we've stayed at in NYC. Overall, this is definitely the best value hotel in NYC in our experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel stay, Great location”
Reviews.Author: koalabear2099
Reviews.Content: Overall Hotel 17 is not a bad place to stay. Hotel 17 is about 3 blocks from union square (in midtown manhattan). I ended up paying (after taxes and all) about $110 per night. Not bad given the location. Yes, the rooms are tiny ( I got a single bed room). It is slightly smaller than a dorm room. Keep in mind, that there are shared bathrooms. Every 3 or so rooms shares one bathroom (CAUTION: some of the bathrooms do not have sinks, only shower/tub and toilet); this bothered me (others may be okay with it). The service is quite good. They do provide you with towels, soap, shampoo, etc. Honestly, given the price for the location, I would stay here again. Just keep in mind that this is a BUDGET HOTEL. There was cable TV, the tv was small (13"). Hotel 17 is ideal for the budget traveler. Not bad for New York City :-)

Reviews.Title: “Before we went we had concerns but we had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Susietubbbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel 17 for a week at the end of June/ beginning of July. After having read entries on this website we were paranoid if our reservation had been received but all was fine. We had a room with ensuite bathroom and the room actually looked better than on the website. What was most important to us was the safe we had in our room. The room and bathroom were always perfectly clean, we have not seen any signs of roaches, mice, fleas and apart from the noisy aircon (and some inconsiderate hotel guests on one occasion), it was a quiet stay. The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate. Unfortunately, breakfast was not available in the hotel but we enjoyed a cheap (but plentiful) breakfast from street vendors, which we ate in the Union Squar park. For the colder season, there is also the Gramercy restaurant and supermarkets just a short walk from the hotel. The subway station is just down the road and gives you access to more than one line. If you are into walking, the hotel is positioned perfectly so that you can walk to the Financial District (South) or up to Central Park (North). A great way to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lookin' for fun and feeling...”
Reviews.Author: lyrebird
Reviews.Content: ...grooooooovy! Sumptous yet funky, stylish but affordable. A renovated old hotel with lots of personality. The elevator is old and beautiful - but possibly one of the slowest to wait for in Manhattan. I ended up climbing the four flights to my room (small, but not as small as the Pickwick Arms) 60% of the time. Dark, moody foyer - great if you're coming in a little drunk late at night. It's got an ice machine, and they'll happily look after your luggage until you check in, or until you need to head off to the airport. Very clean place, quiet at the back. The rooms are fairly small, and the room keys are cards that unfortunately resemble the phone cards one purchases to make cheap calls. So the first night I woke up in the throes of jetlag, went for a leak down the hall in one of the spotlessly clean bathrooms, and ended up in my pajamas attempting to get back into my room using my phone card. The guy on the desk obliged me with another one, but he was grumpy. But this is New York. Who cares. Great location Hotel 17. Stuyvesant Park is a good sit, just nearby. And the East Village is a pleasant stroll away as is Union Square. Price is very cheap for this style of hotel, and you really feel good when you walk up the stoop to it. Lots of Germans stay here I noticed (?). The owners have style and they've put it all into this great hotel, affordable, and full of ambience so you feel like you're a traveller in the old fashioned way - you're not just spending money on some characterless joint in Anytown, USA.

Reviews.Title: “Almost great -- if it weren't for the fleas”
Reviews.Author: NotaSucker
Reviews.Content: I found the 17 online, and the great reviews and low rates convinced me to book a room there. The location is fantastic -- close to Union square and in a great neighborhood. Even though the bathrooms are shared, they are kept clean. The room we were first given turned out to smell like cigarette smoke, and we were given a different room right away. The first morning I discovered a horizontal line-shaped stain on my pants -- it originated from the window sill. The dry cleaners a block away knew right away where we were staying -- they seemed to have seen this sort of stain before... The manager was not available to complain about it until after the holiday weekend. The biggest surprise came a day or so after check-in: I was being bitten by fleas. After returning home, the bites got worse, and it seemed I had brought some fleas home with me. In retrospect, I would have been willing to pay twice for a flea-free hotel. By the way, the friend who stayed with me wasn't touched by the fleas. If you think fleas don't like you, and you don't ever press your legs against the window sill while wearing light-colored pants, then you may enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Scadalous - Don't trust confirmed reservation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation directly with the hotel's web site. Received confirmation number; credit card was partially charged. The hotel manager on sight had all of this yet didn't have a room and would not provide or pay for another hotel. Had to take a taxi to over a hour outside of town. Another older couple had the same experience during the time I was there. Stay clear - This is not reliable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Hard_Woman
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my own in this hotel and felt totally safe. The surrounding area is great for food etc. and easy to get to the subway. Shared bathroom wasn't a problem - always clean and didn't have to wait around to get in. The room was very small and basic but clean. If you just want a base in a nice area this is perfect. I've spent more for less. This is really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location in is really good. Lots of thing to do in the near surroundings if you're into Lower Manhattan. The subway is a short walk away. There was nothing major wrong with the hotel itself either. We had asked for a non-smoking room, but were given a smoking one instead. But we didn't even pay attention to it until the next day when we noticed the ashtray. So no cigarette smell what so ever in our room! When we first arrived in our room it smelled odd though, like no-one had been there for a really long time. But the smell soon went away. There was very unpleasant dampness on the floor. I wouldn't want to see what's under the carpet! Some people on tripadvisor warn about cockroaches and even mice. We didn't see any during our stay, even though we sometimes had food in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for LES!”
Reviews.Author: Racetrackrockabettie
Reviews.Content: When I saw the prices at Hotel 17, I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was a totally pleasant and relaxing experience. Granted, the rooms (ensuite) are the size of a walk-in closet, but everything was spotlessly clean- and I am very picky about that! The bathrooms were actually a decent size and they had shampoo, shoe shine cloths, and a hairdryer. The price cannot be beat by other hotels in the area, unless you want to stay at a hostel. They let us check our bags for the day after we left and we didn't pick them back up till 10pm, free of charge, which was nice. Also, there is a parking garage on 205 3rd ave & 18th that is only a block up and over, so we never had to drive once we parked. The best thing about this place is the location- just steps from Gramercy, Union Square, St Marks Place, and everything in the LES, including CBGBs. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jessica-l-Jones
Reviews.Content: With its great price and convenient location, Hotel 17 proved to be a good value in NYC. It's tucked in a residential neighborhood surrounded by quaint brownstones. It provided a nice break from the tourist throngs and yet remained within easy access of all major sites. One warning: even though my friend and I made our reservations online a month before and confirmed it the day before we arrived, they booked us into a queen room instead of the double (twins) we requested. They apologized and offered us a rollaway for the first night, and as compensation, upgraded us to an ensuite room. If you have a lot of luggage, it's a bit of a haul from the neareset subway station which is about three blocks away. However, the hotel really is in a great location. Union Square is not only the subway stop, but it is also home to a Sephora, a bunch of great cafes, and a Whole Foods. You're within easy walking distance of the Flatiron Building, the East Village, and CBGB's. By subway, Greenwich Village is only two stops away. The hotel itself appeared popular with Europeans, some of which we saw in the hallway waiting for the bathroom in their underwear. Our room was tiny but clean. We had one very warm day during our stay, and the air conditioner worked but was noisy. Though our towels were skimpy (and we had to request fresh ones), hot water was plentiful and water pressure was excellent. There aren't a lot of food options in the immediate vacinity, but Mumbles cafe is across the street, and next door to the hotel is a great deli with a friendly staff. A short walk to Union Square provides many more choices. To be sure, Hotel 17 was not the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in, but in a city as expensive as New York, it provided a lot of bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Catty82
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 4 night stay at Hotel 17 and I loved it. After reading all the reviews over the last year or so I was not sure what to expect, some people loved it some people hated it, but I was very happy to find it was the perfect hotel for me! PROS Location - the street was really lovely with your typical New York brownstones on one side. its only a couple of blocks from the lively Union square which is good for shopping and restaurants and has good subway links. Its also easy walking distance of the west and east villages and the flatiron building. There is the Gramercy Cafe across the street which is very convinient for breakfast and is not at all expensive. Rooms - even though the bathrooms are not en-suite the room was great. We had a twin room and it was really big, MUCH bigger than the room I had at the Hudson last year. The wall paper was fantastic, really old school, kinda 1930's. There was a large TV, alarm clock, telephone, chest of draws, a sink, two mirrors and a desk. The room was at the back of the hotel and on the 3rd floor and was very quiet. We NEVER had to wait for the bathroom in the morning, there were two on our corridor and we could always use one each at the same time. CONS Room Temperature - although i am very reluctant to say anything disparaging about he hotel I have to mention that the room was a little cold. I think they might have been a bit quick to turn down the heating for the summer. Once in bed though I didn't feel cold at all, and they gave my sister an extra blanket which was very warm. All in all a fab hotel at a great price, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since this was one of the cheapest hotels I could find in NYC I was wary about staying here. However, other traveler’s had good experiences so I decided to check it out. Overall, the experience was great. The hotel had a lot of “character” but in a good way. I found the rooms and bathrooms clean. It was also nice being able to leave luggage before and after check-in. The hotel is in a great part of town. There are a lot of restaurants and shops nearby. There is also a major subway stop a few blocks away. I would recommend this hotel to the budget traveler who is looking for an unique, quirky yet affordable NYC experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At first I was skeptical about staying at Hotel 17, due to mixed reviews on this site. Me and two girlfriends stayed there for 8 nights, and it was perfect. The location is perfect, especially for the price...YOU CANT BEAT IT! The rooms are small, but if you get a triple room, there is more space. The bathrooms were always spotless and clean, never had a problem getting one that was free, anytime of the day. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There is no curfew, can come in as late as you want. Taxis come down the street all the time, so you have no problem catching one. We used cabs most of our trip, and it never cost us more than 6-10 dollars one way due to our location. I will definitely be staying at Hotel 17 on my next trip to NY...you simply cannot beat it!

Reviews.Title: “This place was perfect..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and some friends stayed here for 3 days and where very pleased. We searched everywhere online for decent, affordable hotels. Im so glad we didnt stay at this other hotel(forget the name) where we actually booked, AND CALLED THEM A WEEK BEFORE TO CONFIRM AND THEY HAD CLOSED DOWN. Im so glad we found Hotel 17. At first we thought it would be a problem woth sharing bathrooms and all but everytime any one of us went to shower it was all ways dry and clean inside all of them. Besides the fact the hallways and elevator where confined, this is definelty the hotel I will be booking into on the next trip to New York. The price was great and there service was too....Good Job Hotel 17

Reviews.Title: “Hell of a deal.”
Reviews.Author: LAJET
Reviews.Content: 99 bucks for a safe clean, comfortable room in NYC? Can't beat it. Sure you have to share a bathroom, but it's clean as hell, and the place was generally quiet. On a budget - you could do worse. Great safe location too,

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: kattis77
Reviews.Content: Two of my friends and I stayed at hotel 17 for five nights. I expected it to be pretty bad considering the low price, but I was really surprised to see that it was really good. The condition of the room was ok. You have to share bathroom but they are clean and there are plenty of them so there's no queing to the shower in the mornings. So I would say that hotel 17 is a great place to stay if you want a clean and nice place at reasonable cost. The neighbourhood is safe and the Herald Sq subway station is nearby so it is really convenient. While you are staying in the neighbourhood, go to the really nice bar/restaurant, Mumbles, just nearby. They serve excellent pasta and the staff is really friendly!

Reviews.Title: “good deal for the dollar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel 17 twice now and will in the future. Location is tops, great n'hood with lots of good places to eat around the corner. My room was good, basic if you will. Sheets and blanket had seen better times, though. Not all single rooms have a sink, so ask for one. Staff was very friendly and helpful. As in most cheap hotels, there were a few 'weird' guests, I believe of the `permanent' variety, but I think they are all located in their own wing. Hotel 17 is a good deal for the young at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 is excellent value for a Manhattan hotel. The rooms are small and fairly basic but it has plenty of character and is kept spotlessly clean. The staff members are extremely polite, discreet and helpful. Finally, the location is second to none. I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Verytallbecca
Reviews.Content: Small room, but clean and comfortable, fine to come home to after a day's sightseeing. The shared bathroom across the hall was spotless, and I never found myself having to wait for my turn to use it! Really not a glamourous option, but at such a great price I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “what a HAPPY new year!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the hotel over the New Year's holiday and we couldn't of been happier! Very freindly and helpful staff. The rooms and bathrooms were always clean and tidy. We were pleased with the area of the hotel, very nice area. And it was a treat being so close to Times Square, the center of attention for the New Year. 3 blocks, one subway and we were there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, friendly, place to stay and I want to sincerely thank the staff at Hotel 17 for making our New Year's a very pleasant and joyful occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas at Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel 17 several times, but this time, fleas ate me for dinner. I have bites all over my neck and arms. Maybe they're in the pillows. I hope they can fix the problem. Some of the rooms look OK, others are bad news. Choose carefully

Reviews.Title: “Some ups and downs at Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 is in a perfect locale, a relatively quiet East Village street near Stuyvesant Square, Grammercy Park, Union Square, the Village - it was the best "walk-to" location for our needs. But there was a problem with cockroaches if anything resembling food was in the room. There is no fridge or coffee maker, so we brought in bottles of juice, and had some visitors as a result. As they say, you get what you pay for. (Online $99 per night, over the phone $110.) The architecture of the hotel was a big plus, and our room was large (unlike our experience at another hotel, where you walk in the door and your knees hit the bed.) The hotel was well populated by a largely younger international crowd. There were smoking and nonsmoking wings, clean communal baths and no problem for us getting in to them whenever we needed to. There was also some dampness to the carpet in the room that made me uneasy. So as long as there is no food in the room - it's bearable. But next time, I think I'll take a step up in price and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel 17 is located in a beautiful, safe, residential neighborhood very near Union Square. Though visiting from the backwoods of Florida-I actually allowed my 17 year old twin girls to explore the neighborhood alone (even at night). The Hotel itself is beautiful-the shared bathrooms some how always clean. But the management-I still cannot believe the way I was treated- when I complained that a sink in the room had leaked during the night, and had soaked my daughters backpack and camera within-. I was instantly told this when I politely complanied re: the leak-"your daughter should not have left her bag on the floor" Yes-that is a quote. Although two plumbers were sent up quickly(the sink had obviously leaked and leaked many times before)-We were told that a leak to the floor was an impossibility due to the configuration of the plumbing-I even offered to call my plumber husband in Florida. We stayed in our room-and eventually my own girls figured out what they could not-the water was able to make it to the floor because the faucet base itself was where the mysterious leak was occuring-pooling about the sink and then spiling over the sides onto the floor-dashing their theory that we had left the water running all night(inches from my head) with a towel left in the sink. We were kind enough to inform them upon checkout.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: JuneTL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find! We chose it for its price and location. The hotel is located on a quiet street in a nice neighbourhood. It is a 10 minute walk to the subway at Union Square. The hotel has been nicely refurbished giving it the feel of a boutique hotel/pensione - cosy, dark wood, solid doors etc. The room was on the small side but adequate for our needs. Who goes to New York to spend much time in their rooms? We were concerned about the shared bathroom aspect of this hotel but this was not a problem at all. About 11 rooms share two bathrooms on each side of each floor. The bathrooms were very clean. We did not see anyone else on the way to the bathrooms. (We wondered where everyone was?) The minuses of this hotel? The room lighting could be better, the tap of the in-room sink and the air conditioner was noisy. Also, the bed was so new that it squeaked! (Honeymooners be aware!) Minor matters when you consider the convenience of being in Manhattan for the room price. We'll definitely stay here when we next come back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “nice for the price !”
Reviews.Author: gabelou75
Reviews.Content: we stay 8 days in this hotel during may 2005. It was a nice plan for the price. It s a very clean place. This hotel is easy to visit new york a lot of nice street are just near the hotel. The only problem is the noise when you are in the room inside the hotel. Some room are so noisy .... You must ask to the front desk to change your room. Not perfect but a reaal good plan in new york .

Reviews.Title: “Fun and friendly place !”
Reviews.Author: Spatzl
Reviews.Content: First off - the rating is in terms of value for money. For this price Hotel 17 beats everything. Although the bathroom was shared, it was always clean and smelled of bleach (which is my eyes is good if your sharing it with other people). The room was very small but cosy - and who wants to sit in the hotel room in NYC anyway ?? It had fresh soap, towels, hair dryer, TV and air conditioning (which was loud but good). The employees were extremely friendly once you show them that your friendly too. I always laugh at the remarks some people make in these reviews about how some of the staff is unfriendly - maybe if you give them a smile, they'll smile back ??? That's how it was with us anyway. Very helpful, friendly and fun ! The Hotel is situated in a great area (about 10 min walk to Washington square) and 3 min to the subway. I can only recommend this Hotel. Oh and great personalities seem to live there - some pretty funky people ! Thanks for a great time Hotel 17

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - Good value for money in NY”
Reviews.Author: mgf384
Reviews.Content: I Just come back from NY and stayed 5 days at the hotel 17 (room 107) I was not expecting anything special about this budget hotel in the heart of Manhattan. I really have to say that my experience has been very good and my stay very enjoyable : Courteous staff, hotel really clean, rooms correctly decorated and the location could not be better... You come out of the hotel on a nice residential street which take you in 3 minutes to Union Square.. Soho, Little Italy are all at reasonable walkable distance. Unless you fancy staying in NY in a luxurious hotel - Hotel 17 is a nice play to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed from 19 - 22 of August. We had read the reviews here and made our decision based on that. We were not dissappointed. The room was clean and suited our purpose. The bathrooms were equally clean, not to say spotless, and we never found them to be all occupied at once. The staff was also more friendly and helpful than what we were expecting ;) The location is great! Quiet little street, with the excellent Grammercy Cafe for breakfast nearby. Easy walking distance to subway and to interesting surrounding areas. Where I will stay the next time is a no-brainer.... This place does it for me.

Reviews.Title: “New York's finest?!”
Reviews.Author: Doxiegal
Reviews.Content: My daughter, 16 and myself have just returned from a 6 night stay in New York City. Wanting to experience more than just one hotel we decide to stay at Hotel 17, me mostly for the price, her for info she had read in books and such. Our first night was at Portland Square in the Theatre District, ok, no thrills but our own bathroom, I figured it was going to be the best of the three, I was wrong! When we arrived at Hotel 17 we instantly fell in love, the quiet little street seemed quaint and personal, not oozing tourisim. The lobby is very "neat" in all aspects of the word and we actually felt like we were boarding a ride on Disney's Tower of Terror. The hotel was very European looking I guess with dark wood, thick trim and old mirrors, it was wonderfully restored. Our room looked very similar with two comfy beds, I think they were comfy but when you are in New York you are so tired at bed that anything would feel good! The bathrooms were down the hall, I think 10 rooms shared two bathrooms, never did we have to wait or even see another person, super clean, no signs of anyone showering, no smell, this totally changed my views of shared bathrooms as I was dreading this part of the trip but this experience changed my mind. All in all great experience. My daughter has stayed at hostels before and said this was no hostel! I would reccomend it to anyone. The we went to Chealsea Star....read that review!

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: neib12
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 17 is defintely an experience! For the price ($79/night), it's a great value: the location is superb, with easy access to Union Square, Greenwich Village and Gramercy Park. The desk staff is friendly and helpful. My single was tiny and a bit dingey, but I think it was pretty clean. The extremely clean bathroom was down the hall. Amenities are spartan: the in-room TV is small, the towels almost worthless and the ice machine is downstairs. The walls are thin enough that a neighbor complained when I shut my door too loudly. But the cost and location and general condition of the room can't be beat. If you want a safe, cheap hotel in NY, especially if you're traveling alone, this is definitely worth checking out!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was not a hostel like I supposed, but a European-style hotel with the bathrooms in the hallway. This was fine since they were very well kept and only one person at a time could enter, so I had total privacy. For only $75 per night it was an amazing deal. My bed was larger than a regular twin, I was on the 6th floor with a great view, and I had an air conditioner. Also, I was provided with free soaps, shampoo, and even body lotion (it is SO dry in the summer). If you want the maid to come you just put your sign on the knob of your door. I had fresh towels and sheets everyday. I liked the wallpaper, and I asked for a new bedspread, because mine had some light stains, and they brought a beautiful clean one right up, and it even matched the retro wallpaper! Next time I am in NYC, I would like to stay at the Hotel 31, a sister establishment, which is closer to Broadway, but I am sure it will be identical to Hotel 17. GREAT PLACE. GREAT DEAL. P.S. Utilize the Super Shuttle service. Ask the very friendly and helpful deskstaff for more info.

Reviews.Title: “I'LL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, you can't beat the price. If you're young and on a budget like myself, it's worth every penny. You pay for location and nothing else. Union Square is a short walk. What they lack in amenities, details, and service, their location and low traffic make up for. I really don't know many things they offer besides a room and a toilet. But it reminded me of dorm life. Half of a floor shares a couple of small bathrooms, but I never ran into anyone on the way to the john, nor did I ever have to wait. I wondered where they other guests were and was assured that they were around. The room was clean. No rats, no mice. I didn't even notice a smell. It wa dark in an old mansion kinda way. Call it ambiance. I never took the elevator. The bed wasn't great, but it was fine. More blankets would have been nice. The AC worked well. No view outside the window, but I didn't need one. THey don't have wireless internet, but someone close did...lol. Having to buzz in or swipe after a certain time was a hassle. And after drinking too much one night, a friend brought me back. When he came in, they made us pay for a third person spending the night. It was about $10, I think. Check out was easy and they had no problem keeping our bags for awhile as we walked the city before catching a flight. All in all, it's a no frills roof over your head in Manhattan that you can actually afford.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 17- For the Young at Heart & Adventurists!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend took a trip to NY for my college Grad and Hotel 17 was one of best memories of the trip! I was a lil hesitant of staying in a hotel with shared bathrooms, not to mention a starring role in a Woody Allen movie entitled, Manhattan Murder Mystery :) but it turned out to be a great place for the price. There are 4 bathrooms per floor- there was ALWAYS one available and they were pretty clean- (wear flip flops though) we had a bedroom with two twin bed but I think most only have a double. The room was spacious and interesting and the sink in the room was helpful. Keep in mind a couple things, the hallways and hotel in general smells pretty smoky- if you can't deal w/ that I would not recommend it. Also, the place is older so don't be surprised if you open a drawer and the handle falls off! The hotel is also in a good location but a 15 min subway ride to the times square are, which is not bad at all if you can figure out the subway system. There is typically a young crowd, I would recommend this place if you are open-minded, adventurous and you want a cheap sage place to stay in NY. Just me willing to try something new and don't let the lil thing bother you and it'll be a great experience, HAVE FUN!!! PS- Raymond at the front desk rocks!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: scotty82
Reviews.Content: 1 week in may 2005 Hotel 17 was one of those hotels that we werent to sure what it was going to be like, we found it in the lonely planet book of the usa and booked it over the internet. And I really liked it, for that price we were a little wary about what it would be like, if you dont mind sharing a toilet and shower with another few rooms, which are cleaned every day and kept clean, then you'll enjoy it. we were only looking for a room to sleep in while in new york because the rest of the time we were out exploring, if you were just after a bed to sleep in then this is your place, great location as well, easy walking to the subway and a nice neighbourhood. very simple, clean, but comfortable :)

Reviews.Title: “Too small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are too small. Front office staff is ok but not too friendly. If you don't want to spend much time in the hotel , then it is fine. I moved from Murray hill suites for 2 days stay in this hotel and their is no comparison, though the price was same. Murray hill suites on 29th street is the best; more roomy and clean. Shared bathroom is another things you might want to consider before staying here. This is not a good hotel for couples or family. Students or singles may like it.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic, no-frills, quiet and marvelous”
Reviews.Author: xena936
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, eclectic, no-frills, inexpensive hotel, I can't recommend Hotel 17 highly enough. We stayed for a week in mid-May, 2005. The double size bed was very comfortable for me (age 58) and my husband (age 60) who has permanent back and hip pains. It was quiet and the bathrooms shared were kept clean throughout the day. The room was clean and had plenty of space to unpack for a week's stay. I enjoyed the European service and only had our room made up when we wanted trash emptied or new towels. Staff was very helpful on our questions about the local restaurants. The one elevator is a bit slow, but then who's in a hurry! We took the stairs down and the elevator up! A wonderful city park is just across the street. The neighborhood is lovely and we took nearby subway to all sections of Manhatten. The longest it took to get anywhere was above Central Park which took 30 minutes with a couple transfers. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at Hotel 17 again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the first time for us in NYC. We loved this little hotel We stayed on the 8th floor. The bathroom was very clean at all times. Only one time I had to wait for the bathroom. The hotel is small and old, but really, it is very nice. For the price you can't do better. I paid $75/night and I was right in the center of Manhattan. The neighborhood is very nice and I felt safe at all times. The subway station is two blocks away. The satff was very helpful and nice. Recommendation: If you let the hotel call a limo services (set fee $40) they are probably charging you $10 extra, so if possible call the limo service yourself or just take one of the yellow cabs. We will defenitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin!!”
Reviews.Author: Sim0nJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location for us, easy walking distance of Times Square and The Village, best of both worlds really. Although I was weary of having shared bathroom it was never an issue, there was a sink in the room for shaving etc, and the bathroom always seemed to be just cleaned. The staff weren't overly friendly but thats just the way I like it, there when you need them but not pushy. As long as you remember this is a budget hotel you won't be disappointed. Overall, one of the better hotels in New York I have stayed in and I would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK value but.....”
Reviews.Author: COOMBSY
Reviews.Content: Yes it's relatively cheap and the locations great for the East Village and Soho, but we had pigeons nesting on our air conditioner which is fine if you want to get up when they do ie. 5am, but not so good if you want to sleep any later than that. I couldn't reach them due to mosquito netting on the window, the staff said they'd move the nest. I stayed 4 nights and asked each day, they did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Clean, and Reasonable with European Influence”
Reviews.Author: ketagyrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great bargain in expensive New York and has all the conveniences that any tourist would need while exploring this energetic city. I booked a triple at the hotel a week before our arrival at $99 with tax midweek. It was easy to find, just a couple blocks away from Union Square. The hotel was small overall, but the staff was nice and helpful. The room was adequate, it contained a double and a single, windows with a view of a brick wall, a old television and sink. The rooms here have no in-room bathrooms, only shared bathrooms in the hallway which remind me of the hotels found in London. I guess it is very common for older cities to have hotels with shared bathrooms. The hotel itself was very clean, including the rooms and bathrooms. Overnight, very little noise was heard except for the pigeons roosting on our window in the morning. The beds were firm and comfortable, not springy or loud. I showered late in the morning, and instead of a used bathroom as I expected, it was sparkling clean and completely dry. I guess the staff must clean the bathrooms thoroughly after each use, which I thought was amazing. Check out was a little slow, the hotel desk was very busy from people checking out and in. They were kind enough to hold our luggage for the day after we checked out. Overall, this hotel was a good experience. It was definitely worth more than it's price considering New York standards. I would much rather stay here than any other glitzy hotel because you get the same amenities but with some historical touches. A hotel room in New York should only be used for sleep. Who has time to spend in a hotel room when they should be out exploring the great city?!

Reviews.Title: “Trying to set the record straight!”
Reviews.Author: KINGKONG3
Reviews.Content: When I was trying to decide whether to stay here I read many conflicting reviews, now I have stayed here I thought i'd try and put a balanced review of this hotel up. I think the bottom line is that so long as you know what to expect, this is a nice little hotel. Firstly the location is fantastic, a very friendly and quiet (for NYC!) area, which is only about 4 blocks from Union Square, which is a major subway station - making it very easy to get around. The hotel is a bit dark, the bathrooms are shared, and the walls are fairly thin. That said, I wasn't kept awake by other people and the bathrooms were immaculate. Our room wasn't that big, but then let's face it - you're in the big apple, you're not there to sit in your hotel! I'd reccomend this hotel on it's price and location. If you're in my situation (twentysomething on a budget with a few days to explore new york) then you can't go wrong. Maybe if you're a bit older, used to ensuite bathrooms and a few more creature comforts there are bound to be better places. Oh, and incidentally - we did have a midnight visit from a mouse, so if that freaks you out you might like to reconsider. Serves us right for leaving a chocolate bar out I suppose! As i'm writing this, I might also reccommend a small deli on East 17 St. towards Union square that supplied us with food for many a cheap but delicious picnic. It was called Connelly and Corbett, and is well worth looking up.

Reviews.Title: “everything but front desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great place !! clean, great location, confortable, quiet... the staff was ok, Rosa the maid was very nice and all the others in floor service. The reception awful, in any other Hotel these guys would be fired at once. No welcome, no info, no help..nothing...but then we realised that is a common attitude in many touristic places in NY (empire state staff is a good example). if you hide yourself as you cross the reception this is a great place to rest in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal around - clean, too!”
Reviews.Author: demoizelle
Reviews.Content: Having read the variety of comments on the site, I held my breath and crossed my fingers as we ascended the stairs to Hotel 17. First, we had a very late check in (nearly midnite) which was absolutely no problem at all. We were then asked if was OK if they moved us from our original room (w/a shared bath) to a one with a private bath for the same price. Fine with us! The room was tiny but it was cozy and spotless. The bathroom gleamed! How many NY bathrooms can you say that about? The location couldn't be better - you can stumble to a show at Irving Plaza, get some food at the Gramercy Cafe and grab a coffee on Irving Place (in no particular order). We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate — charming and quiet in a nice area!”
Reviews.Author: hjd18
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about Hotel 17. As a first-time New York tourist, I was a little worried about staying in such an inexpensive hotel. I expected filthy bathrooms, roaches and stained carpet — as a best case scenario. From the moment I spotted the awning of the hotel on 17th Street, I felt comfortable, welcomed. The front desk staff — a man named Raymond — was friendly and accomodating from the beginning — he even gave me a larger room than the one I had originally booked — at no additional charge! The elevators were — as many have noted — incredibly slow. However, I just hoofed it up the stairs, which was always quicker in cases where luggage wasn't involved. My single room, which included a full size bed, night table, sink, cable television and desk, was cozy and more than sufficient. The bed was incredibly comfy, the lighting was warm and soft and the carpet was clean. Maid service was prompt and offered only on request, which was major benefit on mornings I needed to sleep in. The hotel is not your typical institutional, boring Days Inn. It's quite charming with lots of dark wood trim, antique wallpaper and light fixtures. Nonetheless, it's obvious improvements have been made in areas where the comfort of the hotel is concerned. The bathrooms (4 on each floor) were all modern, clean and had excellent water pressure. I never once had to wait for the shower and was shocked to find the bathrooms still spotless after a morning filled with showering guests. There must be a maid hiding in a closet up there! Perhaps the most impressive aspect of the hotel is the part of town in which it is located. Situated on a quiet street, three blocks from Union Square (and a major subway station), Hotel 17 is the perfect place to escape after a tiring day of running around the city. The area is residential (flanked by lots of neat brownstones and row houses), but offers plenty of cafes, shops and even a theater. Again, I can't say enough about this hotel. Even if I could afford a more expensive place, I'd still return to Hotel 17. My stay there was one of the most enjoyable aspects of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's basic, but it's clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Scottish-Biker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks in March 05 whilst visiting NYC - what I will say is the reviews are pretty accurate, it's a basic hotel with a gloomy feeling about the place - it IS very, very clean though which to me, is a must! The staff are pretty dry, but that's NYC!!!! The shared bathrooms are constantly cleaned and in my two week visit, I only had one experience of having to wait for a shower - I thought that was pretty good. I had a single room on the ground floor which done the job just fine, you have your own tv and a comfy bed - again the room is quite dull but that didn't bother me too much. I read one of the other reviews and whilst I can't comment about the rat experience, I will tell you about mine. It is an old building (like others in Manhattan), so obviously has some mice in the building - I did see one when I was staying, but only because I had some food in my room, once I ditched that, I never seen or heard of one again. I'm not sure it was a rat the other customer seen, it was more likely a mouse. If you're looking for a cheap and comfortablel place to stay, then this is for you as the area is absolutely fantastic - right in the middle of the Gramercy district which means you are minutes away from the action of the East Village (4 short blocks) and Union Square (4 blocks) - Greenwhich village is about 15 mins walk away - the Gramercy Cafe is a must for breakfast, lunch and dinner! Great food! I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “basic but fine”
Reviews.Author: cheemulover
Reviews.Content: i paid £40 a night plus tax for 7 nights - given the mixed reviews i expected something basic, and it is - i had a single room which was just a bed, desk, mirror and a hangar rail for clothes (plus a tv and radio) - no sink, though i think most rooms had them since i saw them when i happened to pass by other rooms. The shared batthrooms were always claen and i never waited once in 7 days. some rooms dont get much natural light, and it gets stuffy, but i literally only slept here - getting back early monring, waking up and going out. for this purpose it is fine. didnt really see any other guests, though it was clearly full. towels were bit small i guess, but they had new ones every day. great location - 3 blocks from union square which is a cool area interms of bars etc - i was in new york few months before and was staying round times square - this area is much more fun. seen rats/mice mentioned on here - i didnt see any during my week, though i did see some rat/mice poison in my room under the desks so i guess they have them from time to time, though i doubt this is unusual in old buildings in new york, as it is in london. if they have them i would rather see that they are trying to do something about it than just leaving it!! you wont get private rooms much cheaper than this in new york, i would stay here again, though i imagine in summer it would be a little unbrearable with the heat. Price and location make up for any reservations however for me.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: irishinil
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying the weekend at Hotel 17 and I have to say it was much better than I expected! Rooms & bathrooms were clean and the location was 3 blocks from the Union St 4,5,6 Subway. Our room was lovely and warm and I found the staff to be helpful and friendly (they looked after our bags on the Sunday). They also rang a car to bring my friends to JFK for a flat fee of $45. Only downside was there was just one elevator which took ages to come, the towels they give you are tiny and the bathrooms were quite busy on the day of check out. Stay away from the Gramercy Cafe which is 1 block away - we ate the most tasteless food I have ever tasted. It was so bland. If you are on a budget you could not pick a better location.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for the price, but rats!”
Reviews.Author: psylocke
Reviews.Content: its difficult to find a hotel in nyc with your own bathroom unless you are willing to pay 200$ US per night. this place was at a good price considering this. We loved the neighbourhood, and found the shared bathrooms very clean, and they were cleaned more than once a day. My only problem was on the third night of our stay, we were awoken by a small rat in my luggage looking for my food. We chased him out the door. they immediately sent someone up to set traps, and the next day moved us into a room on the top floor where there "were no rats" We did not get any compensation for lost sleep....but, we had no further problems. I would suggest not keeping food in your room. I know that Manhattan has a problem with rats, we saw them in the subway, but some compensation would have been nice. If you book a room here, make sure you get the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading positive reviews about Hotel 17, I booked it for a long weekend in NYC. However, be aware that most rooms have shared bathroom facilities and the service there is truly awful. I was not told there wouldn't be a bathroom in the room, and the bathroom down the hall had hair in the drain and some guy down the hall was puking in it all night long. The staff was not accomodating at all, and basically rude. They can't even change your reservation at the front desk- only online. Just be sure you know what you're paying for- even though it is only worth about $30 a night, like most hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for cool guys”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, bear in mind that it is a budget hotel very well located in NY. The hotel and the service has nothing to do with 3/4 stars modern hotels. I've booked a double room for 3 nights through Expedia. When I arrived, as I was alone, I was given a single room. The clerk told me "I've turned away lots of customers today, we are full, sorry" (be lucky to have a room anyway). This room was very small (see photo) but I get a double room for the next 2 nights (without compensation for the first night of course). The double room is far more comfortable than the single. This hotel is very well located, you have 3 metro lines nearby, among them the green line (4,5,6) which runs manhattan from north to south. I find the room very calm and the bed was good, I've slept well (with earplugs). The bathrooms are very clean, and are cleaned regularly, even at night. I remember I have noticed someone had taken a shower at 10pm and the bathroom was clean again at 5am. What you might not like is the ambiance. The hotel is very dark. The lobby is in fact a corridor and the front desk is above you, you feel a little bit miserable as a first impression. There are no paintings or posters on the walls, no decoration, rooms and corridors are nude and quite old. So, if you expect or like modern hotels, you will be disappointed and go to an hotel which cost at least twice the price. If you are cool, you don't mind sharing a clean bathroom and you don't mind a kind of gloomy atmosphere due to lack of decoration and light this is an hotel for your small budget. They keep your luggage for free if you leave after 12am.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this Dump”
Reviews.Author: DayTripperLDN
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Hotel17 for 1 week after reading some positive review and reading that Woody Allen used it as location for one of his movies. I really do not understand all the people giving high ratings to this place. The room that they gave me was very small and dirty, the bed in very poor conditions and the AC inefficient.The room was also very noisy. I asked to change the room and the very unpleasent staff, after a long and animated discussion, "threw" me the keys of 3 other rooms and saying that i was free to choose the best...they didn't come with me to show the rooms. I saw all the rooms and they where really horrible, worse than the one they gave me. I was obliged to stay for the night because it was very late and I shared my room and the bathroom with few NY size COCKROACHES! The next morning I tried then to leave and cancel my booking but my card had been already charged and they refused to give me back my money. I stayed i more nite and then I left the hotel even if i payed for the week. AVOID THIS PLACE !

Reviews.Title: “nice, cosy and clean place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there in feb 2005 with my two children and was under the impression we would get a room with three single beds. Instead, I had to share a double bed with my daughter and my son had a single. Three single beds would have been more comfortable. We also had a mouse in our room but it didn't do any harm. The window didn't shut well, so at night the wind blew a loud and cold draft through the room. All in all we had a very pleasant stay at the Hotel 17. It is a lovely and cosy place with a lot of style in an excellent location! It is quiet and the bathrooms are very clean! We'd love to come back some time!

Reviews.Title: “No Problem”
Reviews.Author: stlnomad
Reviews.Content: Please don't let anyone talk you out of booking a room at Hotel 17. I found the service to be more than adequate, and you certainly can't beat the price. As an example of the service: I found that one of the toilets was overflowing, and the front desk had the problem resolved IMMEDIATELY. Sure, the rooms are small, and the bathrooms are shared, but 1) you're in NYC to get out, not to stare at your furniture and 2) except for that one aforementioned time, I never had a problem with the bathroom. So if you're looking for a centrally located place to hang your hat (or cap), at $75 a night, and you love NYC, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DON'T RISK IT! Pay a little more and go with a reputable place that has good business ethics and customer service. These guys will make you feel like your business means nothing to them. We showed up at Hotel 17 with all our bags in hand and weary after a full days worth of travel from CA. And, what did we find out? Hotel 17 had overbooked us and our room which had been reserved 3 months prior and then double-checked 1 month prior to arrival, was NOT available. Huh?! How much in advance do you have to book a room here?! After we got the bad news, Hotel 17 then called around and got us a place somewhere else, promising us that the price we were quoted at Hotel 17 would be honored at the new place. Boy, were we snowed on that one. We ended up having to shell out an additional $100 at the new place. The new place basically said that just because Hotel 17 gave them the business does not mean that they will honor the price we were initially quoted. At one point during the conversation with the person at Hotel 17, he said, well if you don't like it, then that's too bad and you can go somewhere else. So, our first time in NY after doing as much preparation as possible, and it's possible that we won't have a place to stay!? To say that they put us between a rock and a hard place would be putting it mildly. PLEASE, do not travel across the country and be at the mercy of these guys. I can tell you that the front area where you check in is very small, dimly lit and smelt musty. And as far as the workers, think of those foreigners running 7Eleven's or QuickMart and there you have it. Rush, rush, rush, and absolutely NO customer service. (And this wasn't just a NY thing. It was just a plain rude thing.)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much great!”
Reviews.Author: berly57
