Reviews.Content: My grown-up daughter and I were planning on a day trip to NYC. At last minute booked a room here. Was a little hesitant with the shared bathroom thing, but decided what the hell. It was great! Great neighborhood -- out of the city -- but certainly very accessible to public transportation. The room we had (411) was bigger than the room we had last year at a "name-brand" hotel. Shared bathroom was a first for me. Bathroom was absolutely spotless. When we first checked in three young women were at the desk complaining that they wanted to change their mattresses because it was like sleeping on wood. I can tell you both my daughter and I had a perfect night's sleep. Would definitely recommend this to people who do not need all the amenities that go with the higher-end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great for Your Budget!”
Reviews.Author: chicagotravelgirl
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very European in feel. The rooms are small and the decor is a bit bare. However, the rooms are bigger than the much more expensive Hudson Hotel. You have a brand new sink in your room. There are several very new, very clean bathrooms per floor that you share with the other guests. Never once did we have a problem getting into the bathroom. They clean the bathrooms every few hours. The doors on the bathrooms are a bit noisy so the first night I woke up every time someone went to the bathroom. However, that was the only noise we encountered and I got used to it quick - maybe ask for a room on one of the ends. We were right across from one of the bathrooms. Otherwise, it was quiet and clean. You can't beat the location. You are a few blocks from Union Square and very close to the trains. You can get anywhere in Manhatten quick! There are also some great restaurants nearby. We had great sushi in the basement of Washington Irving's house right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “17 stars for that rate!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Let's keep it a secret, okay? Very clean, nice clientele & staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Bristolawyer
Reviews.Content: Like some others I read the (few) negative reviews of this hotel and was a little apprehensive. However in the event I was very pleased. Basic, yes. Small, yes. Service a little grumpy (but satisfactory for all that). Room tiny but with a washbasin. Bathrooms shared but I never saw another guest except those waiting for taxis in the lobby. The location is great. There is an old downtown atmosphere as opposed to the modern concrete clone hotels in the theatre district. But above all it is the value for money that makes Hotel 17 such a useful find for people visiting NYC on their own money. Definitely a place worth remembering until I win the lottery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at Hotel 17 for two nights from Oct. 30th 2004. We had stayed the first four nights at the Chelsea Inn and switched because the Inn was not available for our last two nights. We loved the very cozy Chelsea Inn, so sure enough, we were curious how the Hotel 17 would be. To be honest, we don't really have anything big to complain but some smaller things. The hotel has rooms on 8 floors, we stayed on the 3rd with a view on the wall of the building next door. Try to get a room on a higher floor, the hotel has an elevator. The room was quite big, with two beds, tv, phone and a sink. Unfortunately there was not much where to put our clothes. Just a smallish chest of drawers and no closet, but a kind of a wardrobe with just four hangers. It was very clean, also the shared bathrooms, that are really new and nice. There is about twelve rooms that share 2 bathrooms, so in "rush-hour" times you often have to wait to use them. The location of the hotel is great, close to Union Square and the East Village with all its bars and restaurants. The only thing that we really didn't like was that it was icecold in our room. We asked at the reception and they told us the heating would be turned on at night, but it wasn't. To their defense, they told us if we wanted, they could give us a little heater, but we came home quite late at night and didn't want to bother them. On the day of our departure, we were able to store our luggage in an extra room the entire day, which was really great.

Reviews.Title: “Loves It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The gals and I get together in NYC every year for Halloween and we always stay here because it's the best. The location rocks (you can usually spot a celeb or two walking in the hood) and it's just around the corner from the best sushi restaurant (Choshi) on Irving at 19th. Ramon at the front desk is a total sweet heart and will do whatever he can to make sure you have a great stay. Who doesn't love a little European charm in a hotel especially in a big North American city? LOVES IT double extra large size.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited alone NY for 15 days in October 2004. Having read all the reviews here I decided to go for hotel 17. Excellent central location, close at the trendy Union sq., could walk all over Manhattan, to Chinatown up to Central Park, very safe area, very clean bathrooms. To make clear to all, the bathrooms are like a house bath, meaning that they turn to private bathrooms when you lock i.e. like being at airplane bathrooms, not like Youth Hostels. On the 12th night, I had a small adventure there when I cought a little harmless mouse eating my peanut butter cups (chocolate bar by Herseys). I had to cover the hole that the mouse entered, by myself, since the reception guy who supposed to come to fix the problem, after my call, simply did not show up! But to justify the "mouse case" in one other time I was served amazingly fast by the reception guy. New York is very impressive city and there are hundreds of things to do there alone. You can find the best, biggest chinese food too! With plenty of walking you can see NY in 12 days. A last tip: if yu want your room prepared by the maid just let her know by twisting the card hanging from the door from the side "do not disturb me"to the "please make my room". Otherwise...they forget you. Have a nice trip to all. Enjoyed NY a lot and will go again shortly. Kisses

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this place seemed pretty positive, but still, I wasn't quite sure what to expect. Very pleasantly surprised. Extra clean bathrooms, clean rooms, quiet, safe, good location, friendly staff. For the money, I think this hotel gets it right. Obviously it not luxury, but if you're reading about hotels like this, you're not seraching for luxury, right? The lobby, halls and bathrooms have recently been remodeled so the place definitely has a very cute, quaint feel. The rooms are a little worn, but nothing to complain about. The bathrooms are shared, but my room had a sink in it which definitely makes things easier. The hotel was pretty much sold out while I was there but I never saw too many people or heard much noise. Until I win the lottery, I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel 17”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 17, September 2004, for 7 nights, the rooms were clean and a reasonable size, the shared bathroom was not a problem as there were two in close proximity and were very clean. The staff were very friendly and most helpful, it was a two miinute walk to Union Square, and very close to the east and west village, a nice part of NY. Would definitely stay there again it was very cheap compared to other hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: TaniaVioleta
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at this hotel. I have to say it was nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget and planning to visit NYC. The bathrooms were kept cleaned and our room was a good size. The staff was nice and friendly. I would stay there again. I don't have any complains. The experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single from June 6-9. The room was small, but it was only neede for sleeping. No problem with shared bathroom. The place was clean and nicely decorated. Clean place. Great location. Can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This budget property is a fine value for NYC. The small rooms are OK for someone who doesn't want to spend (or doesn't have) a lot of money for accommodations. (I would rather spend my money on food or shopping.) The furnishings were worn but adequate. The shared bath was convenient and clean. The location is a few blocks from Union Square, a center for all sorts of urban activities and a crossroads for several subway lines--so the rest of Manhattan is easily accessible. Although my tiny room did not have an air conditioner--I believe most do--that may be something to inquire about. It wasn't a big deal in May but may be an issue in August. With the money I saved I bought a pair of really cool shoes at Barney's!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal! Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: nanler
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a short trip to NYC. I picked this hotel based on other reviews and the fact that it is the cheapest I could find in the East Village that had decent reviews. And we LOVED it! It's so centrally located for the East and West Villages and Lower East End. We were pretty much able to walk everywhere we wanted (but we do walk alot, keep that in mind). It's also in a safe and quiet location. The price is incredible, the shared bathrooms were very clean, and the whole place has a kind of Victorian (almost creepy, but in a good way!) vibe. Sure, the furnishings aren't new, but we absolutely loved the crown moldings and (unworkable) fireplace in the rooms. The AC worked well, we heard NOTHING from the neighbors, and the staff were friendly and helpful. We went to NYC to see some shows in the indie East Village and couldn't have been happier with this place. Please note that we are young and into music.....so this may affect your decision on whether or not to stay here!
